Title: Financial Controller
Description:
JOB TITLE:
Financial Controller
COMPANY NAME:
Neveah Limited
LOCATION:
Mowe, Ogun [Lagos–Ibadan Expressway]
EMPLOYMENT TYPE:
Full-time
DEPARTMENT/UNIT:
Finance and Accounts
DIRECTLY REPORTS TO:
Chief Financial Officer (CFO) / Managing Director
DIRECT REPORT:
Cost Accountant, Treasury Officer, Senior Accountant, Accounts Payable/Receivable Leads
INTERNAL INTERFACES
: Plant Managers, Supply Chain, Sales/Export Team, HR, Operations, and Internal Audit
EXTERNAL INTERFACES:
Banks, Auditors, Tax Authorities, Export Regulators (CBN, NEPC, FIRS, NCS)
Brief Job Overview
Neveah Limited is a dynamic, fast-growing commodities trading and recycling company committed to excellence, sustainability, and global competitiveness. Since our establishment, we have evolved from a major player in commodity exports into a key stakeholder in Nigeria’s industrial and environmental revolution.
1. JOB OVERVIEW
The Financial Controller is responsible for overseeing all financial operations of the organization’s manufacturing and export businesses, covering metals, minerals, and agro-commodities. The role ensures financial accuracy, operational efficiency, and regulatory compliance across domestic production and international trade activities. This position supports the Chief Financial Officer (CFO) in driving profitability, cost control, export liquidity, and stakeholder confidence through
strong financial governance and reporting discipline.
2. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
A. Financial Management & Reporting
• Lead preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements in compliance with IFRS.
• Consolidate reports across multiple plants and export subsidiaries for management and audit review.
• Manage the general ledger, journal entries, and ensure accuracy of balance sheet reconciliations.
• Coordinate annual external audits and implement recommendations from auditors.
B. Budgeting, Forecasting & Financial Planning
• Lead the budgeting process, ensuring alignment with production, logistics, and export sales targets.
• Develop quarterly forecasts and variance analysis for performance tracking.
• Advise management on investment priorities and cost optimization strategies.
C. Manufacturing & Cost Accounting
• Implement and maintain standard costing systems for raw materials, production, and conversion costs.
• Analyze yield, scrap rates, energy consumption, and process efficiency metrics.
• Provide detailed cost variance analysis and margin reports to management.
• Collaborate with plant managers to enhance cost efficiency and operational productivity.
D. Export Finance & Trade Compliance
• Oversee all financial aspects of export operations including Letters of Credit (LCs), NXP forms, and repatriation of export
proceeds.
• Ensure compliance with CBN, NEPC, NCS, and FIRS regulations related to export trade.
• Monitor FX positions and optimize utilization of foreign exchange for raw material sourcing and export funding.
• Coordinate with banks and logistics providers on export documentation and payment settlements.
E. Treasury, Working Capital & Cash Flow Management
• Supervise cash flow forecasting and ensure sufficient liquidity for operations and capital projects.
• Manage banking relationships, credit facilities, and debt covenants.
• Monitor receivables, payables, and inventory to ensure optimal working capital efficiency.
• Review capital expenditure requests and ensure financial justification for major projects.
F. Internal Controls, Compliance & Taxation
• Develop and enforce internal control policies across procurement, production, and sales.
• Ensure full compliance with tax obligations including CIT, VAT, WHT, and export-related incentives.
• Oversee implementation of ERP-based approval workflows for all finance transactions.
• Coordinate internal audit activities and resolve identified issues promptly.
G. Leadership & Team Management
• Supervise and mentor finance team members including accountants, analysts, and treasury officers.
• Foster a culture of integrity, accountability, and continuous improvement within the finance department.
• Provide financial training to non-finance managers to improve budget discipline and cost awareness.
• Support the CFO and Executive Team in corporate strategic initiatives.
3. REQUIRED COMPETENCIES
• Technical: Financial reporting (IFRS), cost accounting, treasury, tax compliance, ERP systems (SAP/Oracle/Odoo).
• Analytical: Variance analysis, financial modeling, capital budgeting, data-driven decision-making.
• Behavioral: Integrity, attention to detail, discipline, and strong communication skills.
• Leadership: Team building, cross-functional collaboration, and proactive problem-solving.
4. KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS (KPIs)
Reporting Timely and accurate financial statements Within 7 working days of month-end
Cost Control Manufacturing cost variance < 5% deviation
Working Capital DSO / DIO / DPO performance £ 45 / £ 60 / ³ 30 days
Export Finance Export proceeds repatriation Within 90 days post-shipment
Audit & Compliance External audit exceptions Zero material findings
Tax Compliance Statutory remittances 100% on-time
5. QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE
• Bachelor’s degree in accounting, Finance, or Economics (Master’s preferred).
• Professional certification: ICAN or ACCA (mandatory).
• 10–15 years of progressive finance experience, with at least 5 years in manufacturing/export operations.
• Strong knowledge of metals, minerals, and agro-commodity value chains.
• Proven track record managing multi-site financial operations and external audits.
6. CORE VALUES & BEHAVIOURS EXPECTED
• Upholds integrity, transparency, and ethical financial management.
• Commits to operational excellence and continuous improvement.
• Maintains confidentiality and professionalism in all dealings.
• Demonstrates accountability to organizational goals and deadlines.
• Acts as a strategic partner supporting business growth and sustainability.
SALARY:
N1,000,000 - N1,300,000
How to Apply:
To apply for a role at Neveah Limited, please send an email to
careers@neveah.com.ng
with your updated CV saved in your first and Last name. Use the job position you are applying for as the subject of the email.
Only properly submitted applications and qualified candidates will be considered.

Title: Contrôleur de gestion/Contrôleuse de gestion
Project Management Support - Specialist
Description:
Job Highlight
Empowering project success through operational excellence, data-driven insights, and seamless coordination.
About The Project Office
Accelerated Partnership for Renewables in Africa (APRA):
The Accelerated Partnership for Renewables in Africa (APRA) is an African country-led international partnership that brings together governments and stakeholders working to accelerate the deployment of renewables to enhance energy access, enable green industrialization, and improve economic and societal resilience. Launched by African countries and international partners during the Africa Climate Summit in Nairobi in September 2023, the Partnership promotes a holistic approach to the energy transition, provides political leadership, mobilizes action and commitments from public and private entities, and coordinates international efforts for meaningful systemic change.
APRA’s membership currently comprises Kenya, Ethiopia, Djibouti, Uganda, Rwanda, Zimbabwe, Mozambique, Namibia, Ghana and Sierra Leone. As its foundational phase comes to an end, APRA is expanding to engage more countries with high ambitions for renewable energy and green industrialisation in Africa and beyond.
Role Purpose
The Project Management Support Specialist coordinates and supports the effective planning, implementation and monitoring of projects, ensuring delivery of results within the agreed scope, time, cost, quality and risk parameters. The role supports day-to-day project operations, liaises with partners, donors and beneficiaries, and ensures that project activities are in line with UNOPS policies, donor/partner requirements, and quality standards. The Project Management Support Specialist provides analytical and operational support, tracks financial and performance data, identifies risks or implementation challenges, and coordinates timely solutions in collaboration with stakeholders. The role therefore contributes towards ensuring that projects achieve their intended objectives, strengthen partner relationships, and contribute to UNOPS’ operational goals.
Functions / Key Results Expected
Project Delivery and Performance
Support in the planning, implementation and monitoring of project activities in line with approved work plans, budgets and quality standards.
Coordinate day-to-day project operations to ensure timely delivery of outputs and adherence to UNOPS and donor/partner requirements.
Manage and monitor progress against scope, time, cost and quality tolerances. Identify risks and deviations, propose corrective actions, and escalate when required.
Oversee project contracts and supplier performance to ensure compliance and value for money.
Embed sustainability principles - including gender equality, social inclusion and environmental considerations - across project activities.
Contribute to the identification and development of new project opportunities or extensions of existing engagements.
Financial and Procurement Management
Support financial planning, monitoring and reporting to ensure effective budget utilization and cost control in line with UNOPS Financial Rules and Regulations.
Manage cash flow, expenditures and financial commitments, ensuring timely disbursements and accurate financial reporting.
Support procurement and grant management processes, including preparation of Terms of Reference (ToRs), evaluation of bids, and contract administration.
Coordinate with finance and procurement teams to ensure compliance, transparency, and proper documentation of transactions.
Prepare and review financial reports and participate in project audits, ensuring implementation of recommendations.
Stakeholder Engagement and Coordination
Maintain effective working relationships with donors, partners, national authorities and other stakeholders to ensure coordinated delivery and alignment with project objectives.
Support the development and implementation of stakeholder engagement and communication plans, ensuring timely and consistent information sharing.
Facilitate internal coordination among project teams, technical experts and support functions.
Represent the project in meetings, consultations and external engagements as delegated by the supervisor.
Monitoring, Reporting and Quality Assurance
Monitor project performance against agreed indicators, preparing progress, financial and completion reports in accordance with UNOPS and donor/partner standards.
Conduct data analysis and provide inputs for management decisions and strategic planning.
Ensure quality assurance processes are applied to all deliverables, documents and outputs.
Support compliance with internal audit and quality standards, coordinating corrective action as required.
Personnel Management (as applicable)
Assist in supervising, guiding and motivating project team members to achieve high performance and accountability.
Contribute to recruitment, onboarding and performance management of personnel, ensuring gender balance and diversity principles are upheld.
Promote a respectful, inclusive and safe working environment that aligns with UNOPS’ zero-tolerance policy for misconduct, discrimination and harassment.
Ensure compliance with United Nations Department of Safety and Security (UNDSS) safety and security standards for all project staff and operations.
Knowledge Building and Sharing
Support the organization, facilitation and delivery of training and learning sessions on project management.
Participate in knowledge-sharing initiatives and Communities of Practice (CoPs), contributing insights and lessons learned.
Conduct research on project management-related topics and contribute to the drafting of reports, summaries and briefing notes.
Education Requirements
Required
Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in any discipline with 7 years of relevant experience OR Master’s degree (or equivalent) in any discipline with 5 years of relevant experience is required.
Desired
A globally recognized professional certificate or membership in Project Management is desired.
Required
Experience Requirements
Relevant experience is work in project management or related areas.
Demonstrable proficiency in the use of collaboration and productivity tools (e.g. MS Office, G-Suite, etc) and web-based management systems is required.
Desired
Experience of working in multicultural environments or UN system organizations in a developing country is desired.
Experience in development or humanitarian contexts is desired.

Title: Procurement Senior Officer
Description:
Job Highlight
Drive efficient and compliant procurement processes that uphold best practices in international public procurement and organizational standards.
Role Purpose
The Procurement Senior Officer is responsible for developing and implementing strategic and effective procurement services reflecting best practices in international public procurement; compliance with UNOPS procurement rules and regulations; appropriate risk management; and obtaining the best value for money for the acquisition of goods, services and contracting of works. The role analyzes and interprets relevant rules and regulations and provides advice and solutions to a wide spectrum of complex issues related to procurement.
The Procurement Senior Officer has a deep understanding of procurement policy and processes, as well as their application to appropriate situations. In addition to responsibility for the deliverables of the work team, the role focuses on strategic relationship building and demand management, mainly related to aggregation and dealing with complex organization structures, preparation of business cases and understanding of the supply market, as well as sharing knowledge with projects in order to achieve reductions of costs and savings.
By role-modelling the highest degrees of personal and professional ethics, the Procurement Senior Officer maintains a collaborative, quality-driven, client-focused and results-oriented approach to their procurement role. S/he works in close cooperation with the office leadership and project managers, reporting to management on central issues related to procurement activities.
Functions / Key Results Expected
Procurement Operations
Execute procurement activities in accordance with UNOPS rules, regulations, policies and strategic frameworks.
Maintain a client-focused procurement management system, supported by effective internal controls.
Collaborate with project managers to review procurement plans and develop fit-for-purpose strategies that incorporate sustainability and value-for-money principles.
Implement or support all phases of the procurement lifecycle, including strategic planning; pre-purchasing; requirements definition; sourcing; solicitation; management of submissions; evaluation; review and award; post-purchasing; contract finalization and issuance; logistics; and contract management.
Develop and manage rosters of suppliers.
Procurement Process Management
Prepare procurement plans on time and as expected.
Monitor implementation of procurement plans for alignment with project timelines and strategic objectives.
Review and validate requirements to ensure clarity, completeness and suitability from a procurement standpoint.
Follow guidelines for embedding sustainability across the procurement process.
Coordinate the end-to-end solicitation process, including Requests for Quote (RFQs), Invitations to Bid (ITBs), and Requests for Proposal (RFPs) in line with UNOPS policies.
Coordinate the receipt and evaluation of quotations, bids and proposals.
Participate in the negotiation of conditions of contracts in full compliance with UNOPS rules and regulations.
Prepare submissions to the Contract and Property Committees (CPCs)
Enter and update supplier information in the UNOPS ERP system - oneUNOPS (oU).
Monitor contractor performance and certification of completed work for compliance with contractual terms and payment.
Provide advice, remedial action, or solutions to project managers on procurement issues.
Draft Long Term Agreements (LTAs) and/or service or works contracts and other instruments when necessary, and create purchase orders (POs) in the ERP system.
Use of E-Procurement Tools
Utilize the e-sourcing module in line with goals and standards set by the Procurement Group.
Knowledge Building and Knowledge Sharing
Organize, facilitate or deliver training and learning initiatives for personnel on procurement.
Provide sound contributions to knowledge networks and communities of practice by synthesizing lessons learned and disseminating best practices in procurement.
Collect and productively utilize feedback, ideas and internal knowledge about processes and best practices.
Education Requirements
Required
Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in any discipline with 4 years of relevant experience OR
Master’s degree (or equivalent) in any discipline with 2 years of relevant experience is required.
Desired
A globally or nationally recognized professional certificate or membership (e.g. CIPS) is desired.

The role will oversee the country’s distribution quality and full operational compliance in line with investor and regulatory requirements. The role includes managing the carbon excellence team, monitoring customer onboarding, sales processes, and ensuring high standards of data accuracy, field operations, and performance.
The position also involves driving initiatives to optimise customer usage, support charcoal displacement, and maintain carbon performance governance across all teams.
Duties and Responsibilities:
End-to-End Distribution Quality & Compliance:
Own the country’s distribution quality and compliance, ensuring alignment with operational and investor-required standards
Manage the Carbon Excellence Team to maintain high operational standards

Lead initiatives that address common barriers to high-quality usage, including issues with power reliability, pot compatibility, and user errors
Monitor and ensure households reduce or eliminate charcoal use in line with carbon requirements
Conduct regular household audits to verify stove usage and fuel-switching behaviour, ensuring compliance with displacement targets
Identify barriers to effective charcoal displacement and lead corrective actions to ensure customers consistently adopt clean cooking methods
Provide insights to the Commercial and Product teams on fuel stacking patterns and recommend corrective measures
Carbon Performance Governance:
Lead weekly carbon performance reviews with CX, Sales, Field Operations, and Product teams to assess risks, trends, and required actions
Ensure field compliance standards are consistently enforced across all teams
Escalate major risks to leadership, with well-structured recommendations and corrective action plans to mitigate any issues

Develop and implement customer education materials focused on usage, safety, and the long-term benefits of clean cooking
Lead community-based and digital engagement efforts to increase adoption and consistent usage of clean cooking technologies
Foster strong relationships with customers to drive improved engagement and sustainable behaviour change
Work with B2C teams to ensure customer messaging is standardised, accurate, and aligned with carbon project requirements
Field Execution Quality Assurance:
Ensure that field teams strictly adhere to Standard Operating Procedures for customer onboarding, stove placement, usage training, and documentation
Conduct surprise spot-checks, agent audits, and household validations to assess field operations and quality
Identify non-compliant agents and recommend appropriate disciplinary action to maintain the integrity of the program
Compliance and Usage Framework Development:
Develop Ghana-specific compliance and usage frameworks, considering cultural cooking practices, regional fuel stacking behaviour, and local regulatory requirements
Tailor carbon performance and compliance strategies to local contexts while maintaining global standards
Reporting & Insights:
Provide weekly insight reports to senior leadership, highlighting trends in customer usage, charcoal displacement challenges, and data quality from the BI system
Identify opportunities for program optimisation based on data insights and support senior leadership in decision-making processes

Overall Compliance Accuracy: Maintain full compliance and data accuracy across all onboarding, documentation, and carbon processes
Risk Detection & Resolution: Identify and resolve compliance and operational risks within agreed timelines
Reporting & Governance Quality: Deliver all required compliance and carbon performance reports on time with reliable, actionable insights
Customer Usage & Adoption Performance: Achieve expected customer usage levels and successfully drive recovery efforts for low-usage households
Charcoal Displacement Assurance: Ensure households transition away from charcoal and meet carbon program requirements
Field Execution & Distribution Quality: Maintain high operational quality through strong adherence to SOPs and reduced field execution errors
Training & Capability Uplift: Improve team compliance performance and understanding through timely training and capacity-building
Continuous Improvement & Framework Development: Maintain strong governance through updated compliance frameworks and regular improvement initiatives

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Operations, Quality Management, or a related field
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in compliance, quality assurance, risk management, carbon projects, or operations management (preferably in a PAYGo, carbon, or clean cooking environment)
Strong understanding of process controls, documentation standards, and risk management
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
Willingness and ability to conduct on-ground field monitoring across Kumasi and surrounding areas
Strong proficiency in data analysis, reporting, and analytical tools
Advanced skills in Microsoft 365 (Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, etc.)
Self-motivated, able to work independently, and capable of managing tasks with minimal supervision

في أكثر من 100 فندق حائز على جوائز في جميع أنحاء العالم، يخلق فندق ريتز كارلتون للسيدات والرجال تجارب استثنائية للغاية لدرجة أنه بعد فترة طويلة من إقامة الضيف معنا، تبقى التجربة معه. من خلال جذب أفضل محترفي الضيافة في العالم الذين يرسمون ذكريات تدوم مدى الحياة، نعتقد أن الجميع ينجحون عندما يتم تمكينهم من أن يكونوا مبدعين ومفكرين ومتعاطفين.
كل يوم، نضع معايير الخدمة الفاخرة النادرة والخاصة في جميع أنحاء العالم ونفخر بأنفسنا لتقديم التميز في رعاية وراحة ضيوفنا.
سيكون دورك هو ضمان تقديم "المعايير الذهبية" لفندق الريتز كارلتون بلطف وعناية كل يوم. المعايير الذهبية هي أساس فندق الريتز كارلتون وهي ما يرشدنا كل يوم لنكون أفضل من اليوم التالي. هذا هو الأساس وإيماننا بأن ثقافتنا هي الدافع وراء النجاح الذي من خلاله اكتسب فندق الريتز كارلتون سمعة باعتباره علامة تجارية عالمية رائدة في مجال الضيافة الفاخرة. كجزء من فريقنا، ستتعلم وتجسد المعايير الذهبية، مثل وعد الموظف والعقيدة وقيم الخدمة الخاصة بنا. ووعدنا لك هو أننا نقدم الفرصة لتكون فخورًا بالعمل الذي تقوم به ومع من تعمل معه.
عند الانضمام إلى فندق الريتز كارلتون، فإنك تنضم إلى مجموعة من العلامات التجارية مع ماريوت الدولية.

Title: Stagiaire Stratégies et Opérations F/H
Description:
«
Tous nos postes sont ouverts au télétravail »
Rejoindre Deloitte, c'est dire oui à une expérience qui a du sens, celle où les rencontres et les missions vous poussent à grandir chaque jour. C’est évoluer dans un environnement de travail fondé sur la confiance, la transmission et l’intelligence collective pour construire l’avenir de nos clients. Un avenir que nous voulons plus responsable, plus durable et respectueux de l’environnement en prenant des initiatives concrètes à notre échelle.
Et vous, prêts à dire
#ISayYes
à votre futur chez Deloitte ?
Deloitte est présent sur l’ensemble du continent africain notamment en Afrique francophone, anglophone et lusophone et met son expertise au service de ses clients en Afrique.
En Afrique francophone
Deloitte est présent en Afrique du Nord, en Afrique de l’Ouest et en Afrique centrale et dispose de 12 bureaux avec une capacité d'intervention sur 19 pays Deloitte mobilise plus de 1 500 collaborateurs dans les activités de Consulting, d’Audit Assurance, de conseil Juridique et Fiscal, de Risk Advisory, de Financial Advisory et de Business Outsourcing.
En tant que firme multidisciplinaire, Deloitte offre à ses clients un accompagnement de proximité et sur mesure grâce à la maîtrise des enjeux locaux afin de répondre aux attentes et aux besoins des acteurs publics et privés (Assurances, Technologies Médias Télécoms, Santé, Consumer Business, Energie).
Quel sera votre rôle dans la #TeamDeloitte ?
Deloitte est, un des leaders mondiaux du conseil en stratégie. Les consultants Deloitte, en alliant l'excellence de leurs réseaux et un accompagnement hautement personnalisé, répondent aux besoins en constante mutation de leurs clients en apportant des solutions à forte valeur susceptibles d'impacter leurs activités de façon décisive. Le département Conseil regroupe l’expertise de Deloitte en matière de Stratégie & Opérations, Capital Humain et Technologies & Digital à destination d’entreprises industrielles et commerciales, de banques et de compagnies d’assurance et des organisations du secteur public.
Face aux enjeux stratégiques à la fois dans les secteurs et les métiers/fonctions, les consultants aident à concevoir, à mettre en oeuvre et à conduire le changement des organisations, des processus et des systèmes d'informations. Ce département intervient pour conseiller ces organisations dans la définition et la mise en œuvre de leur stratégie.
Au sein de ce département, l'équipe Conseil stratégie & Opérations accompagne ses clients dans l'élaboration de leur stratégie, dans l’accompagnement à la mise en œuvre de leur stratégie et à l’alignement de leur organisation pour et des process, gage de leur efficience opérationnelle.
Vos Missions
:
Vous assistez l'équipe dans la réalisation de tâches et de projets liés à l’élaboration de projets stratégiques;
Vous effectuez des recherches pour soutenir les analyses de diagnostic externe (opportunités et faiblesses) et interne (forces et faiblesses) d’organisations avec une ou plusieurs business units ;
Vous contribuez à la création de documents, de présentations ou de rapports pertinents ;
Vous réalisez des études de marché et de faisabilité.
Vous développez un set de compétences, partagées avec notre réseau international, et structurées autour des dimensions suivantes : leadership, métier et spécialité. Vous participerez et au programme de formations proposé, pour renforcer progressivement ces compétences, en acquérir de nouvelles. Tout au long de votre expérience vous progressez grace à un management de proximité, de responsabilisation et d’accompagnement personnalisé.
Et si c’était vous ?
Vous êtes étudiant(e) ou récemment diplômé(e) en stratégie, business management ou dans un domaine connexe;
Vous aimez travailler en équipe et faites preuve de qualités d'adaptation, de rigueur, d’analyse, de synthèse et de proactivité qui vous permettent de contribuer à l'excellence de notre service auprès des clients;
Vous possédez des aptitudes en rédaction de note conceptuelle, en élaboration de supports de présentation sur PowerPoint.

Title: Sales Consultant – Higher Education Market
Description:
Job Title:
Sales Consultant – Higher Education Market
Location:
Lebanon, Jordan, Egypt
Job Type:
Full-Time
About Us:
Kezana is the leading EdTech provider of AI-powered knowledge solutions, and research and collaboration platforms for academicians, researchers, and students of content from or about the Middle East, Türkiye, and Africa.
Position Overview:
As a Sales Consultant for the Higher Education market, you will be responsible for developing new business opportunities, managing existing client relationships, and promoting our solutions to universities, colleges, and other educational institutions across the MENA region. You will play a key role in achieving sales targets, growing our client base, and driving the company’s presence in the region.
Key Responsibilities:
Sales Strategy & Execution:
Develop and implement sales strategies to promote our solutions to higher education institutions across the MENA region.
Client Relationship Management:
Build and maintain strong relationships with key decision-makers at universities, colleges, and other educational organizations.
Lead Generation:
Identify and generate new business opportunities through networking, cold calling, attending industry events, and leveraging other sales techniques.
Sales Presentations & Proposals:
Deliver compelling presentations and create tailored proposals to meet client needs.
Negotiation & Closing:
Drive negotiations and close deals effectively while ensuring client satisfaction.
Market Research:
Stay up to date on the latest trends in the higher education market and identify opportunities for growth.
Collaboration:
Work closely with internal teams (marketing, product development, customer service) and partners to ensure the successful delivery of products/services to clients.
Reporting & Documentation:
Maintain accurate sales records and reports, including sales forecasts, customer interactions, and progress toward targets.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in library science, information systems, business, education, or related field.
Must be fluent in Arabic and English, including speaking, reading and writing.
Minimum of 5 years of sales experience in libraries and/or the publishing/technology sector, with a proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets.
Strong understanding of the higher education landscape, including key players and trends.
Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Self-motivated with a strong desire to succeed and grow professionally.
Proficient in Microsoft Office and CRM software (Salesforce.com, etc.), and familiar with AI tools.
What We Offer:
Competitive salary and incentive plans.
Opportunity to work with the most passionate and dynamic team in the industry, at the most cutting-edge company in the region.
Access to the highest quality professional development and training opportunities.
A collaborative, multicultural work environment where your contributions are valued.

Title: Associate Manager, Commercial Development
Description:
Main Purpose of Job
Execute overall category development & growth within the country, by driving focus on Channel/customer plans based on shopper insights, while implementing the commercial execution agenda. Combined with delivering the compelling selling stories for the customers within the country, to deliver on the categories strategies and growth expectations.
A DAY IN THE LIFE …
Commercial Process: Input into the ICP process within the respective category/categories within their respective OPCs/countries to ensure timely cross-functional input, with alignment to the key Category, Brand, Channel, Shopper and Customer growth opportunities and activation platforms. Ensure customer plans are aligned to the cluster category and channel priorities
Strategic Revenue Management (SRM): Implement Strategic Revenue Management as a way of working for the category, ensuring opportunities are worked on during the key times of year e.g. ICP and becomes part of the day to day working for the GD community in the OPC, for the category. Category insights to be fed into the MBPC process.
Category Strategy : implement the Omni-Channel Category strategy, delivering Customer, Category & Nestle Growth (The triple win). Drive the relationships with the prioritised customers in order to be the preferred supplier through a deep understanding of their needs
Channel 360: Execute the channel plans to win at the Point of Purchase, within the country, for the category. Ensure category specificities are understood and aligned where it could impact the overall cluster approach.
Shopper: Ensure the needs of the category in the country/OPC are met by executing the shopper research agenda. Drive the understanding of the shopper in the category internally and with key customers, ensuring commercial plans have shopper data & insights embedded throughout.
ARE YOU A FIT?
2-3 years of experience in a commercial role (Sales/Marketing) with a proven track record of delivering on results while being able to: - Solid understanding of Shopper need states, trends & shopping missions- Solid underdstanding of Wholesalers, Hypermarkets, E-retailers, convenience etc.), their Strategies & trends with a full overview on the retaill landscape - Good commercial understanding pricing & promotions
Core knowledge of the 10 Nestlé Corporate Business Principles and expert knowledge in our areas of responsibility.
Strong knowledge of key business processes (ICP, MBP & DF, DCG, BBNW, Marketplace)
Nestle Management and Leadership principles.
Strong understanding of shopper, market intelligence sources, category/channel/shopper trends.
Deep knowledge of key commercial functions and priorities. Customer Management.

Title: HR Manager - Telecom
Description:
Description
We are seeking an experienced and dedicated HR Manager to join our dynamic team in the telecommunications industry. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in shaping our organizational culture and supporting our workforce. You will be responsible for developing and implementing HR strategies that foster a high-performance work environment conducive to achieving business goals. Your expertise in talent acquisition, employee engagement, performance management, and compliance will be essential in navigating the complexities of the dynamic telecommunications landscape. As an HR Manager, you will liaise with department heads to identify staffing needs, facilitate training programs, and ensure that the company adheres to all regulatory requirements. Additionally, you will manage employee relations issues, guiding employees through conflict resolution and ensuring a fair and respectful workplace. This role requires a balance of strategic thinking and hands-on execution. You will have the opportunity to lead initiatives that enhance employee satisfaction and drive operational efficiency. We are looking for an individual who is not only proficient in HR practices but also possesses strong leadership skills to mentor and develop our HR team. If you are passionate about fostering a positive work environment and contributing to organizational success, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity.
Responsibilities
Develop and implement HR strategies aligned with business objectives.
Oversee the recruitment process, ensuring the acquisition of top talent.
Design and conduct employee training and development programs.
Manage employee relations issues, providing guidance and support.
Implement and maintain HR policies and procedures in compliance with regulations.
Conduct performance management processes, including evaluations and feedback.
Monitor and report on HR metrics to inform decision-making.
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field.
Proven experience as an HR Manager or similar role in the telecommunications industry.
Strong knowledge of HR practices, labor laws, and regulations.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to analyze data and generate reports for evidence-based decision-making.
Proficient in HR software and Microsoft Office Suite.
Demonstrated leadership and team management capabilities.

Title: Factory Planner - South Africa
Description:
For over 75 years, BIC has been creating ingeniously simple and joyful products that are a part of every heart and home. As a member of our team, you'll be a part of reigniting a beloved brand as we continue to reimagine everyday essentials in new, sustainable and responsible ways.
Our "roll up your sleeves and get the job done" approach to work creates an environment where self-starters, problem solvers and innovative thinkers thrive. BIC team members are empowered to take ownership of their careers and bring their unique perspectives to the table to make a meaningful impact on our mission.
It's a colorful world - make your mark by joining the BIC team today.
Job Summary
The Factory Planner for the South Africa cluster will be responsible for developing and executing short- to mid-term production plans that align with demand forecasts, inventory targets, and factory capabilities. This role ensures that manufacturing operations are synchronized with supply chain objectives, enabling high service levels, cost efficiency, and agility in response to market dynamics.
This position is critical to strengthening local planning capabilities and will form part of the 2026 Operating Plan structure.
Main Responsibilities / Tasks
Production Planning & Scheduling
Translate demand plans into feasible production schedules for the South Africa factory.
Balance capacity, material availability, and labor constraints to optimize production output.
Monitor adherence to production plans and adjust schedules proactively to mitigate risks
Inventory & Material Management
Ensure alignment between production plans and inventory targets to avoid stockouts or excess.
Collaborate with procurement and material planners to secure timely availability of raw and packaging materials.
Performance Monitoring & Reporting
Track key planning KPIs (e.g., schedule adherence, OTIF, inventory turns).
Provide regular updates and insights to factory leadership and regional planning teams.
Cross-functional Collaboration
Act as the planning interface between factory operations, demand planning, logistics, and procurement.
Support S&OP and pre-S&OP processes with factory-level inputs and scenario planning.
Continuous Improvement
Identify and implement improvements in planning processes, systems, and data accuracy.
Contribute to digitalization and automation initiatives within factory planning.
Key Interfaces:
Factory Operations & Site Leadership
Demand Planning MEA
Procurement & Material Planning
Logistics & Distribution
Quality Assurance
Finance & Controlling
Regional Supply Chain Leadership
Skills, Knowledge, Compensies
Planning & Prioritization:
Ability to manage complex schedules and competing priorities.
Analytical Thinking:
Strong problem-solving skills and data-driven decision-making.
Collaboration & Communication:
Effective stakeholder engagement across functions and levels.
Agility & Adaptability:
Comfortable working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
Systems Thinking:
Understands end-to-end supply chain impact of factory planning decisions.
Additional Notes:
This role is part of the strategic workforce planning for 2026 and supports the decentralization of planning responsibilities.
The position will contribute to improved responsiveness, reduced lead times, and enhanced service levels in the South Africa cluster.
Role may require occasional travel to other cluster sites or regional planning meetings.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in supply chain management, Industrial Engineering, Business Administration, or related field.
3–5 years of experience in factory or production planning, preferably in FMCG or manufacturing.
Strong understanding of supply chain principles, production processes, and planning systems.
Experience with ERP and advanced planning tools (e.g., SAP PP, APO, OMP, Kinaxis, JDE, Blue Yonder).
Proficiency in Excel and data analysis tools; ability to work with large datasets.
BIC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strongly commit to hiring people with different backgrounds and experiences to help us build better products, make better decisions, and better serve our customers. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability status, or similar characteristics. All employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need.
BIC is not seeking assistance or accepting unsolicited resumes from search firms for this employment opportunity. Regardless of past practice, all resumes submitted by search firms to any team member at BIC via email, or directly to a BIC team member in any form without a valid written search agreement in place for that position will be deemed the sole property of BIC, and no fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by BIC as a result of the referral or through other means.

Title: Infection Control Specialist

• Bachelor’s degree in Medicine, Pharmacy, Dentistry, or Nursing
• 1–3 years of experience
• Diploma in Infection Control

职位介绍 岗位职责： 1.负责子公司整体财务运营及管理工作、内控体系的完善；参与公司重大的经营决策，并提供建议和决策支持，参与风险评估、指导、跟踪和控制。 2.统筹公司资金结算与运营、会计核算，及时报送各类管理报表及分析报告，为管理层提供决策依据。 3.主导制定年度财务计划和预算工作并落实实施，负责提供财务数据以及财务分析。 4.项目财务管理：组织开展项目财务管理，参与项目“四算”，即概算、预算、核算和决算，及时监控和汇报项目风险，跟踪项目应收账款情况。 5.税务筹划：负责规划当地税负，合理把控税务风险。 6.负责对公司重要经济合同及购销合同的审查，并监督合同的执行，确保企业利益不受损害。 7.与工商、税务、银行、中介机构、资本市场监管等相关机构建立和保持良好的协作关系。 8.负责部门团队建设及员工培养，制定财务内部相关指标，做好绩效考核管理；协调财务部与其它部门的关系。 9.积极领会集团财务政策，并贯彻执行。 10.领导交代的其他工作。 汇报对象：向集团财务总监和子公司总经理负责，接受双方的考核。 职位要求： 1.全日制本科以上学历，财务、金融或其他经济类相关专业毕业，中高级以上会计职称，注册会计师优先考虑。 2.具备良好的财务管理经验及敏锐的洞察力和数据感觉，熟悉财务管理流程，具有财务把控能力，大局观较强；七年以上财务工作经验，且至少三年以上财务经理/总监的管理经验，同行业或上市公司财务经理或财务总监优先。 3.熟悉企业信息化管理及ERP系统。 4.熟悉高新技术企业、软件企业有关产业政策，熟悉相关税收优惠政策的执行。 5.熟悉《企业会计准则》有关规定，能熟练编制合并报表。 6.具备良好的职业道德，严谨的工作作风及高度的事业心和责任心，认同企业文化，敢于承担责任，执行力强；具有良好的组织、协调能力，善于沟通，能够适应高强度工作。 其他信息 行业要求：全部行业
公司简介
万丰奥特控股集团（以下简称“万丰集团”）创立于1994年，是一家“大交通”领域以先进制造业为核心的国际化企业。一直以来，万丰集团秉持“实业报国、产业强国”的责任使命，遵循“永恒提升价值、不断奉献社会”的理想信念，产业涉足汽车部件、航空工业、智能装备、金融投资等领域，致力于“营造国际品牌、构筑百年企业”。 历经20多年的发展，万丰集团资产超300亿元、员工1.5万人以上，位列中国民营企业500*强、中国汽车工业30强、浙江省100强，已形成轻量化应用汽车部件和通用飞机制造“双引擎”驱动的发展格局，打造全球汽车金属部件轻量化推动者和领*导者、通用飞机创新制造企业的全球领跑者。其中：轻量化铝轮、新材料镁合金产业实现细分市场全球；新工艺涂覆、智能装备工业机器人产业实现细分市场国内；战略性新兴产业通航产业成为全国民企集飞机制造、机场建设、航校培训、通航运营、低空保障、航空俱乐部等于一体全产业链的样板，占地5.5平方公里的万丰航空小镇已列入国家通用航空综合示范区、国家空中游览基地、国家飞行营地、浙江省特色小镇，所产拥有全部知识产权的钻石通航飞机进入世界品牌前三强。借助上市公司平台，万丰集团朝着行业领*先、向千亿目标迈进，从经营国际化向资本、人才、科技、品牌国际化转型升级。 步入新发展阶段，贯彻新发展理念，融入新发展格局，万丰集团将牢牢抓住国家大力发展战略性新兴产业的历史机遇，践行《中国制造2025》战略和“国际国内双循环”新发展格局，专注实体经济，弘扬工匠精神，以数字经济为牵引，以实业经营为基础，不断扩大产业规模，带动周边群体共享发展，实现“百强百誉百年万丰”的战略目标，争当浙江省高质量发展共同富裕标杆企业，为振兴地方经济、推动行业进步、促进社会发展贡献万丰更多的智慧和力量。

Title: Senior Sales Account Manager-New Cairo
Description:
dubizzle Egypt is the leading marketplace for selling and buying online in the region. Our aim is to upgrade people's lives by facilitating deals and identifying attractive opportunities for both individuals and businesses. Our goal is to strengthen local economies, empower small businesses, and help everyone in making smarter choices for themselves, the market, and the planet.
As part of dubizzle, we are alongside some of the strongest classifieds brands in the market. With a collective strength of 8 brands, we have more than 160 million monthly users that trust in our dedication to providing them with the best platform for their needs.
As a Sales Account Manager your purpose is to seek new business opportunities by contacting and developing relationships with potential customers. They are responsible for developing leads from marketing campaigns and meeting sales quotas. They cultivate strong relationships with customers and ensure proper after-sales service. Ultimately, he/she will boost sales and contribute to Bayut long-term business growth.
In this role, you will:
Communicate effectively to manage clients' expectations and ensure they receive a great dubizzle experience
Achieve monthly (Targets renewal and acquisition with consistency)
Become an expert on the Egyptian Real Estate market through combining the on-ground insights with dubizzle high level overview and data
Increase our market share by selling our products to new customers
Manage and arrange meetings with clients for acquisition, renewals, upgrade
Increase our client satisfaction by performing account management services with them
Regularly update reporting dashboard to reflect all sales activities
Liaise with Finance, Customer Support, legal and Marketing department for any sales-related or client-related issues
Collect market insights and keep up to date with laws and local development news
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in marketing or sales or related field
Excellent in English Communication written and speak
3 to 5 years of relevant sales experience
Has a successful record in exceeding or achieving the assigned targets consistently
Experience in farming and cold calls
Knowledge of the real estate market in Egypt
Knowledge of the Subscription industry
Familiar with tech, ecommerce
Familiar with Prop tech, Market place, Facebook, and other digital platforms
Excellent in prospecting, cold calls and generating leads
Excellent communication, negotiation, time management and presentation skills
Excellent in converting lead into paying customer
Positive/Flexible/Presentable/Committed
Eager for success
Has plug and play attitude
Benefits
A fast paced, high performing team
Comprehensive Health Insurance
Life Insurance
Rewards & Recognitions
Learning & Development opportunities

Chez Marriott International, nous nous engageons à promouvoir l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi, à accueillir dignement chaque personne et à offrir les mêmes opportunités à tous. Nous avons instauré un environnement dans lequel les particularités de nos collaborateurs sont appréciées et célébrées. Notre plus grande force réside dans le mélange varié de cultures, de compétences et d’expériences de nos collaborateurs. Nous veillons à prévenir toute discrimination fondée sur des critères protégés, notamment le handicap, le statut de vétéran et tout autre aspect couvert par la loi en vigueur.
Dans plus de 100 établissements primés à travers le monde, le personnel de l'enseigne Ritz-Carlton crée des expériences si exceptionnelles qu'elles restent gravées dans la mémoire des clients longtemps après leur séjour. L'enseigne attire les meilleurs talents de l'hôtellerie du monde entier, qui perpétuent la tradition de créer des souvenirs inoubliables. Nous avons la conviction que chaque personne peut réussir si on lui donne les moyens d'être créative, attentionnée et empathique.
Chaque jour, nous définissons la norme d'un service luxueux, exclusif et inégalé dans le monde entier. C'est notre grande fierté d'offrir à notre clientèle l'excellence en matière de confort et d'hospitalité.
Votre rôle consistera à veiller à ce que les normes d'excellence de l'enseigne Ritz-Carlton soient respectées chaque jour, de manière élégante et réfléchie. Ces normes constituent le fondement des établissements Ritz-Carlton et elles nous poussent à nous surpasser chaque jour. C'est grâce à elles et à notre conviction que notre culture contribue à notre succès que Ritz-Carlton a acquis la réputation d'une enseigne mondiale leader dans le secteur de l'hôtellerie de luxe. En tant que membre de notre équipe, vous apprendrez et appliquerez nos normes d'excellence, telles que notre promesse des employés, notre credo et nos valeurs de service. En contrepartie, nous vous offrons la possibilité d'éprouver de la fierté à l'égard de votre travail et de vos collègues.
En intégrant l'équipe Ritz-Carlton, vous rejoignez également le portefeuille d'établissements de Marriott International.

Title: Fx Risk/Trading
Description:
The Role
The Fx Risk/Trading position involves managing foreign exchange risk and executing trades in a dynamic financial environment. The successful candidate will work closely with the trading team to develop strategies that mitigate risk and enhance profitability.
Monitor and analyze market trends and foreign exchange rates.
Execute trades and manage trading positions effectively.
Collaborate with risk management teams to assess and mitigate risks.
Prepare reports on trading performance and market conditions.
Participate in strategy meetings to discuss market outlook and trading strategies.
Team Structure: You will be part of a collaborative team of traders and analysts focused on optimizing trading strategies and managing risk.
Ideal Profile
The ideal candidate will possess a blend of technical expertise and interpersonal skills.
Degree in Finance, Economics, or related field.
Experience in foreign exchange trading or risk management.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills.
Ability to work under pressure and make quick decisions.
Soft Skills: Critical thinking, Problem Solving.
What's On Offer
This position offers a competitive salary and benefits package, along with opportunities for professional growth and development.
Potential for career advancement within the organization.
Dynamic and inclusive company culture.
Flexible working arrangements, including remote work options.
Access to continuous learning and development programs.

Title: Production Executive
Description:
Company Description
Production Lab is a premier event production company known for curating impactful and memorable experiences. With a team of skilled professionals, we specialize in production to deliver bespoke events tailored to our clients' needs. Our focus on detail and innovation has established us as leaders in event production excellence. We have been dedicated to turning ordinary occasions into extraordinary celebrations that exceed expectations.
Role Description
This is a full-time role based in Cairo, Egypt. As a Production Executive, you will oversee production planning, manage day-to-day operations, and ensure efficient workflows. Additional responsibilities include executing technical and 3D drawings, coordinating with cross-functional teams, and ensuring smooth communication throughout the production cycle. You will be responsible for maintaining high production standards and achieving the company's objectives.
Qualifications
Skills in Production Planning and Production Management
Strong Communication abilities and teamwork skills
Detail-oriented mindset with strong problem-solving and organizational skills
Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple tasks simultaneously
Experience in event production is a must

Title: CHARGÉE ADMINISTRATIVE

Gestion de la facturation via
Dynamics AX
: édition des factures, suivi des impayés et mise à jour des fichiers de facturation.

Job Purpose
The Plant Manufacturing Excellence Manager will function to identify, co-operate and actively participate in strategic & systemic level value chain improvement initiatives and to provide leadership for the implementation of prioritised Strategic intents from the Manufacturing Excellence Strategy for the Plant. He will develop the framework, roll-out and ensure entrenchment of consistent loss intelligence as well as loss eradication processes across the plant as key elements of the Manufacturing Excellence Program driving system.
Key Job Roles & Responsibilities
Lead sustainability of the Manufacturing Excellence Program
* Ensures that the group standards have been implemented in the Plant
* Manage the ManEx program via a structured ManEx steering committee meetings
* Ensure compliance to ManEx Pillars ownership and roll-out
* Develop annual ManEx plan and set short term plans to achieve these targets
* Monitor ManEx progress across all pillars and provide feedback
* Drive quarterly loss intelligence analysis to identify improvement teams needed and coach /influence for success
* If Group standards have been adapted due to plant specifics these changes have been approved by the Group Operational Excellence Director.
Serve as the Plant ManEx subject matter expert and provide guidance to Plant Senior Leadership Team
* Primary ManEx resource for the plant
* Facilitate the Plant 1 year and 3-year planning process
* Manage and drive for compliance to the plant MCRS
- Evaluate plant meetings and provide feedback to managers on meeting effectiveness and identify opportunities to improve structure and tool usage
- Actively participate and critique plant daily, weekly and monthly meetings and ensure ManEx standards are fully implemented and sustained
- Assist Department Management teams in developing sustainability plans to identify and close gaps
Training:
* Ensure that where training implementation is undertaken, it is done following company policies and procedures.
* Interact with leadership teams to determine training needs to support ManEx implementation.
* Where necessary, develop training material to address specific needs of shift based and engineering teams.
* Train Pillar leaders and improvement team leads on ManEx methodologies as part of improvement project launch
Lead, facilitate and coach Problem Solving (5-Why, BDA Sheet, Kaizen, PIP)
* Conduct problem solving training where and when needed
* Facilitate plant problem solving sessions
* Review progress and report on effectiveness of problem solving
* Share monthly reports on improvement teams progress as part of loss eradication
Support Plant achievement of KPI targets and results.
* Verify KPI results tracking for excellence program
* Support KPI training / education at all levels
* Ensure the accurate and timely submission of monthly ManEx reporting info
Development of ManEx work practices for all Pillars
* Coaches, mentors and guides management and other functional teams on ManEx principles and work practices.
* Ensures the ongoing development and review of ManEx and facilitates the development and implementation of appropriate ManEx induction programmes to ensure continuity with respect to newly appointed staff.
Experience & Academic Requirements
A degree in Engineering, Food Science or a related field.
Additional Business Qualification will be an added advantage.
5 years experience in manufacturing environment including 3 years experience in implementing operational excellence program in production or manufacturing environment.
Six Sigma training and post certification experience will be an added advantage.
Experience of working in a matrix-structured organization.
Key Competency Requirements
Excellent interpersonal & influencing skills
Effective planning & organizing
Results orientation
Ability to work under challenging conditions
Manufacturing Excellence Program
Effective leadership and track record of building high performing teams
Analytical, reporting and communication
Coaching and mentorship

Title: Senior Business Analyst – Supply Chain (H/F)
Description:
Créé en 1986 et côté à la Bourse de Casablanca depuis 2008, le Groupe marocain LabelVie est un acteur économique de référence et leader de la grande distribution au Maroc.
En 2009, à travers la signature du contrat de franchise avec le Groupe Carrefour, il accède à sa centrale d’achat pour optimiser et diversifier son sourcing. Il devient ainsi le premier acteur multi-formats de la grande distribution au Maroc par l’exploitation des hypermarchés Carrefour, des supermarchés Carrefour Market et du format hyper cash Atacadao.
Le Groupe LabelVie présente chaque année un plan de développement soutenu renforçant sa présence territoriale avec ses 136 magasins répartis dans 28 villes du royaume et ses 3 plateformes logistiques et un chiffre d’affaires réalisé de 11,7 milliards de dirhams en 2021.
En 2021, le Groupe LabelVie a entamé sa transformation digitale afin de répondre aux enjeux d’innovation et aux besoins des consommateurs finaux. Ce sont ainsi de nombreux projets structurants qui sont actuellement en construction au sein du Groupe pilotés par nos équipes SI, Digital et Data ; constituées d’experts reconnus dans leur domaines et animés par la volonté de relever les challenges de l’innovation et de la transformation digitale dans un secteur en plein essor.
En tant que Business Analyst Supply Chain Senior (H/F) au sein d’une squad agile dédiée à l’implémentation d’une solution de Supply Chain planning, vous serez responsable de :
• Analyse des besoins et définition des spécifications : Collaborer étroitement avec les parties prenantes pour comprendre les exigences fonctionnelles du métier et les formaliser en spécifications claires et concises;
• Conception fonctionnelle : Participer à la conception et à la modélisation des processus et proposer des solutions fonctionnelles et techniques pour résoudre les opportunités identifiées;
• Validation et test : Collaborer étroitement avec les parties prenantes pour garantir que les fonctionnalités répondent aux exigences métier et participer aux tests pour s’assurer de la conformité des livrables;
• Analyse des données et des performances : Effectuer des analyses et des évaluations régulières des solutions en place. Identifier les opportunités d'amélioration et proposer des évolutions.
• Communication et support : Agir en tant que point de contact central des différentes parties prenantes;
• Participation aux cérémonies agiles : Contribuer aux rituels agiles tels que les daily stand-up, les réunions de planification, les revues du backlog et les rétrospectives. Collaborer avec les membres de l'équipe pour assurer la compréhension commune des objectifs et l'alignement incessant sur les priorités.....
Profil recherché :
Issu(e) d’une formation Bac+5 d’une grande école d’ingénieurs, de commerce ou équivalent, avec une spécialisation en Supply Chain, vous justifiez d’une expérience confirmée de 3 à 5 ans minimum dans des fonctions similaires, démontrant une maîtrise des enjeux opérationnels et analytiques du métier.
« Label'vie s’engage à prévenir toute forme de discrimination et notamment celles fondées sur le sexe, la condition physique ou mentale ou la situation et les responsabilités familiales. Label'vie s’engage à promouvoir l’égalité des chances entre les hommes et les femmes, en matière d’accès à l’emploi et à la formation, de conditions de travail, de rémunération, d’évolution de carrière et d’accès à des postes à responsabilité ».

Title: Senior Technical Office Engineer – Architectural
Description:
As a Senior Technical Office Engineer – Architectural, you will play a crucial role in overseeing and managing the technical aspects of architectural engineering projects. This position involves in-depth review, coordination, and approval of shop drawings, addressing technical issues, and ensuring compliance with project standards and specifications.
Your responsibilities will encompass the following key areas:
Shop Drawing Log Management:
Update the shop drawing log with relevant information before submitting drawings to the consultant for approval.
Ensure accuracy and compliance with project design and specifications in all architectural shop drawings.
Request for Information (RFI) Preparation:
Identify and prepare RFIs for any missing, unclear, or conflicting technical information during construction.
Coordinate the resolution of technical matters with the project consultant.
Sub-Contractor and Outsourced Shop Drawing Review:
Review shop drawings submitted by subcontractors and external vendors.
Coordinate the approval process with the project consultant, addressing any discrepancies or concerns.
Technical Issue Resolution:
Participate in resolving unexpected technical difficulties and problems that may arise during construction.
Report issues to the Technical Office Manager for discussion and implementation of proper solutions.
As-Built Drawings:
Prepare accurate as-built drawings at the conclusion of the project.
Hand over completed drawings to the project consultant for record-keeping.
Compliance and Standard Adherence:
Ensure that all work complies with project standards, industry codes, specifications, and design instructions.
Conduct regular checks to confirm adherence to established guidelines.
Construction Detail Preparation:
Prepare detailed drawings required for all architectural construction items, ensuring clarity and accuracy.
Coordination with Different Disciplines:
Collaborate with other disciplines, including civil and MEP teams.
Ensure coordination and integration of architectural drawings with drawings from other disciplines.
To excel in this role, candidates should possess the following qualifications and attributes:
Bachelor's degree in Architectural Engineering.
(cumulative grade must not be less than Good)
.
4 - 6 years of experience in architectural shop drawings, with a focus on medical mega projects.
Proficiency in AutoCAD, and other relevant software.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.

Lapaire, See beyond.

Développer les ventes de l’agence d’optique
Aller directement au contact des prospects sur le terrain aux abords de l’agence, ou dans le périmètre de celle-ci

Conseiller les clients dans leur choix de montures

Veiller à la propreté globale et au confort de l’agence

BAC + 2 minimum en Gestion commerciale ou formation similaire

Le/La candidat(e) doit être très à l’aise avec les nouvelles technologies, applications mobiles et logiciels sur tablette !

Positif: Vous ne montrez pas vos émotions et restez positif et engagé avec vos clients

Commercial dans l’âme: Vous êtes motivé par la performance et l’envie de convaincre

Toujours à l’heure !

The Export Manager is responsible for developing and managing the company’s international sales operations and opening new markets across target global markets. This role focuses on expanding market presence, business development activities, building strategic partnerships, and driving export sales of premium, naturally sourced food products.
This position requires strong expertise in international business development and sales, export regulations, global distribution channels, and managing relationships with distributors, importers, and key accounts.
Location

Export Sales Strategy & Market Expansion

Identify new international markets, distributors, and business opportunities.
Conduct market analysis covering pricing, competition, regulations, and consumer trends.
·       Lead strategic expansion initiatives across key regions (GCC, Europe, Africa, Asia, etc.).
Distributor & Client Management
Establish and maintain strong relationships with international distributors and key account partners.
Negotiate commercial terms, pricing models, and annual business agreements.
Monitor distributor performance and support them in achieving annual sales targets.
Maintain strong long-term relationships with importers, wholesalers, and retail partners.

Ensure compliance with international regulations, customs procedures, and trade requirements.
Coordinate with freight forwarders, logistics, and quality teams to ensure timely shipments.

Ensure adherence to global trade regulations, export requirements, and controls.
Monitor changes in trade laws, tariffs, and certifications required for global markets.
Resolve export-related issues including customs delays, non-compliance cases, and documentation discrepancies.
Pricing, Forecasting & Reporting
Develop export pricing structures aligned with market conditions and cost indicators.
Forecast sales volumes, trends, and budgets for international markets.
Prepare periodic reports on market performance, opportunities, and challenges.
Trade Marketing & Brand Growth
Coordinate with Marketing to execute international campaigns and promotional activities.
Manage product registrations and labeling requirements for each market.
Evaluate the effectiveness of trade marketing investments in each region.
Cross-Functional Alignment
Collaborate with marketing, production, supply chain, finance, and quality departments to fulfill export requirements.
Ensure production capacity aligns with export demand forecasts.
Provide market information to support product development initiatives.
Educational Background and Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in business, Logistics, International Trade, or related field.
Minimum +
10 years of experience
in FMCG and/or Agriculture export sales, preferably in premium food products.
Special Certifications, Licenses, Accreditations:
CITP, CITS, CSCP, or CILT—are preferable.
Technical Skills
Strong knowledge of international trade regulations, business development, export documentation, and customs requirements.
Expertise in Incoterms, shipping terms, freight negotiation, and global logistics.
Proficiency in export compliance processes, including certificates of origin, health certificates, and quality documentation.
Solid understanding of FMCG market dynamics, especially in premium food categories.
Proficiency in ERP systems such as (SAP, Oracle, Odoo) and CRM platforms.
Soft Skills
Excellent communication and negotiation abilities with international clients and partners.
Strong leadership and team management skills to drive export performance.
Strategic thinking with the ability to make data-driven decisions.
Strong problem-solving skills, especially in logistics, customer issues, and documentation challenges.
Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple markets simultaneously.
Exceptional relationship-building skills with distributors, importers, and key accounts.
High attention to detail with strong organizational and planning capabilities.
Strong presentation and business communication skills

Title: Payroll Supervisor
Description:
1.0 Job Purpose.
To oversee and manage the company’s payroll functions, ensuring pay is processed on time, accurately, and in compliance with government regulations. This role involves supervising the payroll team, managing payroll data, resolving discrepancies, and preparing necessary reports.
2.0 Key Accountabilities/ Responsibilities
Job Duties and Key Responsibility Areas
(What is Done, to What, and Why)
Supervise and coordinate the activities of the payroll staff, providing training, guidance, and performance feedback.
Ensure the timely and accurate processing of multi-state payrolls, including wages, benefits, garnishments, taxes, and other deductions.
Review and verify payroll data, such as hours worked, leave, and commissions, to ensure accuracy before processing.
Ensure compliance with all federal, state, and local payroll, wage, and hour laws and best practices.
Prepare and submit all necessary payroll-related reports, including tax filings, year-end reports, and ad-hoc management reports.
Reconcile payroll prior to transmission and validate confirmed reports.
Serve as the primary point of contact for employee inquiries regarding pay, deductions, and payroll policies.
Collaborate with HR and Accounting departments to ensure seamless integration of payroll with benefits and the general ledger.
Identify and recommend updates to payroll processing software, systems, and procedures to improve efficiency and accuracy.
Manage payroll system configurations, including setting up new pay codes, deduction codes, and tax jurisdictions.
Implement “Performance Management the Alliad Way” by setting KPI’s for direct reports (if assigned any), conduct regular reviews, identify training requirements and provide a coaching, mentoring and supportive role.
Ensures adherence to quality standards and applicable regulatory requirements in Food Safety, Occupational Health & Safety, and Environment.

(Comment on any specific factors that affect the job and how the job is performed, such as special conditions, travel, work pressure, etc.)

The incumbent must be able to manage multiple priorities, handle pressure during peak processing periods (e.g., year-end), and stay current with frequently changing payroll laws and regulations.
6.0
BRAND BEHAVIORS
Category
Winning Behaviors
(behavior definition and a description of how the employee is expected to exhibit the behavior in the role)
Core
WIDER IMPACT. Our company doesn’t work in a vacuum. Consider the wider implications of all your activity outside the sphere of the business and strive to ensure that everything you do also creates positive change in the world around you.
Core
ACCOUNTABILITY. We empower and support you so you can do your job to your best ability. That also means you’re accountable for achieving the results for which you’re responsible, including budgets when relevant.
Core
OWNERSHIP. Take ownership of your task and deliver the outcome without passing on responsibility or blaming others. Always try to work from an accurate view of the business as it affects you and feel confident to suggest ways to improve it.
Core
DECISION MAKING. Better Decision Making Within the Team. You are to collaborate within your own team and across teams through better and effective communication, not just bouncing emails back and forth. Decisions need to be based on long-term results and not just one-time event.
Core
RESPONSIVE. Adapting quickly to challenging situations is part of our DNA, so address any issue with the sense of care and urgency it deserves. Don’t let it go until it’s resolved, the problem solved, or the task completed; not until it’s passed on to the next person to reply or act.
Core
COMPANY WIDE. Keep in mind the benefit of the whole company, not just yourself or your own department as we all have a bigger common interest. If Alliad succeeds, we all succeed.

Certified Payroll Professional (CPP) designation is highly preferred.
7.2 Work Experience
Minimum of 5-7 years of direct experience in payroll processing.
At least 2 years of experience in a supervisory or lead payroll role.
Experience with multi-state payroll and tax regulations.
7.3 Technical Skills & Knowledge
In-depth knowledge of payroll principles, practices, and federal/state regulations.
High proficiency with payroll software (e.g., ADP, Workday, Ceridian) and HRIS systems.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel (VLOOKUP, pivot tables, formulas).
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
High level of integrity and ability to handle confidential information.

Legal Experience
The key responsibilities will include supporting the Company Secretary/Head of Legal & Compliance. The Senior Legal & Governance Counsel’s duties will include but not be limited to the following:
Identifying and evaluating the legal risks to which Prudential Zenith is exposed, drawing them to the attention of the various units which they affect and giving counsel to the various members of Management who need to make decisions on the best approach for Prudential Zenith to take in addressing and dealing with the issues raised.

Assisting the Risk & the Compliance teams to establish, update, classify and assess the legal risk and the regulatory universe.
Reducing Prudential Zenith’s documentation risks by ensuring all legal requirements have been fully addressed and complied with.
Giving accurate instructions to Prudential Zenith external law firms and ensuring that the documentation drafted complies with Prudential Zenith Life Insurance requirements.
Seeking legal opinions and advice on complex matters and new legal developments which impact or have the potential to impact the environment in which Prudential Zenith Life Insurance operates.
Governance
Providing the Head of Legal with guidance and advice on governance matters and on relevant laws and regulations. Facilitating training and knowledge building sessions for the Legal and Compliance Department to effectively manage risk. Advising on regulatory frameworks governing ESG and other corporate sustainability initiatives Ensuring that the governance regulatory compliance in Prudential Zenith are properly carried out in accordance with extant laws, regulations and the Group Governance guidelines for Prudential plc. Assisting with induction, orientation, on-going training and education of Directors, including assessing the specific training needs of directors and executive management in their fiduciary and other governance responsibilities. Providing a central source of guidance and advise to the Company, on matters of good governance and of changes in legislation. Ensuring that the Company adheres to the Prudential Group Governance guidelines. Assisting the Company Secretary/ Head of Legal & Compliance with governance reviews, best practice on the annual evaluation, training and development of the Board. Managing shareholder engagement with the Africa Regional Hub (ARH) and associate companies including any monthly or other reporting requirements. Preparing and submitting required reports to ARH and government agencies including the Corporate Affairs Commission (CAC), Financial Reporting Council (FRC) and the National Insurance Commission (NAICOM).
Advisory
Supporting or representing the Company Secretary/Head of Legal & Compliance on providing advice on any HR, business development or compliance matters.
Raising awareness of any legal developments that may affect Prudential Zenith and evaluating any legal ramifications that may have an effect on Prudential Zenith Life Insurance.
Explaining complex legal issues to all levels of staff and giving opinions and recommendations on various legal matters. Analysing new laws and regulations, assessing their impact on Prudential Zenith and advising on the same.
Ensuring that Prudential Zenith’s reputation/image is adequately safe-guarded and maintained with regard to the business principles and policies and business risk adopted within Prudential Zenith’s operations.
Management of litigation matters by pro-actively managing and monitoring significant and material litigation by or against Prudential Zenith businesses to minimize Prudential Zenith’s loss arising from the court matters.
Learning and development
Developing in-house training programs and materials to ensure widespread awareness of legal issues to members of the sales and support departments.
Enhancing liaisons with the ARH to enhance knowledge of prudential policies pieces and other emerging issues.
Financial stewardship
Participating and supporting in the budget process of Legal & Governance Function in Prudential Zenith Life Insurance;
Supporting the legal teams in Prudential Zenith to ensure that they minimizing loss arising from contingent legal risks and/or litigation.
Supporting the Legal & Governance functions across Prudential Zenith to ensure the timely delivery of service and proper accountability for budgets.

Title: Leerkracht invalpool
Description:
Omschrijving organisatie
Wij zijn dé verbinder in werk waar mensen zin in hebben en zin in houden. Elke leerling verdient een goede leraar voor de klas. Wil jij ook van betekenis zijn voor het Nederlandse onderwijs? Of je nu op zoek bent naar een vaste baan of liever als invaller in het onderwijs aan de slag gaat, we gaan samen op zoek naar de beste match.
Maandag® is met 46 vestigingen in 16 steden al meer dan 30 jaar leidend als detacheerder binnen het publieke domein in Nederland. De afgelopen 2 jaar is er, mede door overnames, een sterke groei gerealiseerd. Naast detachering biedt Maandag® ook ZZP-bemiddeling en HR-dienstverlening zoals RPO (recruitment proces outsourcing) en MSP (managed service provider).
Daarmee is Maandag® dé verbinder in werk waar mensen zin in hebben en zin in houden, in zowel de publieke- als commerciële sector. Dagelijks zijn meer dan 4.000 professionals actief binnen de zorg, het onderwijs, de overheid, IT, finance, HR en communicatie.
Functieomschrijving
Wij nodigen u alleen uit te solliciteren als u voldoet aan het gevraagde functieprofiel. Andere sollicitaties zullen niet in behandeling worden genomen.
Over de functie
Ben jij (bijna) afgestudeerd aan de Pabo en wil je graag ervaring opdoen in het primair onderwijs? Wij zoeken enthousiaste, leergierige leerkrachten voor onze invalpool. Geen losse dagdiensten, maar langdurige vervangingen waar jij écht een band met de groep kunt opbouwen. In jouw klas krijgt ieder kind de ruimte om zich op zijn eigen tempo en op zijn eigen manier te ontwikkelen. Met heldere uitleg, creatieve lessen en oprechte aandacht zorg jij voor een veilige en fijne sfeer waarin kinderen zich gezien en gewaardeerd voelen. Of het nu gaat om taal, rekenen of samenwerken, jij helpt hen met plezier stap voor stap verder. In jouw groep krijgt ieder kind de kans om zich op zijn eigen tempo en manier te ontwikkelen. Met duidelijke uitleg, creatieve lessen en jouw warme benadering zorg je ervoor dat leerlingen zich gezien en gewaardeerd voelen. Of het nu gaat om rekenen, taal of samenwerken, jij helpt hen stap voor stap verder. In een langdurige vervanging breng jij rust, structuur en continuïteit. Je bouwt aan vertrouwen, maakt verbinding en zorgt ervoor dat de groep soepel kan doorgaan met leren. Jij houdt overzicht, brengt duidelijkheid en weet tegelijk hoe je plezier en energie in de klas houdt. Of het nu gaat om taal, rekenen of een creatieve opdracht, jij maakt er samen met de leerlingen iets moois van. En dat doe je niet alleen. Samen met collega’s denk je mee over goed onderwijs en zorg je voor een prettige sfeer op school, zowel voor de leerlingen als voor elkaar.
Functie-eisen
Je hebt een Pabo-diploma (of rondt dit binnenkort af).
Je bent flexibel en kunt goed schakelen tussen verschillende groepen of niveaus.
Je denkt in oplossingen, straalt rust uit en staat stevig in je schoenen.
Je vindt het fijn om langere tijd op één plek te werken en écht onderdeel te worden van een team.
De opdrachtgever
Voor verschillende fijne en betrokken basisscholen zoeken wij leerkrachten die plezier halen uit het begeleiden en lesgeven van kinderen. De scholen staan bekend om hun duidelijke structuur, veilige pedagogische klimaat en teams die nauw samenwerken om het beste uit ieder kind te halen. Er wordt gewerkt met moderne lesmethodes en er is veel aandacht voor persoonlijke groei, zowel van leerlingen als van leerkrachten. In een langdurige vervanging krijg je de ruimte om jouw eigen onderwijsstijl in te zetten, mee te denken over onderwijsontwikkeling en een positieve bijdrage te leveren aan een stabiele, fijne leeromgeving.
Dit bieden we jou
Salaris
Goed salaris op basis van je kennis en ervaring.
Persoonlijke begeleiding
Je kunt altijd rekenen op jouw contactpersoon.
Breed netwerk
Met interessante opdrachtgevers in allerlei sectoren.
Eindejaarsuitkering
In december ontvang je (een deel) extra bruto maandsalaris. De hoogte is vastgelegd in de CAO.
Maandag® Academy
Groot aanbod van trainingen en cursussen.
Reiskostenvergoeding
Afhankelijk van de functie en rol kunnen er verschillende opties zijn.

Title: Secrétaire général (F/H) - Institut français de la République démocratique du Congo - Kinshasa
