Title: People Analytics Analyst
Description:
About The Role
We’re looking for a People Analytics Analyst who can turn workforce data into insights that guide smarter decisions across Recruitment, Customer Success, Team Operations, and the broader organization. If analyzing people trends, optimizing hiring funnels, and building models that help leaders plan ahead sound exciting to you, this role could be a great fit.
What You'll Do
Workforce and Performance Insights: Track capacity, productivity, pass rates, and staffing trends across internal departments; analyze workload distribution to identify when teams need additional support; provide recommendations based on people data to improve efficiency and staffing alignment.
Forecasting and Predictive Models: Build forecasting models for attrition, staffing needs, and hiring demand; create scenario plans for seasonal changes, service expansions, and operational shifts; present data-backed options that support leadership decision-making.
Recruitment Funnel Analytics: Review recruitment metrics such as application flow, pass rates, and interview-to-hire ratios; strengthen forecasting for applicant supply and expected hiring volume; suggest improvements to workflows and funnel efficiency.
Reporting and Dashboards: Develop dashboards and reports for Recruitment, Sales, CS, and Ops; prepare monthly workforce and people insights for leadership; ensure consistent and accurate views of people data across teams.
Data Governance and AI Support: Partner with Engineering and Data Management to maintain data accuracy; support AI-based tools such as health scores, bandwidth scores, and internal dashboards; identify and resolve gaps in data collection and structure.
What We're Looking For
Bachelor’s degree in Analytics, Statistics, Business, or related fields
5+ years in people analytics, workforce analytics, HR analytics, or similar roles
Strong quantitative and modeling skills
Advanced Excel/Google Sheets proficiency
Experience in BPO, outsourcing, HR, or high-volume recruitment environments is preferred
Technical Requirements
Stable DSL/Cable/Fiber internet (20 Mbps minimum + backup)
Laptop/desktop with at least Core i5/Ryzen 5 and 8GB RAM
Reliable power source and a backup plan or backup workspace
Perks and Benefits
Competitive pay with annual performance-based increases
Paid time off so you can rest and recharge
Health and dental insurance or a health stipend to make you feel your best
Comprehensive health and dental insurance
Holiday bonuses in appreciation of your hard work
Fully remote setup — work from anywhere you're comfortable
Opportunities to grow with us as we scale
If you're passionate about people data and want to make a measurable impact inside a fast-growing organization, we’d love to hear from you. Submit your application and let’s build something great together.

Title: Director of Security
Description:
About Remote
Remote is solving modern organizations’ biggest challenge – navigating global employment compliantly with ease. We make it possible for businesses of all sizes to recruit, pay, and manage international teams. With our core values at heart and future focused work culture, our team works tirelessly on ambitious problems, asynchronously, around the world. You can find Remoters working from 6 different continents (Antarctica left to go!) and all of our positions are fully remote.
We encourage every member of the Remote team to bring their talents, experiences and culture to the table to help us build the best-in-class HR platform.
If you are energetic, curious, motivated and ambitious, be part of our world. Apply now and define the future of work!
Summary
The Director of Security will oversee and lead Remote’s security team and function. They will manage Remote’s security strategy and its implementation to ensure the confidentiality, integrity and availability of the organisation’s systems and information.
Key Responsibilities
Define, implement, communicate and maintain security strategy, policies, goals and requirements aligned with business strategy, and manage security resources, to support the company’s objectives
Work with the Security Council and Remote’s senior leadership in developing Remote’s Information Security vision, strategy and road-map of Remote’s Security function
Recruit and nurture individual growth to build an autonomous and high performing Security team
Be an advocate of information security best practices and proactively looking to improve and drive Remote’s security posture, driving efforts to improve Security Awareness across company
Drive Remote’s security risk management program, by partnering with Legal, Data Protection and Finance in developing and managing our enterprise risk management framework(s), and collaborating with senior leaders in reducing Information Security risks
Manage and improve upon our Application Security initiatives and personnel to make sure Remote is delivering the most secure Platform possible to its customers
Build a Security Incident Response processes and culture within the Security Team
Report to Remote’s top management about security risks, threats and their potential impact, incidents and security performance
Drive security compliance requirements from customers, standards and regulations
Supervise the management and improvement of Remote’s ISMS as defined in Remote’s ISMS roles and responsibilities document
Requirements
Extensive experience managing security teams, including people, resources, stakeholders and security service management
Certified in cybersecurity management, e.g. CISSP, CISM etc.
Understands the leadership responsibilities and prioritizes execution of company-wide strategy
Experience in cyber security strategy management and implementation and fostering a security culture
Proficient with security principles, technologies and security engineering domains
Ability to clearly articulate security issues to all types of business stakeholders, including Board members
Ability to navigate through ambiguous problems in a hyper-growth environment
Excellent writing and communication skills
Etiquette
Solid display of Remote’s 💎Values
Proactively seeks new tools and frameworks that can improve the team's productivity
Clearly communicates needs and requirements to optimize productivity
Fosters feedback and mentoring within the security team
Suggests new initiatives and approaches to current problems
Helps everyone grow continuously
Clearly aligns mission and vision within the security team
Publicly empowers the team and gives visibility to the work group successes
Practicals
You'll report to: VP, Engineering
Direct reports: Four
Team: Security
Location: EMEA / AMER
Start date: As soon as possible
Application process
Interview with recruiter
Interview with future manager
Interview with team members
Team interview 2 with the VP, Payments & Risk Operations
Team Interview 3 with the Chief Legal Officer
Bar Raiser Interview
Executive Interview
Prior employment verification check
Remote's Total Rewards philosophy is to ensure fair, unbiased compensation and fair equity pay along with competitive benefits in all locations in which we operate. We do not agree to or encourage cheap-labor practices and therefore we ensure to pay above in-location rates. We hope to inspire other companies to support global talent-hiring and bring local wealth to developing countries.
At first glance our salary bands seem quite wide - here is some context. At Remote we have international operations and a globally distributed workforce. We use geo ranges to consider geographic pay differentials as part of our global compensation strategy to remain competitive in various markets while we hiring globally.
Our salary ranges are determined by role, level and location, and our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay for the successful candidate in this role is dependent upon many factors such as location, transferable or job-related skills, work experience, relevant training, business needs, and market demands. The base salary range may be subject to change.
At Remote, we foster internal mobility as a key element of our culture of employee growth and development, supported by a compensation philosophy that guarantees pay equity and fairness. Therefore, all compensation changes associated with an internal move will be reviewed by the Total Rewards & People Enablement team on a case by case basis.
The annual salary range for this full-time position is
$80,250—$180,550 USD
Benefits
Our full benefits & perks are explained in our handbook at remote.com/r/benefits. As a global company, each country works differently, but some benefits/perks are for all Remoters:
work from anywhere
flexible paid time off
flexible working hours (we are async)
16 weeks paid parental leave
mental health support services
stock options
learning budget
home office budget & IT equipment
budget for local in-person social events or co-working spaces
How You’ll Plan Your Day (and Life)
We work async at Remote which means you can plan your schedule around your life (and not around meetings). Read more at remote.com/async.
You will be empowered to take ownership and be proactive. When in doubt you will default to action instead of waiting. Your
life-work balance
is important and you will be encouraged to put yourself and your family first, and fit work around your needs.
If that sounds like something you want, apply now!
How To Apply
Please fill out the form below and upload your CV with a PDF format.
We kindly ask you to submit your application and CV in English, as this is the standardised language we use here at Remote.
If you don’t have an up to date CV but you are still interested in talking to us, please feel free to add a copy of your LinkedIn profile instead.
Not only do we encourage folks from all ethnic groups, genders, sexuality, age, abilities, disability status and any other under-represented group to apply, but we prioritize a sense of belonging. We have 4 ERGs (Women, Disability, Queer, Minorities in Tech) who meet regularly with the People team. During your interviews and beyond, we ask & encourage anybody who needs an accommodation to request one from their recruiter.
We will ask you to voluntarily tell us your pronouns at interview stage, and you will have the option to answer our anonymous demographic questionnaire when you apply below. As an equal employment opportunity employer it’s important to us that our workforce reflects people of all backgrounds, identities, and experiences and this data will help us to stay accountable. We thank you for providing this data, if you chose to.
At Remote, we embrace AI as a valuable tool while prioritizing human creativity and authenticity. We look forward to meeting candidates who balance innovation with genuine expertise and experience. To learn more about Remote's AI guidelines check see here.
Please note we accept applications on an ongoing basis.

Title: Talent Acquisition Manager
Location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
Description:
Overview
This role owns high-volume agent recruitment end-to-end. You’re expected to run a tight operation, hit aggressive hiring targets, and keep the talent pipeline predictable. If a process is slow, noisy, or inefficient, you fix it. The Recruitment Manager leads the team, the workflow, and the output.
Key Responsibilities
1. Hiring Delivery and Capacity Management
Build and execute a volume hiring strategy aligned with calibrated demand forecasts.
Own weekly, monthly, and quarterly hiring commitments for agent-level roles.
Optimize funnel ratios from sourcing to Day 1; identify choke points and remove them fast.
Maintain readiness for surge hiring, seasonal peaks, and sudden client ramps.
2. Team Leadership and Performance Management
Manage and develop Recruiters and Recruitment Coordinators; set clear performance standards.
Drive a culture of speed, accuracy, and high-touch candidate experience.
Train the team on assessment quality, behavioral probing, and data-driven decision-making.
Conduct regular performance reviews, coaching, and workflow corrections.
3. Stakeholder and Client Management
Partner with Operations, Workforce Management, Training, and HRBP to align on demand, selection criteria, and onboarding readiness.
Act as the escalation point for hiring delays, offer fallout, and process bottlenecks.
Present weekly insights and hiring dashboards to senior leadership; recommend actions, not excuses.
4. Process Excellence and Compliance
Maintain a disciplined recruitment process across sourcing, screening, assessments, and onboarding.
Ensure compliance with data privacy, labor regulations, and company policies.
Audit recruiter workflow quality; enforce standardized assessments and strict documentation.
5. Sourcing Strategy and Market Intelligence
Build and manage sourcing channels: job boards, referrals, events, campuses, and community partnerships.
Track competitor hiring trends, salary benchmarks, and talent supply fluctuations.
Experiment, test, and deploy sourcing tactics that reduce cost per hire and time to fill.
6. Technology, Reporting, and Analytics
Oversee ATS hygiene and drive dataset accuracy for reporting.
Generate insights on funnel performance, recruiter productivity, and hiring forecasts.
Identify automation gaps and propose AI-enabled enhancements for screening and scheduling.
Minumum Qualifications
10 years in recruitment, with at least 2 years of experience as a Manager supporting BPO environment.
Proven track record of meeting or beating hiring targets in a fast-paced environment.
Strong command of recruitment analytics, workforce forecasting, and process optimization.
Skilled at stakeholder management, communication, and conflict resolution.
Experience with Workday, or similar ATS platforms is an advantage.

Title: People Analytics Analyst
Location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
Description:
About The Role
We’re looking for a People Analytics Analyst who can turn workforce data into insights that guide smarter decisions across Recruitment, Customer Success, Team Operations, and the broader organization. If analyzing people trends, optimizing hiring funnels, and building models that help leaders plan ahead sound exciting to you, this role could be a great fit.
What You'll Do
Workforce and Performance Insights: Track capacity, productivity, pass rates, and staffing trends across internal departments; analyze workload distribution to identify when teams need additional support; provide recommendations based on people data to improve efficiency and staffing alignment.
Forecasting and Predictive Models: Build forecasting models for attrition, staffing needs, and hiring demand; create scenario plans for seasonal changes, service expansions, and operational shifts; present data-backed options that support leadership decision-making.
Recruitment Funnel Analytics: Review recruitment metrics such as application flow, pass rates, and interview-to-hire ratios; strengthen forecasting for applicant supply and expected hiring volume; suggest improvements to workflows and funnel efficiency.
Reporting and Dashboards: Develop dashboards and reports for Recruitment, Sales, CS, and Ops; prepare monthly workforce and people insights for leadership; ensure consistent and accurate views of people data across teams.
Data Governance and AI Support: Partner with Engineering and Data Management to maintain data accuracy; support AI-based tools such as health scores, bandwidth scores, and internal dashboards; identify and resolve gaps in data collection and structure.
What We're Looking For
Bachelor’s degree in Analytics, Statistics, Business, or related fields
5+ years in people analytics, workforce analytics, HR analytics, or similar roles
Strong quantitative and modeling skills
Advanced Excel/Google Sheets proficiency
Experience in BPO, outsourcing, HR, or high-volume recruitment environments is preferred
Technical Requirements
Stable DSL/Cable/Fiber internet (20 Mbps minimum + backup)
Laptop/desktop with at least Core i5/Ryzen 5 and 8GB RAM
Reliable power source and a backup plan or backup workspace
Perks and Benefits
Competitive pay with annual performance-based increases
Paid time off so you can rest and recharge
Health and dental insurance or a health stipend to make you feel your best
Comprehensive health and dental insurance
Holiday bonuses in appreciation of your hard work
Fully remote setup — work from anywhere you're comfortable
Opportunities to grow with us as we scale
If you're passionate about people data and want to make a measurable impact inside a fast-growing organization, we’d love to hear from you. Submit your application and let’s build something great together.

Experience & Qualifications Required:

OR

Work that you want to talk about

Title: Sr Account Executive Enterprise
Description:
Genesys empowers organizations of all sizes to improve loyalty and business outcomes by creating the best experiences for their customers and employees. Through Genesys Cloud, the AI-powered Experience Orchestration platform, organizations can accelerate growth by delivering empathetic, personalized experiences at scale to drive customer loyalty, workforce engagement, efficiency and operational improvements.
We employ more than 6,000 people across the globe who embrace empathy and cultivate collaboration to succeed. And, while we offer great benefits and perks like larger tech companies, our employees have the independence to make a larger impact on the company and take ownership of their work. Join the team and create the future of customer experience together.
Are you a highly motivated digital native with a passion for working with leading edge software technologies in an international environment?
Do you want to be part of a global company that is a recognized leader in the customer experience space?
Do you enjoy complex sales engagements, hunting for new business and working with market leading solutions?
Are you open-minded for new sales strategies and willing to learn in a strong Sales team with an experienced Sales Coach?
Are you someone that can demonstrate your achievements and successes?
If you said yes, then we would love to hear from you!
The Role:
Genesys is hiring a professional for a Sr Account Executive role in the Enterprise African Market team, to address respective markets with our CX portfolio. At Genesys, our Sr Account Executive are the catalyst behind the growth and success of the company and carry responsibility for all sales opportunities across the Enterprise business segments. In this role you act as a consultative sales professional, take ownership for dedicated key accounts, position the full Genesys solution portfolio, develop and manage a sales pipeline, secure net-new business and drive revenue growth in a defined key account setup. In co-working with other Account Executives as well as a Sales Leader & Coach you will learn from experienced Genesys Employees as part of a verticalized Sales Team.
The Sr Account Executive´s main goal is to achieve an annual sales target together with his AE colleagues by converting as many key account opportunities into won business as possible. Once an opportunity has been closed, the Account Team´s role is to engage with the appropriate internal cross functional team (PS, CSM, TAM and Renewal Team) to help manage the initial phases of post-sales support and ensure the implementation is set up accordingly.
What we look for and expect from the right individual is:
Bringing in, developing and maintaining relationships with key account clients
Being part of numerous complex and consultative sales engagements
Selling complex software solutions to Enterprise customers
Jointly developing account and opportunity plans based on MEDDPICC
Generating sales driven pipeline by having a strong outbound/outreach cadence on weekly basis
Orchestrating a cross functional team and partner ecosystem
Identifying customer/project demands and mapping to the Genesys portfolio
Being a team player and a leader of virtual teams, able to orchestrate and win complex sales cycles
Taking revenue responsibility and carrying of a sales quota
Required qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in computer sciences, business, Business Administration, Marketing or similar education
up to 10 years of professional sales experience – ideally in Key Account Management and Hunting
Experience in positioning and selling Enterprise SaaS solutions (CX experience is a plus)
Enthusiasm for customer service and customer experience management
Maximum demands on the quality of your work as well as a high degree of sales and customer orientation
Strong knowledge of the tech ecosystem in the African market
Committed, proactive, result-oriented and team player
Self-assured appearance and pronounced presentation skills
Fluent English
Strong success orientation
Willingness to travel frequently (up to 30%)
Why Genesys:
Genesys empowers organisations to deliver the best customer and employee experiences through cloud, digital and AI-driven solutions. Through our market-leading platform in over 100 countries, we’re helping our customers drive loyalty, transform their operations and grow.
Join us and become part of a global team of passionate professionals who believe that outstanding customer engagement drives business success.
Genesys is an equal-opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) in the workplace.
Ready to make an impact?
Apply today and help shape the future of Customer Experience with Genesys.
If a Genesys employee referred you, please use the link they sent you to apply.
About Genesys:
Genesys® empowers more than 8,000 organizations worldwide to create the best customer and employee experiences. With agentic AI at its core, Genesys Cloud™ is the AI-Powered Experience Orchestration platform that connects people, systems, data and AI across the enterprise. As a result, organizations can drive customer loyalty, growth and retention while increasing operational efficiency and teamwork across human and AI workforces. To learn more, visit www.genesys.com.

Description:

Case Manager (
Sales Closer
)
JOB ID
ROBTIA5 (8 FTE)
INDUSTRY
Holistic Health Care Facility
LOCATION
South Africa

Full Time

9:00am to 1:00pm and 2:00pm to 7:00pm EST Monday to Friday
9:00am to 1:00pm EST on Friday

$2500 + Rewarding Bonus Structure
TARGET START DATE
ASAP
ROLE OVERVIEW
About the Client:
A leading holistic healthcare and weight loss clinic in Newnan, Georgia. With over 28 years of experience, they have helped over 50,000 individuals address the root cause of their health and weight concerns. Their personalized programs focus on natural, non-invasive treatments, including dietary adjustments, nutritional supplements, and lifestyle changes, empowering the body to heal itself. Each program is tailored to the individual, ensuring unique care for every patient. The goal is to support long-term health and wellness.
About the Role:
The Case Manager (Sales Closer) is pivotal in helping as many people as possible receive life-improving natural healthcare. Your primary purpose is to help prospective patients/clients overcome any
financial barriers or blocks
that would otherwise prevent them from receiving the care our facility offers. You are a key player in expanding our reach and mission.
Key Responsibilities
Your responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Consultation and Sales:
Conduct effective phone or video consultations with prospective patients/clients.
Awareness and Action:
Help raise the prospective patient/client's awareness of their health problem to the point where they are ready and willing to take action, leading to the purchase of the doctor-recommended healthcare plan, products, tests, and/or services.
Patient Quality Control:
Act as a quality control point for existing patients whom you assisted in purchasing care. Ensure they are incredibly happy, succeeding, and doing fantastically well with their plan.
Follow-Up:
Consistently follow up with prospective patients/clients who did not initially purchase the doctor-recommended plan, products, tests, and/or services.
Expert Development:
Commit to ongoing training to become an expert in your craft.
Future Initiatives:
Engage in other sales-oriented activities as they arise and are agreed upon, such as the promotion of new products and services.
Qualifications & Skills
This is 100% remote.
You are required to have a fully functional computer and Wi-Fi in your location.
Your computer must be password protected to ensure HIPAA compliance.
Ideal Characteristics
We are looking for individuals who are not only skilled but embody our holistic mission:
Positive & Upbeat:
Possesses an extremely positive and energetic personality.
Intellectual & Communicative:
Very intelligent, speaks well, and can be clearly understood.
Health Role Model:
Takes care of their own health and practices what they preach.
Driven & Accountable:
Hardworking, willing to go the extra mile, and takes responsibility for themselves and others.
Growth Mindset:
Willing to talk about uncomfortable topics and be uncomfortable.
Willing to step outside their comfort zone to grow and expand as an individual and team member.
Courageous, willing to ask difficult questions, and takes correction well.
Understands there is a lot to learn and is eager to do so.
Compassionate:
Loves helping people and sets a good example as an upstanding member of the community.
Training
Your training period is broken up into 3 parts; your initial 1-week intensive training, your next 2-week follow up training and your ongoing training.
During your initial 1-week intensive training, you may be asked to start earlier, work through some lunches or be available in the evenings or a few hours over the weekend. This is due to the volume of information that you need to learn and your trainer’s availability. The goal is to get our Case Managers up and running as fast as possible without sacrificing training quality and results.
Your second 2-week training period is not as intense, but you still may be asked to dedicate a few hours outside of your normal work hours to fine tune some things that you may need to improve.
Part 3 of your training involves ongoing training. All team members receive ongoing training throughout their employment with us during normal office hours. Much like athletes we know the more you train before the game the better you’ll perform during the game. When you are at your best you can help the greatest amount of people possible and generate the highest amount of income for yourself possible.
Your training consists of multiple, carefully constructed online video and written courses, one-on-one training with your Sales Manager, and group meetings. We take the training of our team members very seriously but we do it in a fun and effective manner.
To apply, please copy and paste the following link into your browser :
https://insideoutva.breezy.hr/p/ace65f5c3ca2-case-manager-sales-closer-job-id-robtia5
Additionally, kindly submit an introductory video or audio (approximately 2 minutes) highlighting your work experience and tenure. Once received, I will be able to schedule you for a meeting immediately.

Title: Economic Incentives Policy Manager
Location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
Description:
Conservation International protects nature for the benefit of humanity. Through science, policy, fieldwork, and finance, we spotlight and secure the most important places in nature for the climate, biodiversity, and for people. With offices in 30 countries and projects in more than 100 countries, Conservation International partners with governments, companies, civil society, Indigenous peoples, and local communities to help people and nature thrive together.
POSITION SUMMARY - This position is based in South Africa or Kenya, with preference for South Africa.
Conservation International (CI) is launching an initiative to strengthen the financial stability of Africa’s Keystone Protected Areas (KPAs). These KPAs are critical for biodiversity conservation and serve as the core of larger ecological systems in landscapes. This will be achieved through technical assistance facilities/ workstreams that will develop conservation finance capacity (at the global, national and KPA level). CI will lead the strategy and management of the program, while working in partnership with co-management partners and local stakeholders to develop, execute and mobilize conservation finance transactions, resulting in financial flows to targeted KPAs during the project period.
CI believes that getting the right policies, rules and incentives in place is essential to achieving our mission. Policies to harness the immediate potential of natural climate solutions (NCS) and environmental incentives are essential to addressing global climate change and biodiversity loss.
The Economic Incentives Policy Manager is responsible for managing the financial incentives and taxes Technical Assistance Facility (TAF) under this program. The overarching goal of this four-year investment is to strengthen the financial stability of Africa’s KPAs by mobilizing at least USD $100 million in conservation finance through innovative mechanisms and enabling policy reform. This position will be a member of the Center for Policy and Incentives team and will report to the Africa Regional Policy Lead.
Responsibilities
Lead the implementation of the Fiscal Incentives and Tax Technical Assistance Facility, including overseeing and advancing the scoping of targeted policy opportunities and then focusing on securing public policies that will support positive incentives for protected areas.
Research and synthesize national and subnational laws, regulations, and policies and prepare focused policy assessments of public policies that could deliver sustainable financing for Keyston Protected Areas in Africa.
Collaborate with a cross divisional team to execute workplans and deliverables for the fiscal taxes and incentives technical assistance facility, ensure integration and complementarity with other technical assistance facilities within the project.
Develop materials, reports, policy recommendations and other written products that will inform on how to use policies to create new incentives/financial mechanisms to encourage sustainable protected areas and landscape models (e.g. Payment for Ecosystem services for regenerative agriculture, fiscal transfers, tax and other fiscal instruments, transition support, market incentives) and to create new funding opportunities for conservation, in line with Conservation International’s communication and reporting standards.
Collaborate with other CI experts to conduct desktop estimates of economic potential for policies for creating or shifting economic incentives for sustainable production and sustainable management, in terrestrial protected areas in Africa.
Provide technical leadership and support to project teams and country offices in advancing, establishing or piloting policies at the national or subnational level that shift incentives and support CI’s objectives which will include providing extensive support to two or more government in engaging with various stakeholders in shaping the policy and legal framework related to fiscal incentives and taxes.
Support liaison efforts between Conservation International and the governments, ensuring effective communication and collaboration throughout the development and implementation of fiscal incentives and taxes that can contribute to protected areas financing and revenue.
Facilitate workshops, meetings, and stakeholder consultations as necessary to gather input and foster collaboration fiscal incentives and taxes policy development process, as part of Conservation International's engagement efforts.
Support donor reporting requirements, including drafting regular progress reports.
Collaborate with the project team, Africa Field Division, Country Programmes and Center for Policy and Incentives team members to ensure that the objectives of the project work are met and to support the broader mission of Conservation International in conserving nature and securing a sustainable future.
Additional Responsibilities
Contribute to global policy initiatives; provide technical input to cross-divisional projects; support knowledge sharing. as required.
People and resource management responsibilities
This job does not have the authority to allocate resources or approve budget expenditures.
This job does not manage staff or direct the work of others.
WORKING CONDITIONS
Work is performed in a typical office environment.
Some international travel expected (25%).
May be asked to work outside of conventional office hours (8am – 5pm).
This role is a fixed-term assignment.
Guidance on flexible work arrangements will be shared during the interview process.
Qualifications
Required
Bachelor's degree in economics and at least 4 to 6 years of relevant experience working on policy and incentives.
Proven record of contributing to the development and execution of applied economic policy or agricultural policies, especially with policies regarding economic incentives.
Understanding of biodiversity, climate change and environmental topics with demonstrated experience with policy analysis.
Strong administrative skills with examples of successful logistical and planning efforts in complex settings related to environmental policy projects.
Courteous, tactful, and a proven ability to work effectively with a wide range of stakeholders, including government officials, conservation organizations, and local communities.
Ability to handle multiple tasks related to policy development and implementation, ensuring that work is completed in a timely and organized manner.
Has excellent written and verbal communication and stakeholder engagement skills.
Strong attention to detail, including the ability to thoroughly review and analyze policy documents and reports for accuracy and compliance with global standards.
Proven ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team framework, especially in the context of policy development, while building effective working relationships with colleagues and external partners.
Has excellent project management skills and is adept working with a dispersed team.
Can manage and complete tasks according to provided timeline framework.
Ability to work well under pressure, multitask, set priorities, and deliver quality results.
Flexibility to work across many time zones where CI operates.
Proficiency in database operations, Microsoft Office applications, and relevant software tools used in policy analysis and reporting.
Preferred
Experience working in a government finance ministry or economic policy think tank with specific focus on Africa.
To apply for this position, please submit a resume and cover letter.
Application Deadline: December 31, 2025 (11:49 PM EST). The position may be filled before the deadline, as applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis.

Identify and execute opportunities for system integration, process automation, and efficiency improvement across all financial functions.
Ensure full compliance with federal, state, and local regulations, as well as loan covenants, insurance requirements, and fund governance standards.
Support audits, financial reviews, and partner with third-party accounting or assurance firms as needed.

Oversee capital allocation, intercompany transfers, distributions, and debt compliance at both fund and company levels.
Lead post-acquisition financial integration, ensuring new PortCos adopt fund-level standards and reporting frameworks.
Provide oversight on cash flow planning
Systems, Reporting, & Insights
Standardize reporting across all companies and ensure consistent use of financial systems (e.g., QuickBooks, NetSuite, or equivalent).
Deliver clear, actionable insights through dashboards, variance analysis, and portfolio-wide financial reports.
Partner with leadership teams to translate financial data into operational strategy and performance improvements.
Team Leadership
Build, lead, and develop a high-performing finance organization across all portfolio companies.
Recruit, train, and mentor Controllers, and Accountants to ensure a unified culture of accountability and excellence.
Foster collaboration between the fund’s executive team and PortCo leadership, promoting alignment and shared success.
Qualifications
Finance MBA and CPA required.
Prior auditing experience (public accounting or audit leadership) required.
5+ years of progressive finance and accounting experience, ideally with exposure to private equity, fund management, or multi-entity portfolio operations.
Demonstrated expertise in financial modeling, budgeting, forecasting, and performance management.
Proven experience managing cross-company financial operations and teams across multiple business units.

Exceptional communication, leadership, and analytical skills with the ability to influence at the executive level.

Partners.

Title: Product Owner
Description:

Join a company that is pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We are renowned for our technical excellence and leading innovations, and for making a difference to our clients and society. Our workplace embraces diversity and inclusion – it’s a place where you can grow, belong and thrive.
Your day at NTT DATA
The Product Owner (PO) is a developing subject matter expert, considered as the content authority for the team level of the Scaled Agile Framework for Enterprises (SAFe). The PO is responsible for a product or service or a number of feature releases, including managing the team backlog, writing, prioritizing and accepting user stories, and representing the customer to the Agile team. They optimize return on investment by ensuring that the Scrum team members are engaged in delivering the most valuable product features.
The role has relevant relationships and responsibilities outside the local team, including working with Product Management to prepare for Program Backlog, participating in Agile Release Train (ART) Synch meetings, and cooperating to deliver Solution value.
Key Responsibilities:
Supports the provision of vision and direction to the Agile development team and stakeholders.

Plans and prioritizes less complex product feature backlog and development for the offer/product.
Fully understand the product vision, roadmap and growth opportunities to enable onward articulation into the development team.
Assesses value, prioritizes backlog items based on this value, time, and other team dependencies determined in the PI planning meeting and refined during the PI, to ensure focus on those with maximum value that are aligned with the offer/product strategy.
Supports with providing backlog management, iteration planning, and elaboration of the user stories.

Leads the planning product release plans and sets expectation for delivery of new functionality/capability

Drives iteration goals and iteration content via prioritized stories.
Establishes story acceptance criteria, accepts stories into the baseline.

Follows business competitors and the industry and keeps abreast with Agile/Scrum/SAFe best practices and new trends and seeks to relentlessly improve the operation of the Product Owner role.
Knowledge and Attributes:
3+ years in Product Ownership or similar roles, preferably in Contact Center or SaaS environments.
Knowledge of the technologies and portfolio of offers.
Knowledge of product development in an ITC industry.
Relevant knowledge of the SAFe’s practices and its application/operation.
Strong communication skills.
Effective escalator and has some conflict resolution skills.
Has collaboration and knowledge brokering skills.
Understands fundamentals of iterative development.
Understands fundamentals of product/ software development processes and procedures.
Understands the value of commitments to delivery made by a development team.
Understands incremental delivery and the value of metrics.
Understands backlog tracking, burndown metrics, velocity, and task definition.
Has the ability to relate to, and integrate with alternate development methodologies (for example, waterfall).
Contact Center Expertise
Strong understanding of contact center operations, call flows, IVR design, and omnichannel strategies.
Familiarity with key metrics (AHT, FCR, CSAT, SLA) and workforce management principles.
Knowledge of compliance standards (GDPR, POPIA) and call recording policies.
Nice to have:
Amazon Connect
Experience designing and managing contact flows using Amazon Connect.
Ability to integrate Connect with CRMs (Salesforce, ServiceNow) and custom APIs.
Proficiency in leveraging AWS Lambda and Lex for automation and AI-driven interactions.
Understanding of real-time and historical reporting capabilities.
Cost optimization strategies for Amazon Connect usage.

Strong grasp of IAM roles, permissions, and encryption for secure data handling.
Knowledge of serverless architecture and API Gateway for scalable solutions.
Familiarity with monitoring tools (CloudWatch, CloudTrail) for performance and compliance.
Exposure to AI/ML services like Amazon Lex, Polly, and Transcribe for advanced customer interactions.

As a Technical Delivery Lead at Nokia, you will play a pivotal role in leading the technical delivery of innovative projects within the Autonomous Networks domain. Collaborating closely with Central Delivery Services, Central Care services, and Project Management teams, you'll drive project success from pre-sales through to operations handover. Your expertise will shape delivery strategies, ensuring alignment with technical specifications, timelines, and quality benchmarks. The work environment is dynamic and collaborative, where you'll engage with diverse technical teams to tackle complex challenges and foster innovation. You'll have the opportunity to influence project outcomes, manage resource allocation, and support pre-sales initiatives, contributing directly to Nokia's mission of advancing technology and connectivity. Join us to make a significant impact in a rapidly evolving field!
How You Will Contribute And What You Will Learn
Leads key and less complex projects that positively contribute to business or operation impact such as streamlining processes and tools for efficiency in functional, region or local operation.
Manages the execution of a programme of medium complexity against agreed programme targets.
Is responsible for project execution performance with respect to financial and operational KPIs such as cost, timelines, revenue, project assets, and customer satisfaction.
Interfaces with key stakeholders at business area leadership.
Owns and manages customer relationship for assigned scope in services, delivery and performance areas.
Ensures contract execution is based on PM@Nokia methodology and applicable BG guidelines and processes.
Ensures proper communication to relevant stakeholders for technical requests, emergency cases, outages and project delivery issues.
Monitors, reports and optimises services delivery in alignment with relevant processes and tools providing sufficient operational visibility to stakeholders (EG Project Management, PMO, customer).
Key Skills And Experience
You have:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in a related field
10 to 15 years of experience in Technical Project Management and services/care delivery
Strong leadership, influencing, and communication skills
Proficient in software development, integration services, CI/CD, and automation frameworks
Solid understanding of Digital Operations Products (OSS, Provisioning, Orchestration, Inventory, Assurance, Analytics & Security architecture
Experience in cost control and budgeting
It would be nice if you also had:
Adaptability to new technologies, tools, and evolving client requirements
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and integrating with development teams
(Software lifecycle management)
About Us
Advancing connectivity to secure a brighter world.
Nokia is a global leader in connectivity for the AI era. With expertise across fixed, mobile and transport networks, powered by the innovation of Nokia Bell Labs, we’re advancing connectivity to secure a brighter world.
Learn more about life at Nokia .
About The Business Group
In Cloud and Network Services, as Nokia's growth engine, we create value for communication service providers and enterprise customers by leading the transition to cloud-native software and as-a-service delivery models. Our inclusive team of dreamers, doers and disruptors push the limits from impossible to possible.
Our recruitment process
We act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. Our employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.
If you’re interested in this role but don’t meet every listed requirement, we still encourage you to apply. Unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences enrich our teams, and you may be just the right candidate for this or another opportunity.
The length of the recruitment process may vary depending on the specific role's requirements. We strive to ensure a smooth and inclusive experience for all candidates. Discover more about the recruitment process at Nokia .
About The Team
Some of our benefits:
Flexible and hybrid working schemes
A minimum of 90 days of Maternity and Paternity Leave, with the option to return to work within a year following the birth or adoption of a child (based on eligibility)
Life insurance to all employees to provide peace of mind and financial security
Well-being programs to support your mental and physical health
Opportunities to join and receive support from Nokia Employee Resource Groups (NERGs)
Employee Growth Solutions to support your personalized career & skills development
Diverse pool of Coaches & Mentors to whom you have easy access
A learning environment which promotes personal growth and professional development - for your role and beyond

Title: Vervoersbegeleider - Kinderdagcentrum Onder één Dak
Description:
Jij geeft kinderen rust onderweg. En dat... is zó waardevol!
Hoe ziet jouw nieuwe werkplek eruit?
Namens onze collega’s op Kinderdagcentrum Onder één Dak heten wij jou graag welkom!
Wij zijn een behandelcentrum voor kinderen in de leeftijd van 4 tot 18 jaar oud. Zij hebben een verstandelijke beperking en bij sommigen in combinatie met gedrag. Sommigen kunnen zich moeilijk uiten. Een onrustige rit naar het Kinderdagcentrum Onder één Dak kan dan veel invloed hebben op het kind.
En…
dát is nu net waar wij jou hard kunnen gebruiken!
Als Vervoersbegeleider ben jij degene die zorgt voor stabiliteit, overzicht en een prettige sfeer. Hier houden de kinderen ook een prettig gevoel aan over. Jij bent een bekend gezicht voor de kinderen als voor hun ouders. Want
vertrouwen
… dat is belangrijk!
Wat mag je doen?
’s Ochtends stap je in de bus en ga jij langs verschillende adressen. Je haalt de kinderen op, helpt hen veilig de bus in en zorgt er voor dat iedereen op zijn gemak is. Je voelt goed aan wat een kind nodig heeft. Ook als zij zich niet goed in woorden kunnen uitdrukken. Als Vervoersbegeleider stel je een kind gerust en jij weet rust uit te stralen.
Het kan ook voorkomen dat jij de kinderen ’s middags naar huis brengt. Aan het eind van de dag haal je als Vervoersbegeleider de kinderen weer op – op het Kinderdagcentrum Onder één Dak. Jij brengt de kinderen veilig thuis.
Jouw dag zit er weer op. Hopelijk voel jij de impact die jij maakt op alle kinderen die jij begeleid.
Hoe waarderen wij jou?
Een bruto maandsalaris van min. €2.154,00 en max. €2.836,00 (FWG 15) bij een 36-urige werkweek volgens de CAO Gehandicaptenzorg.
Een contract voor onbepaalde tijd met een proeftijd van twee maanden op oproepbasis.
We stimuleren groei binnen Eemhart, daarom bieden we ruime opleidings- en ontwikkelmogelijkheden, passend bij jou.
Standplaats is Amersfoort.
Arbeidsextra’s die wij bieden bovenop het in de vacature genoemde salaris:
Gunstige secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, zo ontvang je naast de standaard 8% vakantiegeld een eindejaarsuitkering van 8,33%.
Eemhart heeft een eigen online Leerplein waar je volop gratis kunt bijscholen voor competenties die bij jouw functie horen.
Naast het wettelijk geregelde vakantieverlof (144 uur naar rato van je dienstverband) ontvang je een extra verlof budget (balansuren) van 57 uur (bij een fulltime werkweek).
Eemhart heeft een uitgebreid Meerkeuze arbeidsvoorwaarden (MKA-regeling): zoals fiscale korting bij aanschaf van bijvoorbeeld een smartphone, laptop en/of elektrische fiets, Bol.com, Coolblue of weekendje weg bon, sportabonnement.
Wat breng je mee?
Je bent beschikbaar op doordeweekse dagen van 7.30 tot 9.30 uur en van 15.15 tot 17.15 uur.
Je bent representatief, enthousiast en hebt verantwoordelijkheidsgevoel.
Je bent bereid om een training epilepsie en medicatie toedienen te volgen.
Nog vragen of direct solliciteren?
Voor vragen over deze functie kun je contact opnemen met Esther Lems (Manager Zorg) via 06 – contactinformatie .
Voor vragen rondom de sollicitatieprocedure kun je contact op nemen met de Recruiter voor deze rol Chyniel Campbell via 06 – contactinformatie .
Reageren op deze vacature kan gedurende de gehele looptijd. Wanneer wij een geschikte collega hebben gevonden dan sluiten wij de vacature. Wacht dus niet te lang en reageer direct!
Wat een leuke functie he? We verwachten deze dan ook zelf in te kunnen vullen en acquisitie is zonde van jouw en onze tijd. Hier wordt niet op gereageerd.

Title: Banking Consultant for S4 Transition Projects SA
Description:
Innovation is and will always be the core to SAP Fioneer, and it is the promise of why we were spun out of SAP: agility, innovation, and delivery.
SAP Fioneer builds on a heritage of outstanding technology and a deep understanding of corporate and consumer demands. At the heart of it all it is simple: We bring financial services to the next level with innovative software solutions and platforms.
We are helping companies in the financial services industry to achieve speed, scalability, and cost-efficiency through digital business innovation, cloud technology, and solutions that cover banking and insurance processes end-to-end.
A global company, rapid growth, innovative people, and a lean organization make SAP Fioneer a place where you accelerate your future!
About Role
As
Banking Consultant (Solution Architect) - in
Transactional Banking , you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of modern banking architectures. You will drive strategic transformation projects, design scalable and future-proof solutions, and advise our clients on the modernization and optimization of their core banking platforms.
Leveraging your deep understanding of core banking and related technology, you will collaborate closely with our customers to define and deliver solutions that enable operational excellence, regulatory compliance, and business agility.
With your in-depth process and solution expertise, you are recognized as an expert in your field. You will work hand in hand with stakeholders across business and IT to translate strategic goals into concrete architectures and deliver tangible value.
Responsibilities
Engage with prospects, customers, and sales teams to comprehensively understand and anticipate business requirements and transformation challenges in core banking
Utilize your deep industry and technology knowledge to clearly articulate customer needs and solution approaches
Translate complex banking processes into robust, scalable solution designs and architectures based on SAP Fioneer products
Lead the design of suitable target architectures and scalable solutions for complex business problems
Conduct fit-gap analyses, identify innovation potential, and ensure solution designs align with customers' strategic and business objectives, also considering regulatory guardrails
Advise customers on the best possible use of SAP Fioneer solutions to achieve business outcomes, e.g., modernization, cost efficiency, and long-term competitiveness
Drive opportunities, transformation projects, and innovation initiatives - acting as a trusted advisor and architectural lead for core banking architecture and solutions
Collaborate with product and engineering teams to shape product roadmaps and ensure alignment with market needs
Provide coaching to team members and foster a culture of knowledge sharing
Requirements
Academic degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, IT, Business, Finance, Economics, Physics, Mathematics; MBA or PhD is a plus.
4 to 7+ years of professional experience in consulting, banking, or software companies - ideally in solution / enterprise architecture, technology transformation and/or core banking implementation based on SAP Banking components.
Proven track record in delivering complex transformation or modernization programs within commercial and/or retail banking.
Deep expertise in Transformational Banking, banking domains, such as deposits, lending, account management, product engines, and regulatory processes.
Strong understanding of modern banking technology stacks, integration architectures, and cloud transformation.
Excellent communication skills in English
Benefits
You will have the opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry on an incredibly ambitious project to shape the ever-evolving financial sector. This is an environment where you can have it all - the agility, enthusiasm and dynamism of a start-up, combined with the established expertise, solid market presence and extensive customer network of a more established organisation.
At SAP Fioneer, you will benefit from a flexible work environment that encourages creativity and encourages you to think outside the box, bring new ideas to the table, and challenge the status quo. You will become part of a diverse and global team that we are proud of and are constantly growing and reinventing. As an employee, you will have the chance to chart your own career path and take advantage of competitive compensation packages and progression opportunities based on merit.
This appointment will be made in accordance with our Employment Equity Plan and the company's commitment to transformation and diversity.
Industries: Non-profit Organizations and Primary and Secondary Education

Title: Business Intelligence & Workforce Strategy Analyst
Location: East London, Eastern Cape, South Africa
Description:
About The Job
TalentPop, a high-growth agency supporting over 700 E-Commerce brands globally, is searching for a
Business Intelligence & Workforce Strategy Analyst
. This strategic role sits at the nexus of BI, advanced analytics, and executive decision-making. Your mission is to build the predictive models and reporting infrastructure that drives TalentPop’s future growth, service expansion, and AI adoption strategy. You will be the organization’s primary data partner, creating the unified, accurate view of workforce performance and operational capacity that powers our executive team.
Core Responsibilities & Focus Areas
I. Predictive Modeling & Executive Strategy (The Primary Focus)
Develop predictive models for attrition, hiring demand, internal resource shortages, and growth scenarios.
Build comprehensive scenario plans for internal growth, new service expansion, seasonal hiring fluctuations, and operational shifts driven by AI adoption.
Model high-level "what-if" analyses to support executive decision-making (e.g., revenue growth, churn patterns, new vertical launches, efficiency targets).
Lead the creation and maintenance of the Monthly Business Intelligence Report summarizing strategic workforce insights, hiring performance, and departmental capacity for TalentPop's leadership team.
II. Business Intelligence & Reporting Infrastructure
Build and maintain standardized dashboards and reporting tools that serve cross-functional leadership (Recruitment, Sales, Marketing, Client Success, Executive).
Serve as a key data partner alongside our Engineering and Data Management team to define and maintain the baseline data structure and operational metrics.
Ensure data governance and integrity across all BI reporting pipelines (HubSpot, HR systems, etc.) and validate data accuracy for executive consumption.
III. Workforce & Capacity Planning
Translate executive growth strategy into actionable headcount forecasts and hiring targets.
Analyze labor capacity utilization and department efficiency to ensure alignment between strategic growth goals and internal labor capacity.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Finance, Economics, Statistics, or similar.
5+ years of experience in business intelligence, strategic analytics, and/or workforce forecasting, preferably in a BPO or high-growth service environment.
Proven experience building complex, predictive models and executing scenario planning for executive review.
Strong background in data governance and serving as a BI-to-Engineering partner for data structure and pipeline validation.
Technical Requirements
Stable DSL/Cable/Fiber internet (20 Mbps minimum + backup)
Laptop/desktop with at least Core i5/Ryzen 5 and 8GB RAM
Reliable power source and backup work location
Perks & Benefits
Competitive Compensation: Receive competitive pay with annual performance-based increases.
Time to Recharge: Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) so you can rest, travel, and recharge.
Comprehensive Wellness: We offer a choice of Health and Dental Insurance or a Health Stipend to ensure you feel your best.
Holiday Bonuses: Receive a special Holiday Bonus in appreciation of your hard work and dedication.
Fully Remote Setup: Enjoy the flexibility of a 100% remote work setup—work comfortably from anywhere.
Growth Opportunities: Access clear pathways and opportunities to grow with us as TalentPop continues to rapidly scale in the E-commerce industry.
How to Apply
Ready to Drive Strategy and Growth?
If you are an analytical powerhouse ready to leverage data to define our workforce strategy and drive efficiency for hundreds of global E-commerce brands, we want to hear from you.
TalentPop is redefining support operations, and we need your expertise to model our future.
Apply now to join our global, collaborative, and fast-growing team!

Strong project management skills
Creative thinker and problem solver

Title: Portfolio Marketing Manager
Description:
The Apex Group was established in Bermuda in 2003 and is now one of the world’s largest fund administration and middle office solutions providers.
Our business is unique in its ability to reach globally, service locally and provide cross-jurisdictional services. With our clients at the heart of everything we do, our hard-working team has successfully delivered on an unprecedented growth and transformation journey, and we are now represented by over circa 13,000 employees across 112 offices worldwide.Your career with us should reflect your energy and passion.
That’s why, at Apex Group, we will do more than simply ‘empower’ you. We will work to supercharge your unique skills and experience.
Take the lead and we’ll give you the support you need to be at the top of your game. And we offer you the freedom to be a positive disrupter and turn big ideas into bold, industry-changing realities.
For our business, for clients, and for you
About The Role
We’re looking for a commercially minded and execution-focused Product Marketing Manager to join our Portfolio Marketing team. This role will be instrumental in driving go-to-market (GTM) strategy, positioning, and messaging for our Fintech and digital platforms across the financial services ecosystem. You’ll work closely with product owners, demand generation, sales, and client relationship teams to ensure our fintech solutions are clearly articulated, competitively positioned, and effectively adopted in the market.
This role supports the Group’s broader fintech strategy and will play an important role in contributing to the businesses transition in messaging to a ‘digital-first innovator’ in our space.
Key Responsibilities
Go-to-Market Planning: Lead GTM planning for new product launches and newly acquired Fintech products alongside Product teams – produce a GTM pack to serve as the basis of all outbound activity across sales, marketing and CRM teams.
Messaging & Positioning: Develop differentiated messaging frameworks and value propositions tailored to buyer personas across the fintech lifecycle.
Sales Enablement: Create and maintain sales collateral, pitch decks, battlecards, and training materials to support Client facing and sales teams. Collaborate with the Demand Marketing team to ensure alignment with campaign messaging.
Market Intelligence: Extract ongoing competitor and market research from product team to inform positioning, pricing, and content strategy. Feed insights back into product roadmap discussions and campaign planning.
Campaign Collaboration: Partner with demand generation, content/comms and digital teams to provide the required information and collateral to develop integrated campaigns that drive awareness, engagement, and pipeline growth across fintech platforms
Performance Tracking:
Define and report on key product marketing KPIs including engagement, adoption, retention, and influenced pipeline.
Customer Voice and Content: Be the information engine on Fintech solutions - act as the voice of the customer by gathering feedback, testimonials, and case studies from internal stakeholders to support the creation of thought leadership and product content for use across channels.
Required Experience And Skills
3–5 years of experience in B2B product marketing in a SaaS or fintech business.
Strong understanding of the fintech landscape, including digital platforms, tokenisation, and regulatory considerations.
Good understanding of and strong interest in Fintech solutions such as blockchain, tokenization etc.
Proven ability to translate complex technical features into compelling, client-centric messaging.
Experience working in matrixed environments with cross-functional global teams across product, sales, and marketing.
Proficiency in using SaaS marketing tools such as CRM and SAM’s.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with a focus on storytelling and clarity.
Familiarity with AI tools to streamline content creation and campaign execution.
Ability to work at pace and manage multiple projects concurrently.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience marketing to institutional investors, asset managers, or wealth platforms.
Knowledge of lifecycle marketing and buyer journey mapping.
Exposure to solution selling and segment-based GTM strategies.
Disclaimer: Unsolicited CVs sent to Apex (Talent Acquisition Team or Hiring Managers) by recruitment agencies will not be accepted for this position. Apex operates a direct sourcing model and where agency assistance is required, the Talent Acquisition team will engage directly with our exclusive recruitment partners.

Description:
About Remote
Remote is solving modern organizations’ biggest challenge – navigating global employment compliantly with ease. We make it possible for businesses of all sizes to recruit, pay, and manage international teams. With our core values at heart and future focused work culture, our team works tirelessly on ambitious problems, asynchronously, around the world. If you are energetic, curious, motivated and ambitious, be part of our world. Apply now and define the future of work!
What This Job Can Offer You
This is an exciting time to join Remote and make an impact in the global employment space as a
Senior Product Designer
joining our
Product Design
team. Design at Remote is a 40+ multi-disciplinary team of designers and creatives passionate about crafting the experiences that help Remote scale successfully and help customers find, hire, manage and pay anyone, anywhere 🌍
At Remote, we look for
Senior Product Designers
who are well-experienced, have high-level of maturity across the end-to-end design process, can autonomously lead design within a product team and are comfortable navigating ambiguity. You will be part of a thriving cross-functional organisation, where you will collaborate with Designers, Engineers and Product Managers worldwide to deliver remarkable user experiences to customers.
You can also check out our blog post on How to land a Design role at Remote, and the Youtube link to our Ask Me Anything event.
What You Bring
An individual contributor with an impressive portfolio of product design work demonstrating your maturity across the end-to-end design process, not only showcasing your ability to identify and understand problems to solve, but deliver delightful, well-crafted user interfaces that have tangible impact on users.
Persuasive communication skills that help you build strong narratives around your design work, provide direction and guidance to others, as well as collaborate effectively with peers and stakeholders - with fluent written and spoken English.
A systems thinker who champions the importance of holistic thinking, is comfortable in a high-growth, fast-paced environment and has a work history that demonstrates an ability to autonomously take ownership of design for complex domains and/or multiple projects.
Strong evidence that you are an effective cross-functional collaborator with your product and engineering counterparts and are able to work effectively to build consensus and resolve debates and drive the business towards impactful outcomes.
You are an engaged member of your design organization whose focus is not only delivering quality user experiences, but help shape our design culture and ways of working.
Preference will be given to candidates who have experience designing complex B2B SaaS solutions for industries like HRTech, FinTech etc.
Candidates that embody and demonstrate our core values at Remote.
While it is not required to have experience working remotely, it is considered a plus.
Key Responsibilities
Influence strategy for your product team, identifying opportunities for impact in collaboration with your stakeholders and cross-functional peers.
Apply the right research methodology at the right time, helping you and your team empathise with customer challenges and develop an intimate knowledge of the problem being solved.
Leverage AI prototyping as a tool for exploring conceptual ideas, iterating with your cross-functional peers and these bringing ideas to life with functional flows.
Craft high-fidelity user interfaces with flair at velocity, expressing your maturity in interaction design and maintaining our exceptional bar for quality, while delivering at speed.
Lead compelling vision initiatives for your team and domain, influencing and visualising the direction-of-travel and opportunities for innovation.
Solve problems holistically with systems-thinking, understanding the ripple effect of your design decisions and ensuring scalability, while avoiding introducing unnecessary variation to our information architecture and experiences.
Communicate persuasively, weaving storytelling narratives around your work to bring peers on the journey with you, while triaging their critique and feedback efficiently and effectively.
Collaborate transparently in the open, proactively sharing your work with the wider organisation to solicit frequent feedback and identify opportunities for cross-domain collaboration.
Advocate usage of our design system Norma to its best advantage, understanding when to follow it strictly or deviate, improve and contribute back.
Champion our experience principles by ensuring simplicity, usability, scalability and accessibility in all user experiences we deliver.
Be an active member of our cross-functional culture by advocating quality, shaping our ways of working and providing peer support, critique and feedback to others.
Practicals
You'll report to: Senior Product Design Manager
Team: Design
Location: Global
Start date: As soon as possible
Remote Compensation Philosophy
Remote's Total Rewards philosophy is to ensure fair, unbiased compensation and fair equity pay along with competitive benefits in all locations in which we operate. We do not agree to or encourage cheap-labor practices and therefore we ensure to pay above in-location rates. We hope to inspire other companies to support global talent-hiring and bring local wealth to developing countries.
At first glance our salary bands seem quite wide - here is some context. At Remote we have international operations and a globally distributed workforce. We use geo ranges to consider geographic pay differentials as part of our global compensation strategy to remain competitive in various markets while we hiring globally.
The base salary range for this full-time position is USD 56,300 to USD 126,700. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level and location, and our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay for the successful candidate in this role is dependent upon many factors such as location, transferable or job-related skills, work experience, relevant training, business needs, and market demands. The base salary range may be subject to change.
At Remote, we foster internal mobility as a key element of our culture of employee growth and development, supported by a compensation philosophy that guarantees pay equity and fairness. Therefore, all compensation changes associated with an internal move will be reviewed by the Total Rewards & People Enablement team on a case by case basis.

Title: Senior Workforce Planning & Operational Analyst
Description:
About The Job
TalentPop, a premier, fast-growing agency supporting over 700 global E-Commerce brands, is seeking a highly skilled
Senior Workforce Planning & Operational Analyst
. Your core mission is to optimize our internal staffing, productivity, and labor capacity across all departments (Recruitment, CS, Team Operations). This role is the operational engine behind our growth, focusing on building, maintaining, and refining the quantitative models that govern how, when, and where we staff our business. If you thrive in a high-velocity BPO environment and excel at translating raw operational data into actionable staffing constraints and efficiency gains, this is your opportunity.
Core Responsibilities & Focus Areas
I. Workforce Modeling & Capacity Planning (The Primary Focus)
Own and refine TalentPop’s internal workforce and capacity models across all business functions to determine optimal staffing levels.
Analyze labor capacity utilization, productivity metrics, and department efficiency to proactively identify staffing needs, constraints, and resource reallocation opportunities.
Establish weekly, monthly, and quarterly hiring targets in partnership with departmental leadership based on rigorous labor capacity analysis.
Develop predictive models for attrition, bandwidth risk, and internal resource shortages, especially in high-volume hiring environments.
II. Operational Analytics & Efficiency
Model "what-if" analyses to quantify the impact of changes in staffing, performance, or process improvements on department load and company-wide labor requirements.
Monitor key departmental KPIs (capacity utilization, output per FTE, efficiency trends) and provide data-driven recommendations to leadership.
Build dashboards and reporting tools focused on productivity, efficiency, and resource allocation for leadership and operational managers.
III. Recruitment Funnel Analysis
Maintain applicant forecasting models that project future supply based on historical conversion rates and expected demand.
Track and analyze recruitment performance metrics, including interview-to-hire ratios, pass/fail trends, and time-to-fill, to optimize the hiring workflow.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Finance, Economics, Statistics, or similar.
5+ years of experience focused on workforce planning, headcount forecasting, and operations analytics in a high-volume BPO, outsourcing, or call center environment.
Advanced proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets (complex modeling, scenario analyses).
Proven ability to interpret complex operational data and deliver actionable staffing and efficiency recommendations.
Technical Requirements
Stable DSL/Cable/Fiber internet (20 Mbps minimum + backup)
Laptop/desktop with at least Core i5/Ryzen 5 and 8GB RAM
Reliable power source and backup work location
Perks & Benefits
Competitive Compensation: Receive competitive pay with annual performance-based increases.
Time to Recharge: Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) so you can rest, travel, and recharge.
Comprehensive Wellness: We offer a choice of Health and Dental Insurance or a Health Stipend to ensure you feel your best.
Holiday Bonuses: Receive a special Holiday Bonus in appreciation of your hard work and dedication.
Fully Remote Setup: Enjoy the flexibility of a 100% remote work setup—work comfortably from anywhere.
Growth Opportunities: Access clear pathways and opportunities to grow with us as TalentPop continues to rapidly scale in the E-commerce industry.
How to Apply
Ready to Drive Strategy and Growth?
If you are an analytical powerhouse ready to leverage data to define our workforce strategy and drive efficiency for hundreds of global E-commerce brands, we want to hear from you.
TalentPop is redefining support operations, and we need your expertise to model our future.
Apply now to join our global, collaborative, and fast-growing team!

Title: People Consulting - Associate Director
Description:
People Consulting – Associate Director
People Consulting shapes and delivers the part of business strategy that depends on people. As a People Consulting professional, you will have the opportunity to work with global clients to understand and address some of their largest and most complex people-related challenges, and ultimately improve and drive sustainable business results. We focus on engagements that relate to the Human Capital value chain in totality, including, but not limited to, Organisation Design, Change Management, Talent Management, Learning, Transactions and Reward.
In joining EY, you will gain access to valuable experiences and a wealth of knowledge and thought leadership by working across capabilities, service offerings, sectors and geographies. Whenever you join, and no matter how long your stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.
Job summary:
As a member of the People Consulting team, focused on designing and implementing large-scale, complex, global transformation programmes across various sectors, you will join a talented group of professionals that help support and improve businesses through their various types of transformation.
Key responsibilities:
As a Senior Manager specialising in Change Management, you will be a key resource on business transformation projects for our clients. From a technical perspective, you will be responsible for the following:
Developing and implementing a Change Management strategy that supports the organisation's vision and business objectives
Leading Change Management initiatives across the organisation, including technology rollouts, process improvements, organisational restructuring, cultural change, etc.
Overseeing a team of Change Management professionals, providing guidance, training and performance management
Conducting impact analyses, assessing change readiness, and identifying and actively managing key stakeholders
Designing and executing communication and engagement plans to ensure all affected parties are aware of the changes and understand their roles within the transition
Creating training programmes and materials to facilitate effective knowledge transfer and skill development for changes
Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including IT, HR, project management, and departmental leaders, to align Change Management activities with business goals
Monitoring the adoption of changes and gauging the effectiveness of Change Management activities, making adjustments as necessary
Managing resistance to change through proactive engagement, negotiation and conflict resolution
Establishing metrics and KPIs to measure the success of Change Management efforts and report regularly to senior leadership
Acting as a Strategic Advisor to the client, integrating knowledge and insights from all areas of the business and streams of the transformation project to deliver an all-encompassing and seamless change experience for stakeholders
Developing and coaching leaders of the organisation to be true Change Leaders who drive the change through all levels of the business
In this role, you should be able to deliver quality client service, analyse complex problems and deliver insightful solutions, while also managing resources to deliver on the project objectives. You will also be expected to have advanced written and verbal communication skills, excellent attention to detail, be able to engage in critical thinking, take initiative, and be able to quickly integrate into new teams and rapidly establish relationships both internally and externally. More specifically, the successful candidate should:
Demonstrate technical competence in Change Management and take a practical / business-driven approach to solving complex client challenges
Lead multi-disciplinary teams and engagements
Stay up-to-date with key technical and functional skills, as well as industry trends
Go the extra mile to deliver high-quality deliverables
Be able to influence and persuade clients and stakeholders to gain support for any major change initiatives and/or decisions
Demonstrate leadership abilities and be able to coach and manage members of the team
Encourage and facilitate collaboration amongst team members, and promote an inclusive working environment
Be able to identify and help manage any potential issues and risks during a client assignment
Lead business development and client pursuit activities
Identify and flag any follow-on engagement opportunities
Support and lead certain engagement activities from planning through to implementation
Be able to remain calm and composed in stressful situations
Be proactive and take initiative
Be comfortable dealing with ambiguity, embrace uncertainty and adapt swiftly to changing situations
Be able to work in a fast-paced environment
To qualify, candidates must have:
Relevant postgraduate qualification
Certification in Change Management methodology (e.g. Prosci) is advantageous
Relevant professional experience, for example, previous Consulting experience and/or experience in successfully leading and implementing Change Management programmes for large-scale transformation projects
At least 8 to 10 years’ experience in Change Management
Who we are:
At EY, we are 212,000 people based in 728 offices in 150 countries, organised into 28 Regions and four Areas. The vast majority of our people work in one of our four service lines – Assurance, Advisory, Tax, Transaction Advisory Services (TAS) – or in Core Business Services (CBS), which provides internal operational support such as HR and IT services.
As a business advisor at EY, you will help many of the world’s leading companies and governments tackle their most pressing issues. You will also have the opportunity to reach your potential by being given opportunities for professional development and experiences with clients across geographies and industries.
