Title: Senior Workforce Planning & Operational Analyst
Description:
About The Job
TalentPop, a premier, fast-growing agency supporting over 700 global E-Commerce brands, is seeking a highly skilled
Senior Workforce Planning & Operational Analyst
. Your core mission is to optimize our internal staffing, productivity, and labor capacity across all departments (Recruitment, CS, Team Operations). This role is the operational engine behind our growth, focusing on building, maintaining, and refining the quantitative models that govern how, when, and where we staff our business. If you thrive in a high-velocity BPO environment and excel at translating raw operational data into actionable staffing constraints and efficiency gains, this is your opportunity.
Core Responsibilities & Focus Areas
I. Workforce Modeling & Capacity Planning (The Primary Focus)
Own and refine TalentPop’s internal workforce and capacity models across all business functions to determine optimal staffing levels.
Analyze labor capacity utilization, productivity metrics, and department efficiency to proactively identify staffing needs, constraints, and resource reallocation opportunities.
Establish weekly, monthly, and quarterly hiring targets in partnership with departmental leadership based on rigorous labor capacity analysis.
Develop predictive models for attrition, bandwidth risk, and internal resource shortages, especially in high-volume hiring environments.
II. Operational Analytics & Efficiency
Model "what-if" analyses to quantify the impact of changes in staffing, performance, or process improvements on department load and company-wide labor requirements.
Monitor key departmental KPIs (capacity utilization, output per FTE, efficiency trends) and provide data-driven recommendations to leadership.
Build dashboards and reporting tools focused on productivity, efficiency, and resource allocation for leadership and operational managers.
III. Recruitment Funnel Analysis
Maintain applicant forecasting models that project future supply based on historical conversion rates and expected demand.
Track and analyze recruitment performance metrics, including interview-to-hire ratios, pass/fail trends, and time-to-fill, to optimize the hiring workflow.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Finance, Economics, Statistics, or similar.
5+ years of experience focused on workforce planning, headcount forecasting, and operations analytics in a high-volume BPO, outsourcing, or call center environment.
Advanced proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets (complex modeling, scenario analyses).
Proven ability to interpret complex operational data and deliver actionable staffing and efficiency recommendations.
Technical Requirements
Stable DSL/Cable/Fiber internet (20 Mbps minimum + backup)
Laptop/desktop with at least Core i5/Ryzen 5 and 8GB RAM
Reliable power source and backup work location
Perks & Benefits
Competitive Compensation: Receive competitive pay with annual performance-based increases.
Time to Recharge: Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) so you can rest, travel, and recharge.
Comprehensive Wellness: We offer a choice of Health and Dental Insurance or a Health Stipend to ensure you feel your best.
Holiday Bonuses: Receive a special Holiday Bonus in appreciation of your hard work and dedication.
Fully Remote Setup: Enjoy the flexibility of a 100% remote work setup—work comfortably from anywhere.
Growth Opportunities: Access clear pathways and opportunities to grow with us as TalentPop continues to rapidly scale in the E-commerce industry.
How to Apply
Ready to Drive Strategy and Growth?
If you are an analytical powerhouse ready to leverage data to define our workforce strategy and drive efficiency for hundreds of global E-commerce brands, we want to hear from you.
TalentPop is redefining support operations, and we need your expertise to model our future.
Apply now to join our global, collaborative, and fast-growing team!

Title: Senior-level Direct Response Copywriter
Description:
Our client is a unique marketing agency providing end-to-end lead gen services for a focused client base.
Each of their 50 employees understand they are a performance-based agency, which means their monthly client revenue increases when they win. Winning big usually hinges on their ability to provide high-performing direct-response ads, landing pages that convert, and nurture sequences that move leads toward conversion.
The big-impact projects are usually video ad scripting, static Facebook ad scripting, lead nurture/sales email campaigns, CRO, VSLs, and funnel design. They also do a lot of brand work, lead magnet creation, etc.
To grow revenue they need talent; specifically, direct response marketing talent.
This is where you come in...
They're looking for an outstanding copywriter to join their agency!
In this position, you will develop direct response copy across a variety of mediums including Facebook ads, YouTube video scripts, landing pages, email / sms sequences, etc. Our client has a suite of processes, tools, and templates based on proven winners. You will be trained on their copywriting methods and add your expertise to continuously refine the model.
A successful candidate will have experience with writing across all digital media, a strong desire to grow, and a champion's mindset.
Responsibilities
Write direct response copy across a variety of digital channels.
Help create content strategies across different industries and clients.
Interact with media buyers and the analytics team to monitor performance results on a/b tests and refine both copy and processes accordingly.
Work closely with project team to brainstorm ideas, create unique concepts, and develop messaging for new campaigns and other requested materials
Exceptional writing skills that demonstrate the ability to create campaign content that attracts the ideal client profile.
Follow industry best practices and supplied client briefs and style guides.
Salary:
$3000 / month
Type of Work:
Full-time remote
Work Schedule:
8-hours per day Mon-Fri with flexibility on timing
Requirements
In depth background in a remote set-up of work similar to freelancing as an Independent Contractor (deep understanding on the pros & cons involved in this industry).
3+ years of direct response copywriting experience (agency experience a plus), including both short and long-form
Demonstrated ability to communicate through a variety of writing styles and emotions
Self-motivation remote worker, strong desire to grow, positive attitude, and resourceful.
Able to time manage and juggle multiple projects for different client focuses.
Reliable internet connection and consistent availability during designated hours.

Be careful of Recruitment Scams:
Fraudsters or employment scammers often pose as legitimate recruiters, employers, recruitment consultants or job placement firms, advertising false job opportunities through email, text messages and WhatsApp messages. They aim to cheat jobseekers out of money or to steal personal information.
To help you look out for potential recruitment scams, here are some Red Flags:
Upfront Payment Requests: Deloitte will never ask for any upfront payment for background checks, job training, or supplies.
Requests for Personal Information: Be wary if you are asked for sensitive personal information, especially early in the recruitment process and without a clear need for it. Fraudulent links or contractual documents may require the provision of sensitive personal data or copy documents (e.g., government issued numbers or identity documents, passports or passport numbers, bank account statements or numbers, parent’s data) that may be used for identity fraud. Do not provide or send any of these documents or data. Please note we will never ask for photographs at any stage of the recruitment process.
Unprofessional Communication: Scammers may communicate in an unprofessional manner. Their messages may be filled with poor grammar and spelling errors. The look and feel may not be consistent with the Deloitte corporate brand.
If you're unsure, make direct contact with Deloitte using our official contact details. Be careful not to use any contact details provided in the suspicious job advertisement or email.
At Deloitte, we want everyone to feel they can be themselves and to thrive at work—in every country, in everything we do, every day. We aim to create a workplace where everyone is treated fairly and with respect, including reasonable accommodation for persons with disabilities.
We are committed to employment equity and building a diverse and inclusive workplace across the African continent. Our recruitment processes are aligned with our Employment Equity Plan and the principles of the Employment Equity Act. Preference may be given to candidates from designated groups.
We actively support the inclusion of people with disabilities and embrace neurodiversity in the workplace. We recognise and value the unique strengths that neurodivergent individuals bring, and we are committed to creating an environment where everyone can thrive.
If you require reasonable accommodations in relation to your disability and neurodiverse needs during the recruitment process, please let us know. We are happy to make adjustments to suit your individual needs.

Title: Senior Workforce Planning & Operational Analyst
Location: East London, Eastern Cape, South Africa
Description:
About The Job
TalentPop, a premier, fast-growing agency supporting over 700 global E-Commerce brands, is seeking a highly skilled
Senior Workforce Planning & Operational Analyst
. Your core mission is to optimize our internal staffing, productivity, and labor capacity across all departments (Recruitment, CS, Team Operations). This role is the operational engine behind our growth, focusing on building, maintaining, and refining the quantitative models that govern how, when, and where we staff our business. If you thrive in a high-velocity BPO environment and excel at translating raw operational data into actionable staffing constraints and efficiency gains, this is your opportunity.
Core Responsibilities & Focus Areas
I. Workforce Modeling & Capacity Planning (The Primary Focus)
Own and refine TalentPop’s internal workforce and capacity models across all business functions to determine optimal staffing levels.
Analyze labor capacity utilization, productivity metrics, and department efficiency to proactively identify staffing needs, constraints, and resource reallocation opportunities.
Establish weekly, monthly, and quarterly hiring targets in partnership with departmental leadership based on rigorous labor capacity analysis.
Develop predictive models for attrition, bandwidth risk, and internal resource shortages, especially in high-volume hiring environments.
II. Operational Analytics & Efficiency
Model "what-if" analyses to quantify the impact of changes in staffing, performance, or process improvements on department load and company-wide labor requirements.
Monitor key departmental KPIs (capacity utilization, output per FTE, efficiency trends) and provide data-driven recommendations to leadership.
Build dashboards and reporting tools focused on productivity, efficiency, and resource allocation for leadership and operational managers.
III. Recruitment Funnel Analysis
Maintain applicant forecasting models that project future supply based on historical conversion rates and expected demand.
Track and analyze recruitment performance metrics, including interview-to-hire ratios, pass/fail trends, and time-to-fill, to optimize the hiring workflow.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Finance, Economics, Statistics, or similar.
5+ years of experience focused on workforce planning, headcount forecasting, and operations analytics in a high-volume BPO, outsourcing, or call center environment.
Advanced proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets (complex modeling, scenario analyses).
Proven ability to interpret complex operational data and deliver actionable staffing and efficiency recommendations.
Technical Requirements
Stable DSL/Cable/Fiber internet (20 Mbps minimum + backup)
Laptop/desktop with at least Core i5/Ryzen 5 and 8GB RAM
Reliable power source and backup work location
Perks & Benefits
Competitive Compensation: Receive competitive pay with annual performance-based increases.
Time to Recharge: Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) so you can rest, travel, and recharge.
Comprehensive Wellness: We offer a choice of Health and Dental Insurance or a Health Stipend to ensure you feel your best.
Holiday Bonuses: Receive a special Holiday Bonus in appreciation of your hard work and dedication.
Fully Remote Setup: Enjoy the flexibility of a 100% remote work setup—work comfortably from anywhere.
Growth Opportunities: Access clear pathways and opportunities to grow with us as TalentPop continues to rapidly scale in the E-commerce industry.
How to Apply
Ready to Drive Strategy and Growth?
If you are an analytical powerhouse ready to leverage data to define our workforce strategy and drive efficiency for hundreds of global E-commerce brands, we want to hear from you.
TalentPop is redefining support operations, and we need your expertise to model our future.
Apply now to join our global, collaborative, and fast-growing team!

Title: Er du vores nye kollega og brænder du for myndighedsarbejdet med børn og unge med funktionsnedsættelser?
Description:
Er du en erfaren rådgiver og har du lyst til at bidrage med høj faglighed, arbejdsglæde og engagement i arbejdet for børn og unge med funktionsnedsættelser og deres familier i en myndighedsfunktion i Vallensbæk kommune, så er denne stilling den helt rigtige for dig.
Vi søger nemlig en dygtig og engageret børne- og ungerådgiver til en fast stilling i vores team, der arbejder med børn og unge fra 7-18 år (eller op til 23 ved ungestøtte) med funktionsnedsættelser.
Voksen, Familie og Forebyggelse kan tilbyde dig:
Vi er i afdelingen Voksen, Familie og Forebyggelse en gruppe på 15 børne- og ungerådgivere, der er engagerede, alsidige og hvor høj faglighed, humor og sammenhold vægtes højt. Vi har fast faglig sagssparring i teamet og ekstern supervision.
Vi har i afdelingen en god, social og omfavnende kollegagruppe på tværs af Voksen- og Familieområdet. Vi lægger stor vægt på et godt arbejdsklima, med et solidt fællesskab, hvor tillid og selvstændighed vægtes højt. Vi er en arbejdsplads med plads til humor, diversitet og hvor det sociale prioriteres højt. Vi er en tværprofessionel afdeling bestående af myndighed, udfører og en tæt ledelse. Der tilbydes i kommunen flextid, en god kantineordning, billig massage og en masse fælles aktiviteter.
Til vores nye kollega, vil vi sørge for en god on-boarding til området, hvor du også får et makkerskab med en kollega.
Dine arbejdsopgaver vil primært bestå i:
Myndighedsarbejde for børn og unge med funktionsnedsættelser i alderen 7-18 år og deres familier
Afholde inddragende samtaler med forældre og børn og unge med alle typer funktionsnedsættelser
Udarbejde afdækninger
Træffe afgørelser primært efter barnets lov
86, 87, 89 og 90
Bidrage med din faglighed og viden på området og deltage i vores sagssparringer
Børne- og ungerådgiverteamet er opdelt i mindre teams, som består af et team som arbejder med modtagelse + børnefaglige undersøgelser, psykosociale sager (+ 7 år), sager med børn og unge med funktionsnedsættelser (+7 år) og småbørnsprojektet (som består af to børne- og ungerådgivere som har psykosociale sager 0-6 år og to som har sager med børn med funktionsnedsættelser 0-6 år). Dette betyder, at du ikke kommer til at skulle udarbejde børnefaglige undersøgelser.
Vi forventer:
At du er uddannet socialrådgiver
At du har overblik og forståelse for myndighedsfunktionen, så du kan træffe kvalificerede og lovmedholdelige afgørelser
At du har kendskab til eller erfaring med barnets lov, særligt
86, 87, 89 og 90
At du arbejder inddragende og løsningsorienteret i arbejdet med barnet og forældrene
At du har gode samarbejdsevner og kan trives i et projekt, som hele tiden er i udvikling
At du er struktureret og prioriterer i arbejdsopgaver - også når der er travlt
At du kan formulere dig klart og tydeligt overfor børn og forældre, og trives med skriftligt sags arbejde
Hos os sker det gode arbejde i fællesskab, og vi håber du har lyst til at være fysisk til stede på kontoret og tage del i hverdagen sammen med os
Praktiske oplysninger:
Der er tale om en fast stilling på 37 timer med ansættelse pr. 1. februar eller snarest derefter 2026. Løn- og arbejdsvilkår i henhold til gældende overenskomst.
Ansøgning vedlagt eksamensbevis og cv skal være Voksen, Familie og Forebyggelse i hænde senest den 7. januar 2026 kl. 12.00. Der forventes at være ansættelsessamtaler den 12. januar 2026.
Er du nysgerrig på afdelingen eller ønsker du en nærmere beskrivelse af arbejdsopgaverne, er du velkommen til at kontakte vores børne- og ungerådgiver og faglige koordinator, Julie Ebbesen, på telefon: 23 22 18 21.
Vallensbæk Kommune arbejder på digitale løsninger for borgere og medarbejdere, og vi vil derfor bede dig om at søge stillingen elektronisk ved at klikke på "søg stillingen" eller ved at gå ind på www.vallensbaek.dk/job og søge via stillingsopslaget.
Arbejdstid: Dag
Ansøg her
Retur til søgning

Build a performance-driven, test and learn and commercially driven team focused on performance and productivity, Champion a culture of proactively managing risk, continuous improvement, action and accountability.

Design the right operating model for digital and determine the best-fit suppliers to support execution. Develop and drive top and bottom-line performance improvement by working with the Chief Marketing Officer and wider technical teams to sustainably transform our business. Achieve objectives and aspiration of the business through the delivery of market leading marketing and digital enablement solutions.

Manage and report on performance within the department or area of responsibility; set appropriate performance objectives for direct reports and hold them accountable for achieving these; take appropriate corrective action where necessary to ensure the achievement of annual business objectives.
Establish and monitor industry level benchmarks for marketing performance and digital customer/partner experience. Develop, manage and execute against a performance and productivity driven annual plan.
Mentor & develop the skills within the team (includes setting & providing feedback on monthly KPI's & targets)
Ensure governance standards across the digital campaigns for paid and organic and enforced and well-managed. Manage the team that creates and deploys all digital performance marketing activities of the TIH brands across all digital channels (ie: Social Media, Adwords/PPC, SEO, display) with a focus on growth and first time buyer acquisition.

Identify and manage stakeholders up to C-suite level, finding out their needs/issues/concerns and reacting to these by leading and coordinating the development of stakeholder engagement plans to support the communication of business information and decisions.
Collaborate with other country peers (UK & AUS) to share learnings and enhance digital marketing capabilities. Work closely with internal business units to ensure digital marketing strategy is aligned with all brand and sales strategies and are working withing existing governance standards. Manage and inspire external partners to enhance and develop the organisational initiatives. Work closely with peer functions such as digital teams, brand, sales, operations and data science to ensure the business objectives are being met.

Experience

Commitment to maintaining confidentiality and objectivity.

WHAT YOU WILL DO:
Assess Novelty: Assess whether the manuscript is original and adds new knowledge or insights to the field of study.
Evaluate Study Design and Methodology: Assess whether the study design and methods are appropriate, comprehensive, and clearly described to ensure that the research can be accurately reproduced in the future.
Literature Review: Check whether the manuscript thoroughly incorporates and cites relevant, up-to-date research in the field.
Analyse Results and Conclusions: Evaluates whether the results are presented clearly and appropriately, and whether the conclusions are supported by the data and significant to the field.
Providing Constructive Feedback: Provide constructive feedback, suggesting improvements or highlighting any flaws, omissions, or ethical concerns.
Recommend Publication: Based on your evaluation, the journal editor will decide whether the manuscript should be accepted, revised, or rejected.

Title: Senior Shopify Developer

The ideal candidate will have a strong Shopify Liquid background, experience with Shopify’s theme development, and a solid understanding of frontend technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Custom Shopify Development
Build, edit, and maintain custom Shopify pages and templates using Shopify OS 2.0 with clean, performance-focused customizations.
Develop custom product pages, collection pages, and landing pages aligned with brand guidelines and conversion goals.
Implement and customize Shopify Liquid to create reusable components and enhance site functionality.
Ensure a consistent, seamless user experience across desktop and mobile devices.
Shopify Store Optimization
Optimize site performance, including load speed, mobile responsiveness, and SEO best practices.
Implement features such as upsells, bundles, and product recommendations on product detail pages.
Partner with design and marketing teams to support feature launches, promotions, and new product releases.
Frontend Development
Use HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript to enhance site functionality and user experience.
Implement responsive layouts and interactive elements across the storefront.
Collaborate closely with designers to integrate creative assets while maintaining visual consistency.
Site Maintenance & Troubleshooting
Monitor the site for bugs, broken links, and functionality issues, resolving them efficiently.
Deploy updates, changes, and fixes with minimal customer disruption.
Provide ongoing maintenance to continuously improve performance and usability.
Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO)
Implement conversion-focused features such as upsells, cross-sells, and bundles throughout the site.
Support A/B testing efforts and analyze performance data to improve user flows and conversion rates.
Collaborate with marketing to optimize landing pages and product pages for conversion.
Integrations
Integrate Shopify with third-party tools including CRM, subscriptions, loyalty, and reviews platforms.
Ensure accurate data flow across systems for products, customers, and transactions.
Support integrations related to affiliate marketing, loyalty programs, and customer feedback.
Performance Monitoring
Use analytics tools to monitor site traffic, user behavior, and conversion performance.
Identify opportunities to improve funnels, user paths, and overall site effectiveness.
Qualifications
Experience
4+ years of experience working as a Shopify Developer with a strong focus on custom theme development.
Hands-on experience building and maintaining Shopify OS 2.0 storefronts.
Experience supporting conversion-focused e-commerce initiatives.
Experience with third-party integrations for subscriptions, CRM, loyalty, or reviews platforms.
Skills
Strong proficiency in Shopify Liquid, HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript.
Deep understanding of Shopify theme architecture and performance optimization.
Solid problem-solving skills with the ability to troubleshoot layout, performance, and functionality issues.
Strong attention to detail with a focus on high-quality, low-bug releases.
Ability to manage tasks independently and communicate progress clearly.
Experience with CRO concepts and implementing conversion-driven site features.
Experience with analytics tools and performance tracking is preferred.
Familiarity with Shopify Plus, A/B testing, SEO for e-commerce, email marketing platforms, or high-traffic DTC launches is a plus.
Opportunity
This role offers the opportunity to take ownership of the technical foundation of a growing DTC brand. You’ll build a custom Shopify experience from the ground up, influence performance and conversion outcomes directly, and work closely with creative and marketing teams to shape a high-impact e-commerce presence.

Title: General Manager for German high-precision machining company in Japan
Description:
Company
For a well established German company in the field of precision machining with an outstanding growth record and superior technology, we are looking for a dynamic and market minded General Manager for its Japanese Sales- & Service-operations based in Osaka.
Our client covers a niche market in supplying high tech engineering tools and machinery for automotive suppliers as well as for semiconductor-related businesses. Due to its emphasis on constant research and development, combined with a strong service and process approach, the company has continuously expanded its businesses, now being among the top players of their various segments in Europe, Asia, and in North America.
Position
Reporting to the COO of the German head office, you will be in full charge of all operations of the growing Japanese subsidiary with currently 6 employees. Your principal focus will be servicing and expanding the base of Japanese customers in the semiconductor industry. As the General Manager your tasks will thus be
- to strategically discover and develop new market opportunities
- to put together project calculations and quotations
- to manage key accounts with an emphasis to increase service contracts
- to attend fairs and increase the company`s reputation in the industry
- to supervise all account management and servicing
- to account for and supervise all financial controlling and reports.
In this position you will enjoy a maximum degree of responsibility and entrepreneurial freedom to ensure the continuous success of the company and to further expand its operations. Supported by a team of highly specialized and experienced engineers and service technicians in Germany and in Japan, this job opportunity offers a long term perspective to excel in a fast moving, technologically sophisticated and
challenging business surrounding.
Qualification
The position requires degrees in (or a strong understanding of) engineering, sales and business management. Technical expertise and practical experience in the semiconductor industry (or metal precision machining) are also prerequisites for this
position.
As a candidate you should have a successful track record in managing projects in technical sales and service in mid-size company structures. In your prior experiences in sales and business development you have proven your distinct sense for market
developments and opportunities plus your ability to turn them into profit. Having a strong character and target drive yourself, you are experienced in bridging the gap between the European and German direct way of communication and Japanese subtle standards and expectations. You should thus speak Japanese fluently, enjoy solid roots within Japanese society and still be able to move freely between the cultures.
If your profile meets this attractive opportunity, Mr. Benjamin Ditzen would be happy to receive your application consisting of a covering letter and your CV at candidates@interpool-personal.de
In your e-mail please indicate your motivation and the reasons for your interest in the position. Please tell us especially about a) your leadership qualities, b) your experience in sales and engineering and c) your prior international exposure.
For further questions you can reach us as the HR Consultant handling the first part of the recruitment process in Germany at 0049 - 30 - 40 50 03 58.

Ability to analyse ad performance data and translate insights into actionable creative direction
Strong copywriting skills with understanding of direct-response frameworks

Highly data-driven mindset. You prioritise performance over creative preference

Basic video editing skills (CapCut, Premiere, or similar)

Fast-moving. You can produce and iterate at pace without sacrificing quality
Proactive. You don't wait to be told what to test next

Title: People Analytics Analyst
Description:
About The Role
We’re looking for a People Analytics Analyst who can turn workforce data into insights that guide smarter decisions across Recruitment, Customer Success, Team Operations, and the broader organization. If analyzing people trends, optimizing hiring funnels, and building models that help leaders plan ahead sound exciting to you, this role could be a great fit.
What You'll Do
Workforce and Performance Insights: Track capacity, productivity, pass rates, and staffing trends across internal departments; analyze workload distribution to identify when teams need additional support; provide recommendations based on people data to improve efficiency and staffing alignment.
Forecasting and Predictive Models: Build forecasting models for attrition, staffing needs, and hiring demand; create scenario plans for seasonal changes, service expansions, and operational shifts; present data-backed options that support leadership decision-making.
Recruitment Funnel Analytics: Review recruitment metrics such as application flow, pass rates, and interview-to-hire ratios; strengthen forecasting for applicant supply and expected hiring volume; suggest improvements to workflows and funnel efficiency.
Reporting and Dashboards: Develop dashboards and reports for Recruitment, Sales, CS, and Ops; prepare monthly workforce and people insights for leadership; ensure consistent and accurate views of people data across teams.
Data Governance and AI Support: Partner with Engineering and Data Management to maintain data accuracy; support AI-based tools such as health scores, bandwidth scores, and internal dashboards; identify and resolve gaps in data collection and structure.
What We're Looking For
Bachelor’s degree in Analytics, Statistics, Business, or related fields
5+ years in people analytics, workforce analytics, HR analytics, or similar roles
Strong quantitative and modeling skills
Advanced Excel/Google Sheets proficiency
Experience in BPO, outsourcing, HR, or high-volume recruitment environments is preferred
Technical Requirements
Stable DSL/Cable/Fiber internet (20 Mbps minimum + backup)
Laptop/desktop with at least Core i5/Ryzen 5 and 8GB RAM
Reliable power source and a backup plan or backup workspace

Title: Programs (Implementation) Manager
Description:
Career Area:
Strategy
Job Description:
Your Work Shapes the World at Caterpillar Inc.
When you join Caterpillar, you're joining a global team who cares not just about the work we do – but also about each other. We are the makers, problem solvers, and future world builders who are creating stronger, more sustainable communities. We don't just talk about progress and innovation here – we make it happen, with our customers, where we work and live. Together, we are building a better world, so we can all enjoy living in it.
At Caterpillar, we’re
committed
to our customers, who build a better, more sustainable world with our products, services and solutions. We understand and show the value of why they should choose us. We’re exploring new ideas and opportunities –
innovating
to discover the breakthroughs necessary for tomorrow’s growth. Through it all, we are one team– creating and delivering world-class products, services and solutions superior to the competition. Learn more about the Caterpillar Experience.
We are looking for a
Programs (Implementation) Manager
to join our
Strategy, Growth and Transformation
team within one of Construction Industries’ newly formed divisions:
Customer Solutions Growth Regions.
The division is regionally focused on Africa, the Middle East, Eurasia, Asia (excluding Japan), and Latin America (LATAM) and organized into three functional areas: Customer Facing, Customer Solutions, and Business Enablers.
This role is part of the
Customer Solutions team
, the engine of our business—driving growth by delivering tailored, territory-specific solutions that solve customer pain points, accelerate decision-making, and enable profitable sales execution.
About Strategy, Growth And Transformation Team
The team provides Data and insights for executive decision making and sales execution - ensuring that we are delivering our internal and external commitments as we set up the organization. We are responsible for driving accountability for results in Caterpillar and the Caterpillar dealer network. The team uses both structured and innovative problem solving to define opportunities and are centre of excellence for key strategic projects to drive results.
As the
Programs (Implementation) Manager
you will work on key strategic projects involving internal teams, dealers and/or customers to solve pressing business needs - both short and long term
Role Definition:
Designs, implements, and maintains organizational programs in support of corporate strategy.
What You Will Do (Responsibilities):
Organizing and coordinating processes and procedures for all project teams to follow within the program.
Serving as a liaison and building bridges among project teams within the program; translating corporate objectives into program objectives and practices.
Planning and monitoring program development to ensure that quality standards and goals are achieved.
Managing all aspects of an organizational program to ensure projects within the program are implemented, accepted and accomplished within a set deadline.
What Will Put You Ahead (Preferred Skills):
Postgraduate qualification preferred
PMP certification will be advantageous
Minimum of 8–10 years of commercial project or programs management experience - related to strategy implementation
Ability to lead and oversee project roll-outs with a clear understanding of phasing and governance standards.
Proven experience working within multinational organizations and across multiple territories
What You Have (Basic Skills Required):
Data Gathering & Analysis:
Knowledge of data gathering and analysis tools, techniques, and processes; ability to collect and synthesize data from a variety of stakeholders and sources in an objective manner to reach a conclusion, goal, or judgment.
Level Working Knowledge:
Follows proper data gathering and analysis processes and policies.
Reports problems that arise in the data collection process.
Participates in gathering and analyzing an organization's data based on requirements.
Documents data from various sources and in various formats.
Utilizes basic data collection and evaluation tools and techniques.
Data-Driven Decision Making:
Knowledge of the data-driven decision-making process and associated tools and techniques; ability to gather and analyze data to make organizational decisions that align with strategic business objectives and goals.
Level Working Knowledge:
Applies an assigned technique for data-driven thinking in a Decision-Making process.
Discerns between "signal" and "noise" when interpreting data.
Identifies, obtains, and organizes relevant data and ideas.
Participates in the process of choosing KPIs and metrics to influence decisions.
Utilizes the basic data collection and evaluation tools and techniques.
Influencing:
Knowledge of effective influencing tactics and strategies; ability to impact decisions within and outside own organization.
Level Working Knowledge:
Develops basic persuasive arguments.
Discusses organizational culture around providing input on decisions.
Uses active listening skills and probing techniques to surface opportunities to influence.
Identifies who the decision makers are and how they receive information.
Regularly presents ideas or suggestions to associates in persuasive terms.
Alignment:
Knowledge of the importance of collaboration among team members and the ability to enroll stakeholders in communicating and coordinating activities to support the organization's vision and strategies.
Level Extensive Experience:
Involves team in discussions focused on clarifying and improving broad commitment.
Interprets the organization's vision for external stakeholders.
Establishes clear expectations and accountabilities linked to the vision.
Develops methods for effectively and consistently communicating strategy and operational goals.
Helps managers tailor approaches for mobilizing their team around the strategy.
Refines operational priorities over time to preserve alignment with vision.
Cross-Team Integration:
Understanding of the importance of inter-team collaboration in breaking down silos and achieving business results; ability to lead employees from various functions to communicate, coordinate work across divisions, and collaborate in solving problems as one team.
Level Working Knowledge:
Maintains a strong internal network that promotes informal collaboration.
Shares information that may be relevant to other teams across divisions.
Assesses the potential synergies from combining common practices across teams.
Identifies differences among teams that could cause barriers to effective integration.
Applies relevant information gathered from comparable teams to own team.
Program Management:
Knowledge of the policies and techniques to manage a set of related projects within a program; ability to plan, organize, monitor, and control the set of projects, ensuring efficient utilization of technical and administrative resources to achieve program objectives.
Level Extensive Experience:
Evaluates risks and vulnerabilities, and creates contingency plans.
Advises others on preferred tools, techniques and methods for estimating program cost and time.
Conducts regular and ad-hoc program reviews with project managers, team and clients.
Coaches others in maintaining open communication among project managers and interested parties.
Oversees reporting requirements, and creates monitoring and control mechanisms.
Plans, estimates, staffs, organizes and monitors a set of projects within a program.
Team Management:
Knowledge of effective team building techniques; ability to form and manage effective teams.
Level Extensive Experience:
Brings projects to closure and ensures capture of what can be learned from the experience.
Leads the definition of team mission and objectives for a variety of teams.
Employs appropriate techniques for maintaining team enthusiasm, energy, and focus.
Ensures that team members are on board, unified, and moving in the same direction.
Communicates both within the team and to stakeholders.
Learns and utilizes special talents and work styles of team members.
Additional Information:
Must be able to travel up to 25% (Domestic & International)

Title: Digital Sales VA
Description:
An Elite, Fully Remote Role Where Your Performance Dictates Your Paycheck and Your Path!
Join TalentPop – Where Top Performers Thrive
Are you a
top-tier performer
? The kind of person who doesn't just meet goals—you shatter them? TalentPop partners with the world's most
dynamic, high-growth e-commerce brands
, and we're looking for an elite group of sales-minded individuals to join our team. This isn't just a support role; it's a
high-octane, revenue-driving position
where your persuasive skills directly translate into
unlimited career advancement
and
premium financial rewards.
If you thrive on the thrill of the close, enjoy the freedom of
fully remote work
, and demand to be recognized and rewarded for your hustle, your search ends here.

must
follow these critical steps exactly. **Applications that do not choose 'Brand Concierge' and enter the correct code WILL NOT be reviewed.**
When selecting the position during your application, please choose “Brand Concierge” from the list of available roles.
In the application form, you’ll be asked for an application code – please enter BCS in that field.
About the Role: The Digital Sales VA
As a
Digital Sales VA
(internally, E-Commerce Sales Outreach Specialist), you are the
revenue hero
. You'll be the crucial link that turns near-misses into massive wins for our partner brands. Your primary mission is to
capture lost revenue
and
upscale the customer journey
through personalized, persuasive outreach. You will communicate via email, SMS, and live chat to encourage purchases, provide personalized recommendations, and deliver a seamless shopping experience.
What You'll Do
The Hunt: Become an expert in Abandoned Cart Recovery, reaching out to potential buyers at the critical moment to close the sale.
The Conversion: Use your persuasive communication mastery to provide tailored recommendations that guide buyers toward purchasing—increasing Average Order Value (AOV).
The Impact: Act as a strategic partner, delivering exceptional customer service while troubleshooting issues efficiently to ensure a seamless, friction-free transaction.
The Strategy: Collaborate with a high-performing team to refine outreach campaigns that maximize sales and drive continuous growth.
Your Blueprint for Success (The Requirements)
We are looking for self-starters who are ready to hit the ground running.
1+ Year of Proven Remote/Online Sales Experience: You already know how to close a deal and drive revenue without supervision.
1+ Year of Customer Support Experience: Comfort and skill in engaging customers via email, chat, or phone (E-commerce experience is a massive advantage).
Conversion Mindset: You possess elite communication skills and a natural, undeniable ability to convert leads and persuade customers.
Tech Savvy: Familiarity with platforms like Shopify, CRM tools, or other customer engagement software.
Self-Motivated: Goal-oriented and able to thrive in a fast-paced remote environment.
Technical Requirements
A personal PC or laptop with an i5 processor or higher.
A stable internet connection with a minimum of 15 Mbps upload and download speeds.
A quiet, professional workspace for calls.
The Irresistible Rewards: Why You'll Love Working Here
We believe elite performance deserves elite compensation and unwavering support. At TalentPop, we invest in you, your future, and your well-being.
Financial Freedom & Growth: Enjoy highly competitive base pay paired with guaranteed annual performance-based raises. Your dedication is consistently rewarded and your earning potential grows every year.
True Work-Life Balance: Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) ensures you have the freedom to rest, recharge, and take care of what matters most—without sacrificing your paycheck.
Premium Health & Wellness: Choose between comprehensive Health and Dental Insurance or a substantial monthly Health Stipend to keep you feeling your absolute best, always.
Performance Bonuses & Appreciation: Benefit from Holiday Bonuses as an extra 'thank you' for your commitment and hard work throughout the year.
Ultimate Remote Flexibility: Say goodbye to the commute forever! Enjoy a 100% fully remote setup that gives you complete control over your environment and schedule.
Clear Path to Leadership: We don't just hire—we promote. Take advantage of unlimited opportunities for growth and advancement as you move into senior and leadership roles within our rapidly expanding company.
Ready to Turn Conversations Into Conversions?
If you're excited about helping brands grow and want to be part of a team that celebrates results, learning, and impact—we want to hear from you.
Apply now and start dictating your future with TalentPop.

Title: Performance Marketing Manager (E-Commerce)
Description:
Performance Marketing Manager (DTC E-Commerce)
Location:
Remote
Working Hours:
Monday to Friday, 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM UK GMT (minimum 4 hours overlap)
Contract Type:
Independent contractor
Language:
Applications accepted in English only
About Purolabs
Purolabs is a fast-growing DTC supplements brand based in the UK with over 350,000 happy customers.
We create clean, science-backed supplements that actually work. No fillers, no nasties, just real results.
Featured in Vogue, Women's Health, and Evening Standard, our UK-made products are trusted by health-conscious people who refuse to compromise on quality.
We're a small, family-run team that values ownership, transparency, and getting things done without the bureaucracy.
The Role
We're looking for a Performance Marketing Manager to own and scale our paid acquisition channels.
You'll be the person in the ad accounts every day, not reviewing dashboards from a distance. This role is equal parts strategist and executor. You'll plan the roadmap, build the campaigns, analyse the data, and optimise for profitable growth.
Your primary focus will be Meta Ads, with responsibility for expanding into TikTok, Google, and YouTube as we grow. You'll work directly with our founders and collaborate with our creative team to develop winning ad concepts and high-converting funnels.
This isn't about vanity metrics. We care about contribution margin, not just ROAS. You'll need to think commercially and understand how paid media fits into the bigger picture of customer acquisition and lifetime value.
What You'll Own
Full management of Meta Ads, from campaign builds to daily optimisation and scaling
Testing new platforms including TikTok, Google, and YouTube
Creative strategy and briefing, working with designers and video editors to produce scroll-stopping ads
Landing page and funnel optimisation to improve conversion rates
Budget allocation and forecasting across channels
Weekly reporting on performance, insights, and strategic recommendations
Building scalable processes and systems as we grow the marketing function
What We're Looking For
2+ years hands-on experience managing Meta Ads for DTC/e-commerce brands
Track record of profitably scaling ad spend (£30k+ monthly)
Strong grasp of unit economics: CAC, LTV, MER, contribution margin
Experience developing creative briefs and working with creative teams
Analytical mindset with ability to translate data into action
Comfortable working autonomously in a fast-paced environment
Clear communicator who can explain performance and strategy to non-marketers
Nice to Have
Experience in health, wellness, supplements, or beauty
TikTok or Google Ads experience
Familiarity with Shopify, Klaviyo, Triple Whale
Understanding of retention and email marketing
What We Offer
Fully remote with flexible hours (just maintain GMT overlap)
Competitive rate based on experience
Paid time off including UK bank holidays
Direct access to founders with real input on strategy
Opportunity to shape the marketing function of a growing brand
Products that genuinely help people feel better
Important
This is a contractor position (not employment)
Applications welcome globally
Minimum 4-hour daily overlap with UK hours required
Please submit CV in English
Note: Applications without a Vocaroo submission will be rejected.

Title: Senior Communications Manager - Analyst Relations
Location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
Description:
Be the voice of Canonical
We're on the lookout for an energetic and creative Senior Communications Manager with experience in analyst relations (AR) to join our communications team. The ideal person for this role will drive communications strategy through the analyst relations channel in order to increase Canonical's visibility among industry influencers and shape market perception.
Canonical serves a diverse customer base, ranging from end users to startups, large enterprises and governments. Our portfolio is broad in scope and in reach. The ideal candidate is passionate about technology, curious about shaping the evolving AR field, and relishes the challenge of communicating a diverse product range based around trusted open source.
The AR field is becoming increasingly data-driven. Market research is also changing as a discipline thanks to AI models. As the voice of Canonical towards analysts and industry influencers, you will define and implement a strategy for data-driven engagement across portfolio areas, building on key narratives, developing new ones, and establishing relationships to advance our position across markets.
This role will involve close partnership with the Product Management function within the company, as well as the Alliances, Sales and Marketing teams, to communicate key product news and announcements and manage perception of Canonical and its range of products among analysts. You will have the opportunity to shape the AR field in the company and help our organization stay ahead of the curve using technologies like AI to conduct market research and assess market perception, delivering insights to the business.
This is a senior position and sits in the communications team reporting to the Director of Communications.
Location:
This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.
What your day will look like
Prepare and execute analyst-focused communications plans for product announcements, new partnerships and other initiatives in line with our go-to-market strategy
Proactively look for ways to use new technologies like AI to analyze market trends and assess analyst perception and sentiment of Canonical and its products
Understand GenAI platforms developed by analyst firms and ensure they contain the right information about Canonical's portfolio
Craft and deliver compelling narratives about Canonical and its products in line with our company vision
Manage analyst relationships directly, coordinating touchpoints throughout the year both through online briefings and industry events
Measure the impact of the AR program, reporting regularly on progress to leadership, implementing the necessary tooling to improve collaboration and managing spend
Proactively position the company in key analyst reports to drive recommendations and strengthen the company's brand
Support the Director of Communications on Corporate Communications initiatives
What we are looking for in you
Extensive experience in market research, AR or communications
Experience managing technology communications (agency or in-house) or AR programs
A track record of delivering innovative and successful communications campaigns in the technology space, and enhancing company positioning through AR programs
Experience of cloud/SaaS/open source technology an advantage
An analytical eye and a good sense for the type of content that resonates best with analysts and other industry influencers
Exceptional interpersonal skills and aptitude for forging trusting relationships across diverse, cross-functional teams
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proven ability to prioritize and differentiate what matters from the noise, meeting deadlines without sacrificing quality
Affinity for planning is a must, experience with project management tools like Jira is an advantage
Background in product management or product marketing is a plus but not required
Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events
What we offer you
Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, please ask your Talent Partner.
🏠Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
📚Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
💰Annual compensation review
🏆Recognition rewards
🏝 Annual holiday leave
👶Parental Leave
🧑‍💼Employee Assistance Programme
🧳Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
✈️Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events
About Canonical
Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Creative Learning & Development Specialist
Description:
Ignite the Next Generation of E-commerce Creative Talent
Are you a passionate expert in
creative marketing
and a gifted
educator
?
TalentPop
is the recognized leader in providing high-performance virtual assistance to the world's fastest-growing E-commerce brands. We are seeking a
Creative Learning & Development Specialist
to design, manage, and deliver the essential training programs that transform great remote talent into
best-in-class creative Virtual Assistants (VAs)
.
This role is for the builder, the coach, and the creative strategist. You won't just facilitate existing modules—you will
own the curriculum
for creative excellence, ensuring our VAs are client-ready masters of Social Media, Email Marketing, and Graphic Design.
Your Strategic Impact: Curriculum Ownership and Delivery
You will be the architect of our creative training pipeline, directly influencing the quality and scalability of our talent pool.
Instructional Design & Strategy: Conceptualize, design, and continuously update all training materials (modules, decks, videos, resource libraries) focused on high-demand creative skills to reflect current industry trends and client needs.
Skill Mastery Programs: Build and facilitate advanced, hands-on workshops in key marketing disciplines, including Social Media Management, Email Marketing, and Graphic Design.
Virtual Onboarding & Assessment: Lead the training and evaluation for all new creative hires, ensuring 100% preparedness for client-facing tasks and setting the benchmark for quality performance.
Performance Coaching: Conduct targeted 1:1 and group coaching sessions to diagnose performance gaps and mentor existing VAs toward specialization and advanced skill achievement.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner directly with the Operations and Client Success Teams to identify and close critical skills gaps that impact service delivery and client satisfaction.
What You Bring: The Expert Combination
We are seeking a rare blend of creative practitioner and professional trainer, ideally with BPO or remote experience.
Training Expertise: 2+ years of formal experience in Learning & Development, instructional design, or corporate training delivery.
Creative Proficiency: Proven hands-on experience in Social Media Management, Email Marketing, and/or Graphic Design—you must be able to teach and troubleshoot these skills effectively.
Tool Mastery: Deep familiarity with the software VAs rely on (e.g., Canva, Meta Business Suite, Klaviyo, Buffer, Google Workspace).
Communication: Exceptional virtual presentation and facilitation skills; ability to simplify complex technical/creative concepts into clear, actionable learning paths.
VA/Remote Context: Previous experience as a Virtual Assistant, freelancer, or training talent in a remote/BPO environment is highly desirable.
Our Commitment to You: Perks & Growth
We invest in the people who build our talent. As a remote specialist, you will receive:
Competitive salary with annual performance bonuses.
Comprehensive health coverage (HMO or monthly stipend).
Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) package.
Permanent remote work setup.
Budget and resources for continuous professional development and certifications.
A clear career track to management roles within our L&D department.
Technical Readiness
A professional, reliable home office setup is required, including a stable,
wired internet connection (20 Mbps minimum)
and a dedicated workspace.
If you are ready to design the curriculum and develop the talent that powers the next wave of E-commerce success, apply to join our L&D team today!

公司简介
万丰奥特控股集团（以下简称“万丰集团”）创立于1994年，是一家“大交通”领域以先进制造业为核心的国际化企业。一直以来，万丰集团秉持“实业报国、产业强国”的责任使命，遵循“永恒提升价值、不断奉献社会”的理想信念，产业涉足汽车部件、航空工业、智能装备、金融投资等领域，致力于“营造国际品牌、构筑百年企业”。 历经20多年的发展，万丰集团资产超300亿元、员工1.5万人以上，位列中国民营企业500*强、中国汽车工业30强、浙江省100强，已形成轻量化应用汽车部件和通用飞机制造“双引擎”驱动的发展格局，打造全球汽车金属部件轻量化推动者和领*导者、通用飞机创新制造企业的全球领跑者。其中：轻量化铝轮、新材料镁合金产业实现细分市场全球；新工艺涂覆、智能装备工业机器人产业实现细分市场国内；战略性新兴产业通航产业成为全国民企集飞机制造、机场建设、航校培训、通航运营、低空保障、航空俱乐部等于一体全产业链的样板，占地5.5平方公里的万丰航空小镇已列入国家通用航空综合示范区、国家空中游览基地、国家飞行营地、浙江省特色小镇，所产拥有全部知识产权的钻石通航飞机进入世界品牌前三强。借助上市公司平台，万丰集团朝着行业领*先、向千亿目标迈进，从经营国际化向资本、人才、科技、品牌国际化转型升级。 步入新发展阶段，贯彻新发展理念，融入新发展格局，万丰集团将牢牢抓住国家大力发展战略性新兴产业的历史机遇，践行《中国制造2025》战略和“国际国内双循环”新发展格局，专注实体经济，弘扬工匠精神，以数字经济为牵引，以实业经营为基础，不断扩大产业规模，带动周边群体共享发展，实现“百强百誉百年万丰”的战略目标，争当浙江省高质量发展共同富裕标杆企业，为振兴地方经济、推动行业进步、促进社会发展贡献万丰更多的智慧和力量。

Title: Digital Sales VA
Description:
An Elite, Fully Remote Role Where Your Performance Dictates Your Paycheck and Your Path!
Join TalentPop – Where Top Performers Thrive
Are you a
top-tier performer
? The kind of person who doesn't just meet goals—you shatter them? TalentPop partners with the world's most
dynamic, high-growth e-commerce brands
, and we're looking for an elite group of sales-minded individuals to join our team. This isn't just a support role; it's a
high-octane, revenue-driving position
where your persuasive skills directly translate into
unlimited career advancement
and
premium financial rewards.
If you thrive on the thrill of the close, enjoy the freedom of
fully remote work
, and demand to be recognized and rewarded for your hustle, your search ends here.
IMMEDIATE ACTION REQUIRED: APPLICATION FAST-TRACK!
To ensure your application is reviewed by the **Recruitment Team**, you
must
follow these critical steps exactly. **Applications that do not choose 'Brand Concierge' and enter the correct code WILL NOT be reviewed.**
When selecting the position during your application, please choose “Brand Concierge” from the list of available roles.
In the application form, you’ll be asked for an application code – please enter BCS in that field.
About the Role: The Digital Sales VA
As a
Digital Sales VA
(internally, E-Commerce Sales Outreach Specialist), you are the
revenue hero
. You'll be the crucial link that turns near-misses into massive wins for our partner brands. Your primary mission is to
capture lost revenue
and
upscale the customer journey
through personalized, persuasive outreach. You will communicate via email, SMS, and live chat to encourage purchases, provide personalized recommendations, and deliver a seamless shopping experience.
What You'll Do
The Hunt: Become an expert in Abandoned Cart Recovery, reaching out to potential buyers at the critical moment to close the sale.
The Conversion: Use your persuasive communication mastery to provide tailored recommendations that guide buyers toward purchasing—increasing Average Order Value (AOV).
The Impact: Act as a strategic partner, delivering exceptional customer service while troubleshooting issues efficiently to ensure a seamless, friction-free transaction.
The Strategy: Collaborate with a high-performing team to refine outreach campaigns that maximize sales and drive continuous growth.
Your Blueprint for Success (The Requirements)
We are looking for self-starters who are ready to hit the ground running.
1+ Year of Proven Remote/Online Sales Experience: You already know how to close a deal and drive revenue without supervision.
1+ Year of Customer Support Experience: Comfort and skill in engaging customers via email, chat, or phone (E-commerce experience is a massive advantage).
Conversion Mindset: You possess elite communication skills and a natural, undeniable ability to convert leads and persuade customers.
Tech Savvy: Familiarity with platforms like Shopify, CRM tools, or other customer engagement software.
Self-Motivated: Goal-oriented and able to thrive in a fast-paced remote environment.
Technical Requirements
A personal PC or laptop with an i5 processor or higher.
A stable internet connection with a minimum of 15 Mbps upload and download speeds.
A quiet, professional workspace for calls.
The Irresistible Rewards: Why You'll Love Working Here
We believe elite performance deserves elite compensation and unwavering support. At TalentPop, we invest in you, your future, and your well-being.
Financial Freedom & Growth: Enjoy highly competitive base pay paired with guaranteed annual performance-based raises. Your dedication is consistently rewarded and your earning potential grows every year.
True Work-Life Balance: Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) ensures you have the freedom to rest, recharge, and take care of what matters most—without sacrificing your paycheck.
Premium Health & Wellness: Choose between comprehensive Health and Dental Insurance or a substantial monthly Health Stipend to keep you feeling your absolute best, always.
Performance Bonuses & Appreciation: Benefit from Holiday Bonuses as an extra 'thank you' for your commitment and hard work throughout the year.
Ultimate Remote Flexibility: Say goodbye to the commute forever! Enjoy a 100% fully remote setup that gives you complete control over your environment and schedule.
Clear Path to Leadership: We don't just hire—we promote. Take advantage of unlimited opportunities for growth and advancement as you move into senior and leadership roles within our rapidly expanding company.
Ready to Turn Conversations Into Conversions?
If you're excited about helping brands grow and want to be part of a team that celebrates results, learning, and impact—we want to hear from you.
Apply now and start dictating your future with TalentPop.

Title: Account Executive
Description:
Established in 2004,
OLIVER
is the world’s first and only specialist in designing, building, and running bespoke in-house agencies and marketing ecosystems for brands. We partner with over 300 clients in 40+ countries and counting. Our unique model drives creativity and efficiency, allowing us to deliver tailored solutions that resonate deeply with audiences.
As a part of
The Brandtech Group
, we're at the forefront of leveraging cutting-edge AI technology to revolutionise how we create and deliver work. Our
AI solutions
enhance efficiency, spark creativity, and drive insightful decision-making, empowering our teams to produce innovative and impactful results.
Role:
Account Executive
Location:
Durban, South Africa
About The Role
Working with our client, the Account Executive leads deliverables and tasks from concept to completion, providing excellent communication and coordination skills. Building strong relationships with internal stakeholders and external clients. The Account Executive is the key communicator on the status, risks, and challenges of all the project deliverables, inclusive of budget and resources. Working in the area of digital marketing, this dynamic role is a great opportunity for a self-starter with an interest in all areas of online consumer engagement and user experience.
What You Will Be Doing
Work in true collaboration with the client and be responsible for a seamless successful project and product as the outcome
Managing projects from beginning to end with clear communication regularly on milestones, targets, goals, and deadlines
Develop existing client relationships as part of the business pipeline
Working alongside internal and external teams and developers
Develop internal and external marketing communications including email marketing and CMS
Copywriting for internal comms with senior management
Continuously assessing working methods and processes while making recommendations for improvement
Integrating into the client process to gain new business opportunities
Acting as the lead contact for the client’s internal project
Work with the client’s PR team on digital comms
Reviewing project resources and providing an analysis of whether they meet the demands of the project
Supporting the Account Director in managing the project’s critical path, deliverables, and budget where appropriate, updating stakeholders and recap reviews
What You Need To Be Great In This Role
Excellent client engagement skills with the ability to proactively organise and influence clients and build strong and effective working relationships
Exceptional project management skills to be the product owner working with the clients
A track record in copywriting and proofing of external comms
Background in producing project recaps, WIPs and updates
Experience in digital marketing is highly beneficial
Overall responsibility for the successful initiation of the project plan and execution with stakeholders, monitoring progress, controlling deadlines and closure of the project
The ability to develop and put forward the best process in tackling data gathering and storing
The ability to host clear, efficient, and productive project meetings for differing stages of the project from kick-off to discovery, and so on, using a project methodology
Knowledge of CRM systems, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, and AEM is preferred
Working knowledge of using word press would be valuable
Quick learner and self-motivated
Proficient in Microsoft Office and other related software

Title: Insurance Call Centre Agent - Night Shift (US Hours)
Location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
Description:
Company Description
WNS (Holdings) Limited (NYSE: WNS) is a global Business Process Management (BPM) leader. WNS offers business value to 400+ global clients by combining operational excellence with deep domain expertise in key industry verticals, including Banking and Financial Services, Consulting and Professional Services, Healthcare, Insurance, Manufacturing, Retail and Consumer Packaged Goods, Shipping and Logistics, Telecommunications, Travel and Utilities. WNS South Africa has been in operation since 2003 and built a reputation as the industry leader for Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) in South Africa, with a growing footprint into Africa. We are a strategic partner for delivering a full range of basic to complex processes from our eight delivery centers across South Africa, employing 4000+ people.Why join us?We promise our employees to experience role clarity, coaching and mentoring, professional development and structured career path through our 5 people promises and keeping employee experience at the core. Experience the culture of outperformance, engagement, celebration and also contribute to society through our WNS Cares Foundation, where you have the opportunity to support meaningful initiatives and make an impact in the community.
Job Description
CSR Responsibilities
Receive incoming calls from customers who have a policy related question
Ability to interact and thrive in a fast-paced environment dealing with a high volume of calls and stressful situations
Deliver appropriate sense of urgency when responding to customer requests
Maintain professional etiquette and provide exceptional customer service when corresponding with customers via phone
Effectively advise the Coach, Floor Support mentor, or Team Leader promptly and fully to inform them of any problems, or unusual matters which may lead to an escalation or dissatisfied customer
Responsible for entering accurate information into systems. - Detailed documentation is required for potential future investigatory purposes
Qualifications
Minimum Requirements:
Matric

Title: People Analytics Analyst
Description:
About The Role
We’re looking for a People Analytics Analyst who can turn workforce data into insights that guide smarter decisions across Recruitment, Customer Success, Team Operations, and the broader organization. If analyzing people trends, optimizing hiring funnels, and building models that help leaders plan ahead sound exciting to you, this role could be a great fit.
What You'll Do
Workforce and Performance Insights: Track capacity, productivity, pass rates, and staffing trends across internal departments; analyze workload distribution to identify when teams need additional support; provide recommendations based on people data to improve efficiency and staffing alignment.
Forecasting and Predictive Models: Build forecasting models for attrition, staffing needs, and hiring demand; create scenario plans for seasonal changes, service expansions, and operational shifts; present data-backed options that support leadership decision-making.
Recruitment Funnel Analytics: Review recruitment metrics such as application flow, pass rates, and interview-to-hire ratios; strengthen forecasting for applicant supply and expected hiring volume; suggest improvements to workflows and funnel efficiency.
Reporting and Dashboards: Develop dashboards and reports for Recruitment, Sales, CS, and Ops; prepare monthly workforce and people insights for leadership; ensure consistent and accurate views of people data across teams.
Data Governance and AI Support: Partner with Engineering and Data Management to maintain data accuracy; support AI-based tools such as health scores, bandwidth scores, and internal dashboards; identify and resolve gaps in data collection and structure.
What We're Looking For
Bachelor’s degree in Analytics, Statistics, Business, or related fields
5+ years in people analytics, workforce analytics, HR analytics, or similar roles
Strong quantitative and modeling skills
Advanced Excel/Google Sheets proficiency
Experience in BPO, outsourcing, HR, or high-volume recruitment environments is preferred

Laptop/desktop with at least Core i5/Ryzen 5 and 8GB RAM
Reliable power source and a backup plan or backup workspace

Title: Business Intelligence & Workforce Strategy Analyst
Location: Port Elizabeth, Eastern Cape, South Africa
Description:
About The Job
TalentPop, a high-growth agency supporting over 700 E-Commerce brands globally, is searching for a
Business Intelligence & Workforce Strategy Analyst
. This strategic role sits at the nexus of BI, advanced analytics, and executive decision-making. Your mission is to build the predictive models and reporting infrastructure that drives TalentPop’s future growth, service expansion, and AI adoption strategy. You will be the organization’s primary data partner, creating the unified, accurate view of workforce performance and operational capacity that powers our executive team.
Core Responsibilities & Focus Areas
I. Predictive Modeling & Executive Strategy (The Primary Focus)
Develop predictive models for attrition, hiring demand, internal resource shortages, and growth scenarios.
Build comprehensive scenario plans for internal growth, new service expansion, seasonal hiring fluctuations, and operational shifts driven by AI adoption.
Model high-level "what-if" analyses to support executive decision-making (e.g., revenue growth, churn patterns, new vertical launches, efficiency targets).
Lead the creation and maintenance of the Monthly Business Intelligence Report summarizing strategic workforce insights, hiring performance, and departmental capacity for TalentPop's leadership team.
II. Business Intelligence & Reporting Infrastructure
Build and maintain standardized dashboards and reporting tools that serve cross-functional leadership (Recruitment, Sales, Marketing, Client Success, Executive).
Serve as a key data partner alongside our Engineering and Data Management team to define and maintain the baseline data structure and operational metrics.
Ensure data governance and integrity across all BI reporting pipelines (HubSpot, HR systems, etc.) and validate data accuracy for executive consumption.
III. Workforce & Capacity Planning
Translate executive growth strategy into actionable headcount forecasts and hiring targets.
Analyze labor capacity utilization and department efficiency to ensure alignment between strategic growth goals and internal labor capacity.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Finance, Economics, Statistics, or similar.
5+ years of experience in business intelligence, strategic analytics, and/or workforce forecasting, preferably in a BPO or high-growth service environment.
Proven experience building complex, predictive models and executing scenario planning for executive review.
Strong background in data governance and serving as a BI-to-Engineering partner for data structure and pipeline validation.
Technical Requirements
Stable DSL/Cable/Fiber internet (20 Mbps minimum + backup)
Laptop/desktop with at least Core i5/Ryzen 5 and 8GB RAM
Reliable power source and backup work location
Perks & Benefits
Competitive Compensation: Receive competitive pay with annual performance-based increases.
Time to Recharge: Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) so you can rest, travel, and recharge.
Comprehensive Wellness: We offer a choice of Health and Dental Insurance or a Health Stipend to ensure you feel your best.
Holiday Bonuses: Receive a special Holiday Bonus in appreciation of your hard work and dedication.
Fully Remote Setup: Enjoy the flexibility of a 100% remote work setup—work comfortably from anywhere.
Growth Opportunities: Access clear pathways and opportunities to grow with us as TalentPop continues to rapidly scale in the E-commerce industry.
How to Apply
Ready to Drive Strategy and Growth?
If you are an analytical powerhouse ready to leverage data to define our workforce strategy and drive efficiency for hundreds of global E-commerce brands, we want to hear from you.
TalentPop is redefining support operations, and we need your expertise to model our future.
Apply now to join our global, collaborative, and fast-growing team!

Title: Freelance Peer Reviewer - Antibody therapeutics
