We are currently looking for
researchers, retired researchers, and former researchers
who can perform peer reviews for journals and publishers.
Note:
You should be able to disclose your full name and affiliations with the publishers.
WHAT YOU NEED to Have:
Doctorate (PhD/MD) or equivalent advanced degree in the subject area.
At least two publications in the last two years in your field.
Thorough understanding of research methodologies and ethical principles within the relevant discipline.
Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills.
Strong written communication skills with the ability to provide clear, concise, and constructive feedback.
Ability to adhere to deadlines and manage time effectively.
Commitment to maintaining confidentiality and objectivity.
Prior experience as a peer reviewer for academic journals is highly desirable.
Familiarity with online manuscript submission and review systems.
WHAT YOU WILL DO:
Assess Novelty: Assess whether the manuscript is original and adds new knowledge or insights to the field of study.
Evaluate Study Design and Methodology: Assess whether the study design and methods are appropriate, comprehensive, and clearly described to ensure that the research can be accurately reproduced in the future.
Literature Review: Check whether the manuscript thoroughly incorporates and cites relevant, up-to-date research in the field.
Analyse Results and Conclusions: Evaluates whether the results are presented clearly and appropriately, and whether the conclusions are supported by the data and significant to the field.
Providing Constructive Feedback: Provide constructive feedback, suggesting improvements or highlighting any flaws, omissions, or ethical concerns.
Recommend Publication: Based on your evaluation, the journal editor will decide whether the manuscript should be accepted, revised, or rejected.
Job Functions: Health Care Provider, Research, and Writing/Editing
Industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Research Services, and Writing and Editing

Title: Cyber Risk & Assurance Advisor (Cape Town or Johannesburg)
Location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
Description:
About Us
Integrity360 is the largest independent cyber security provider in Europe, with a growing international presence spanning the UK, Ireland, mainland Europe, Africa and the Caribbean. With over 700 employees, across 12 locations, and six Security Operations Centres (SOCs)—including locations in Dublin, Sofia, Stockholm, Madrid, Rome and Cape Town—we support more than 2,500 clients across a wide range of industries.
Over 80% of our team are technical experts, focused on helping clients proactively identify, protect, detect and respond to threats in an ever-evolving cyber landscape. Our security-first approach positions cyber resilience as a business enabler, empowering organisations to operate with confidence.
At Integrity360, people come first. We invest heavily in learning, development and progression, fostering a dynamic culture where innovation, collaboration and continuous growth are at the heart of what we do. If you're ready to take your cyber security career to the next level, we’d love to hear from you.
Job Role
We are currently seeking an energetic individual who wishes to further their career in the IT Risk, Compliance, and Security Consultancy space. Integrity360’s Cyber Risk and Assurance team is working in a rapidly growing, fast paced environment with significant opportunities for development. The successful candidate will provide deep, pragmatic and relevant advice to our clients, specifically surrounding Governance, Risk and Compliance elements of their business.
We cherish our talent, we nurture their skills, and we ensure they gain exposure to many sectors. We ensure that they enjoy many positive and productive challenges and plan a path that helps them achieve their career goals.
Key Responsibilities
Act as a Virtual Information Security Officer (vISO), providing strategic guidance and oversight to clients on managing information security risks.
Work closely with senior stakeholders to embed security expertise across various organisational functions.
Assist clients in developing, implementing, and maintaining compliance and security policies, standards, frameworks, procedures, and guidelines, ensuring alignment with organisational strategy and regulatory requirements.
Conduct privacy and security audits in line with recognised frameworks and standards (e.g., ISO 27001, CIS18, NIST, etc.).
Perform Privacy Impact Assessments (PIAs) and advise clients on adopting effective data privacy practices.
Collaborate with clients to define clear governance structures for information security and privacy management.
Evaluate the design and effectiveness of clients' existing privacy and security controls from a risk, compliance, and assurance perspective.
Identify opportunities for improvement and support client relationship growth by collaborating with Sales and technical teams.
Support the Sales team by assisting in proposal development and responding to tenders and RFPs.
Occasional travel (nationally and internationally) may be required, thus a valid driver's licence and access to a reliable vehicle are essential.
Candidate Requirements
A good level of senior leadership experience in risk, compliance and security management.
5+ years of experience in Cyber Risk, Compliance, and Security Management and Data Privacy.
Excellent written, spoken, and interpersonal communication skills, with the ability to translate complex security concepts for both executive and technical audiences.
Excellent listening skills are essential so that you can communicate with the client, empathise with their situation and be able to demonstrate your understanding of their issues.
Flexibility in working methods and times (role may require you to work extra hours should the client call for it)
Ability to understand the business context and technology challenges and handle uncertainty and apply appropriate security solutions in response to multiple risks and needs.
Strong ability to understand PII and data flows from a technical perspective.
An ability to work with limited guidance but also as part of a mixed skilled team
Ability to understand technical requirements and functionality.
Ability to see the big picture and have a keen eye for detail in different situations while making sure the message is clear and understood by all levels within a business.
Strong understanding of industry standards (e.g. GDPR, ISO 27001, ISO 27701, ISO 27018, SOC2, Cloud Security Alliance (CSA), NIST, COBIT, PCI-DSS, GDPR, DPA, ISO31000).
Relevant certifications such as ISO 27001 Lead Implementer/Auditor, CISSP, CISM, CRISC, or similar are advantageous.

You will be required to provide detailed and accurate guidance on issue resolution to the security support team. Capacity and demand management
Security updates and patching

Experience supporting and configuring complex technical environments involving large network and security projects

A dynamic interest in solving technical issues as well as learning new skills
Energy, passion for technology and a commitment to on-going development
Flexibility in working methods and time
A desire to share the knowledge and act as a mentor for junior engineers.
Required Skills
3+ years’ experience of deploying, configuring, maintaining and trouble-shooting Splunk and/or Rapid 7 and/or MS Sentinel SIEM solutions particularly focusing on Security Use Cases
Hands on experience with multiple SIEM solutions will be a strong advantage
Knowledge of some of the following leading Security Products would be a strong advantage:
Firewalls - Checkpoint, Fortinet
Vectra
Qualys
EPP/XDR – CrowdStrike, Cylance
Linux and Shell Scripting experience and advantage (Python,Bash)
Optional – Certification in CISSP, TOGAF, GIAC or equivalent

passing
score. (NOTE: Not all Examinations consider residency credit in the scoring process) To substantiate a claim for residency points, Applicants must UPLOAD LEGIBLE COPIES of the following:

https://www.clevelandohio.gov/sites/clevelandohio/files/AffidavitOfResidency0321.pdf

at the time of filing
application for the examination in which credit is sought in order to qualify for veterans' credit. Title: Divisional Planning Manager - KwaZulu Natal
Description:
Description
Description
We are hiring!
At Sappi, we are a leading global provider with a reputation for delivering high-quality sustainable Woodfibre products and solutions for the global markets. We lead through our values centred around integrity, courage, making smart decisions which we execute with speed. We are seeking unique people who believe in fostering a diverse and inclusive environment.
We’re on the lookout for a
Divisional Planning Manager
to lead and manage the divisional planning function for Sappi's forestry operations, ensuring the development and implementation of strategic and tactical plans for a sustainable and cost-effective fibre supply to Sappi's mills. This role is central to balancing the long-term health of the forest with the immediate and future demands of the business and to develop and maintain planning systems used to manage the timber resource for Sappi forests that will provide sound information for decision making.
As a
Divisional Planning Manager
, you will be responsible for:
Overseeing the development, integrity and maintenance of the forestry planning software used by Sappi Forests. Prescribes data capture procedures to maintain standards, conduct quality control of the data as it applies to growing stock. Monitor and adjust processes to accurately estimate future growth.
Adherence to best practices and output data is conducted through formal audits, comparison of actual and planned results and through "reasonable" checks on output of the system itself.
Lead the development and execution of long-term strategic plans for the forestry division. Draws up long-term (20 year) timber supply plan using the data that resides in the planning system. The format of these plans vary depending on the application required, the 2 basic types are plans based on allowable cut or plans tailored to meet a specific set of demands. Software developed to simulate the harvest scheduling process (HSS) is used.
Ensure that tactical plans (first 3 to 5 years) tie back to the first 3 to 5 years used in the 20 year plan through an iterative process between end users and regional planners, the latter interacts with regional operational staff, some intervention may be required.
Conduct ad hoc exercises to quantify available volume and products for specific projects.
Facilitates timber sourcing meeting between stakeholders, matches supply and demand from own, resources and project Khulisa suppliers
Extract standing ton information for Sappi RSA used in plantation fair value.
Manages effect of various forms of damage on plantation growing stock, quantify volume loss and draws up motivation for adjustments which is scrutinized by external auditors.
Supervises a mensurationist and database administrator. Must have clear understanding of mensuration and how PSP (permanent sample plot) program will provide data required for growth modeling. Understand data availability and reports that can be created to serve users requirements.
Compile and manage the departmental budget, ensuring that costs are well-managed and contained. Draws up budget and controls expenditure
Oversee the gathering of information through enumeration, field surveys, and GPS work to ensure accurate data for planning. Manage and develop contractors responsible for enumeration and GPS work.
Provide input for financial forecasting and analysis related to forestry operations.
Lead, mentor, and develop the planning team, fostering a culture of high performance and continuous improvement.
Report progress on key statistics (e.g., areas, species, harvested and planted areas) to management and operational teams.
What we are looking for:
Degree or diploma in Forestry or related science qualification
8 years minimum experience in the Forest or related industry with at least 2 years in forestry planning
Strong computer literacy with in-depth working knowledge of MS Office
Understanding of forest growth and yield modelling and measurement will be advantageous.
Working knowledge of MicroForest and LiDAR technologies will be advantageous.
What’s in it for you?
Opportunity to work within a global organisation that continues to thrive in a rapidly changing world even after 80 years of existence.
Learning and development programmes to fast-track your career within Sappi.
Opportunities to travel (dependent on upon the role).
Market leading leave benefits.
Employee wellbeing benefits.

Description
Classified job announcement for all qualified applicants. Certified Occupational Therapy Assistant // Related Services 7 hours a day // 174 days a year // Salary Grade 13 - $27.62 per hour (Support Salary Table 2025-2026) To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the essential job functions satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the primary job functions herein described. Since every duty associated with this position may not be described herein, employees may be required to perform duties not specifically spelled out in the job description, but which may be reasonably considered to be incidental in the performing of their duties just as though they were actually written out in this job description. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS * Assists with assessment of student functioning (e.g., self-regulation, fine motor skills, developmental level). This may involve practices such as observation of students in classroom and other settings, gathering of work samples, conducting interviews, reviewing files and the administration and scoring of standardized tests. * Assists with preparation of 504 plans and IEP long-term goals and goal-related benchmarks. * Participates in IEP and 504 meetings. Discusses, coordinates and answers questions regarding plan elements with IEP team. Explains the occupational therapy evaluations to parents. Assists with implementation of plans. * Performs "activity analysis" of student required tasks. * Consults with classroom teachers, resource teachers, etc. to review student evaluations and to propose strategies and make recommendations. * Assists Occupational Therapist with development, maintenance and modification of treatment plans. Provides teachers, students and parents with lists of performance enhancement activities and strategies for students. Answers questions relating to occupational therapy. * Records and maintains daily skill and goal accomplishment progress notes, consolidating at the end of each term. Updates and makes adjustments to goals as necessary. Documents analyses and evaluations. * Mentors and assists occupational therapy assistant college students. * Directs activities of fine motor assistants. * Fabricates or recommends the purchase of adaptive equipment. * Drives personal automobile to various school locations within the district. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS * Associate's degree in occupational therapy plus two 8-week internships in specialty area. * Some experience related to skills above preferred. * Certification as Occupational Therapy Assistant. * Driver's license. * Occupational Therapy Assistant license in the state of Utah. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES * Ability to train and/or work with adults and children; strong interpersonal skills. * Ability to communicate effectively, verbally and in writing. * Knowledge of early childhood development stages/processes. * Ability to administer and score standardized tests. * Basic office skills (e.g., filing, word processing). * Ability to operate computer. * Ability to research and develop individualized student interventions. * Ability to manage inventory and property. PHYSICAL DEMANDS Medium work: Exerting up to 50 pounds of force occasionally, and/or up to 30 pounds of force frequently, and/or up to 10 pounds of force constantly to move objects. The work also requires the following physical abilities in order to perform the essential job functions: balancing, crawling, fingering, grasping, handling, hearing, kneeling, lifting, mental acuity, pulling, pushing, reaching, repetitive motion, speaking, talking, visual acuity and walking. WORKING CONDITIONS Employees in this position work in a dynamic environment that requires them to be sensitive to change and responsive to changing goals, priorities, and needs.

Own and iterate reminder sequences: Test and optimize SMS, email, direct mail, and voicemail messaging angles; implement proven tactics like personalized scripts and direct mail
Design and execute structured A/B tests with clear hypotheses, tracking logs, and documented scaling plans for winning variations
Deliver weekly Show Rate Briefs and lead Show Rate War Rooms to maintain accountability and cross-functional alignment
Provide clear insights to Media Buying, CRO, and Creative teams. Escalate risks quickly and collaborate on funnel enhancements
Build and maintain the Show Rate Strategy: Document proven tactics, best-practice templates, and benchmarks for continuous improvement
Translate diagnostics into client-ready communications: Explain performance dips and present recommended actions clearly and confidently
Support automation initiatives including dashboards, reporting systems, and early-warning indicators for attendance trends
Requirements
Strong analytical and diagnostic skills: Comfort interpreting KPIs, using dashboards, and identifying root causes in performance data
Proven experience in marketing operations, CRO, client strategy, call center operations, or performance marketing (2+ years preferred)
Accountability and ownership mindset: You take responsibility for outcomes, not just activities
Multi-account management ability: Maintain focus across multiple accounts using prioritization frameworks and structured workflows
Structured experimentation experience: Design A/B tests with clear hypotheses, track results, and scale winners systematically
Meticulous documentation habits: Build playbooks, log experiments, maintain benchmarks, and create repeatable systems
Cross-functional collaboration skills: Work effectively with Media Buying, CRO, Creative, DevOps, and Account Management teams
Tech-savvy and adaptable: Comfortable testing new tools, reminder systems, automation platforms, and messaging workflows
Bias toward action and iteration: Move quickly from diagnosis to implementation, measure outcomes, and continuously improve
Strategic AI application: Know when and how to use AI for idea generation, pattern recognition, and content iteration while maintaining analytical rigor and quality control
Craft Compelling Copy: Able to write persuasive, results-oriented email copy, including engaging subject lines and clear calls-to-action.
Location: Fully-Remote
Salary $3000.00

Title: Distribution Manager, Crushing & Screening
Description:
Job Purpose
The Capital Equipment Distribution Manager is responsible for developing, managing, and supporting the network of distribution partners for the company’s crushing & screening product range. This role is focused on developing the company’s presence in small mining & aggregate markets across Europe, Middle East, Asia, South Africa and other regions as identified for growth. This role ensures that distributors are fully capable, motivated, and aligned to achieve sales, service, and market growth targets across their assigned territories.
Key Responsibilities
Distributor Development & Management
Identify, recruit, and onboard new distributors to expand market coverage.
Evaluate and manage distributor performance through regular reviews and business planning (sales targets, inventory levels, service capability, customer satisfaction).
Establish joint business plans with key distributors to drive growth and profitability.
Provide ongoing commercial and operational support to improve partner performance.
Sales & Market Growth
Develop and execute distribution sales strategies to achieve regional sales objectives.
Support distributors in key account development, tendering, and project opportunities.
Monitor market trends, competitor activity, and pricing to optimize market positioning.
Collaborate with marketing to drive product awareness, lead generation, and promotional activities.
Inventory & Supply Chain Coordination
Work with supply chain teams to forecast demand, plan stock levels, and optimize equipment availability.
Ensure distributors maintain appropriate stock, demo, and spare parts levels to meet customer needs.
Training & Capability Building
Conduct product and sales training for distributor sales and service teams.
Ensure distributors meet technical, aftersales, and safety compliance standards.
Reporting & Analysis
Provide regular reports on distributor performance, market coverage, and sales forecasts.
Track profitability, channel margins, and ROI on distribution initiatives.
Key Skills & Competencies
Strong commercial and relationship management skills.
Understanding of capital equipment sales cycles and project-based selling.
Experience with distribution/channel management models.
Analytical ability to interpret sales and market data.
Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
Strategic thinker with hands-on execution.
Qualifications & Experience
5–10 years’ experience in crushing & screening equipment sales or distribution management (jaw crushers, cone crushers, industrial screens).
Preferred experience in static crushing & screening equipment.
Proven track record of building and managing successful distributor networks.
Performance Metrics
Distributor sales growth & market share.
Channel profitability & inventory turnover.
Distributor satisfaction and retention.
Market coverage and brand presence.
Accuracy of forecasts and business plans.

Title: Principal, Client Partner, Services Business Development
Description:
Our Purpose
Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we’re helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.
Title And Summary
Principal, Client Partner, Services Business Development
Principal – Account Client Partner
Location: Johannesburg, South Africa
The Principal Client Business Partner is a senior leadership role within Mastercard Services with full accountability for a single, strategically significant client relationship. The role operates at the intersection of client impact, commercial performance, and delivery excellence, owning the end-to-end Services agenda for the account.
At the Principal level, this role is expected to independently originate, shape, sell, and deliver complex advisory engagements while achieving defined sales, revenue, and delivery targets. The role serves as a trusted executive advisor to senior client leadership and plays a critical role in driving profitable growth, developing talent, and contributing to Mastercard Services’ intellectual capital and market reputation.
Role Description
Client Impact & Executive Partnership
Acts as the senior Services relationship owner for a single strategic client, serving as a trusted advisor to executive and C-suite stakeholders.
Independently defines and drives the Services client agenda, grounded in a deep understanding of the client’s strategy, operating environment, and performance priorities.
Anticipates client needs and proactively brings insights, solutions, and perspectives that deliver measurable business impact.
Recognized by the client as a strategic partner whose insights shape decision-making and long-term direction.
Commercial Leadership & Profitable Growth
Holds full accountability for sales, revenue, and margin performance on the account, aligned to Services growth targets.
Originates, qualifies, and converts advisory opportunities through an insight-led, consultative sales approach.
Leads proposal development, pricing, internal approvals, and contract negotiation with minimal oversight.
Actively manages pipeline health, re-engagements, and cross-functional contributions to ensure sustained growth.
Consistently delivers profitable growth and demonstrates ownership mindset for Services P&L on the account.
Delivery Excellence & Quality Leadership
Leads and oversees complex advisory engagements, ensuring high standards of problem solving, analytical rigor, and client-ready outputs.
Sets the intellectual direction for engagements, including hypothesis-driven approaches, analytical frameworks, and recommendation development.
Ensures disciplined project governance, financial management, and risk mitigation across all account engagements.
Partners closely with delivery leaders to ensure seamless execution and realization of client value.
Sets the quality bar for delivery and is accountable for both outcomes and how work is delivered.
People Leadership & Talent Development
Provides day-to-day leadership, coaching, and development for consulting teams across engagements.
Actively contributes to performance management, feedback, and career development of team members.
Builds inclusive, high-performing teams aligned to Mastercard Services’ values and leadership principles.
Recognized as a people leader who develops talent and strengthens the Advisors bench.
Thought Leadership & Knowledge Stewardship
Contributes to the creation and evolution of Services intellectual capital, methodologies, and market-relevant thought leadership.
Brings global perspectives and best practices to local client challenges by leveraging Mastercard’s global network.
Actively shares knowledge and mentors others across the Services community.
Viewed internally as a subject-matter leader and contributor to Services’ brand and market credibility.
Enterprise & Values Leadership
Models Mastercard’s leadership principles, including client-first mindset, accountability for results, and thoughtful risk-taking.
Operates with a strong sense of urgency while maintaining quality, integrity, and collaboration.
Acts as a steward of Mastercard’s reputation with clients and partners.
Demonstrates enterprise leadership beyond immediate account responsibilities.
Experience
All About You
Typically 12+ years of professional experience, including significant time in management consulting, advisory, or strategy roles.
Demonstrated success leading large, complex client accounts within financial services, payments, or adjacent industries.
Proven track record of independently achieving sales, revenue, and delivery targets in a professional services environment.
Education & Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree from a recognized institution required.
MBA or relevant postgraduate qualification strongly preferred.
Background in a top-tier strategy firm, Big 4 consulting firm, or in-house advisory / strategy function is highly desirable.
Capabilities & Competencies
Deep consulting toolkit: structured problem solving, hypothesis-driven analysis, executive storytelling, and impact-oriented recommendations.
Strong commercial acumen with the ability to manage pipelines, pricing, margins, and client economics.
Exceptional executive presence with the ability to influence C-suite stakeholders.
Strong analytical and financial modelling skills, with advanced proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint.
Ability to operate independently in a matrixed, fast-paced environment while mobilizing cross-functional teams.
High accountability mindset with a bias for action, results, and continuous improvement.
Corporate Security Responsibility
All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

Title: Junior Software Developer - Observability
Location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
Description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.
We are hiring a Junior developer with a proven track record in Python and/or Go. As part of the Observability team, you will develop a cloud-native monitoring stack that composes best-in-class open-source monitoring tools. The stack is opinionated, resilient, and scalable, providing deep insights out of the box. The user experience is polished and seamless for the end-users, and its administrators will enjoy smooth, lightweight Day 1 and Day 2 operations.
This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, Kubernetes, and Observability. Build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, the growing international software company behind Ubuntu.
The monitoring stack will monitor applications running on a mix of cloud technologies such as Kubernetes and OpenStack, as well as bare-metal, virtual machines and containers. The stack will be capable of monitoring applications and infrastructure irrespective of whether they are operated by Juju, and will leverage multiple data sources at various levels of the architecture, including Juju itself, to contextualize the collected telemetry and insights delivered to the end-users.
You can read more about the project here and here.
Location:
This role will be based remotely in the EMEA and Americas regions
The role entails
Collaborate proactively with a globally distributed team
Write, test and document high quality code to create new features
Debug issues and interact with a vibrant community
Review code produced by other engineers
Attend conferences to represent Canonical and the Charmed Observability Stack
Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events
What we are looking for in you
You love technology and working with brilliant people
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You are a skilled Python developer, preferably with a track record in open source
You have a working knowledge of Go
You have interest and experience with two or more of the following: Ubuntu Linux, container images, Debian packaging, snap, distributed systems.
What we offer colleagues
We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events
About Canonical
Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Financial Controller
Description:
Financial Controller
About Hunterlodge
Hunterlodge is a UK-based, full-service advertising agency with a fast-growing and diverse client portfolio. Following a series of recent client wins, we are strengthening our finance capability and are seeking an experienced
Financial Controller
to support the agency’s continued growth, governance, and strategic decision-making.
This is a senior, hands-on role requiring strong technical expertise, commercial acumen, and the confidence to partner closely with leadership across the business.
Role Overview
This is a remote-based Financial Controller role supporting Hunterlodge’s UK operations from South Africa. You will work closely with the UK-based leadership team, ensuring financial accuracy, compliance, and insight across the business.
The role requires strong technical accounting expertise, excellent communication skills, and the ability to operate confidently across time zones.
Key Responsibilities
Financial Operations & Reporting
Oversee all general ledger activity, ensuring accurate recording and reconciliation of transactions including billing, accounts payable, accounts receivable, payroll journals, and accruals, in line with UK GAAP.
Prepare and coordinate monthly, quarterly, and annual financial closes, producing timely and accurate management accounts and statutory financial statements.
Assist in Managing cashflow including bank reconciliations, debt management and ensuring sufficient funds are available for operations.
Deliver in-depth financial analysis to identify trends, risks, and opportunities for cost control or revenue optimisation.
Governance, Risk & Control
Act as the primary point of contact for external auditors, managing the audit process end-to-end.
Ensure strong internal controls and compliance with statutory, regulatory, and tax obligations.
Identify and mitigate financial risks, working closely with senior leadership to develop and monitor risk mitigation plans.
Strategy & Business Partnering
Provide clear, actionable financial insight and recommendations to the Finance Director, CEO, and Board.
Support the annual budgeting process and rolling forecasts, monitoring performance against budget and reporting variances to department leads.
Partner with departments including Sales, Operations, Creative, and Content to embed financial discipline into operational planning and performance tracking.
Drive continuous improvement in financial processes and systems, including the evaluation and implementation of new finance software where appropriate.
Accounts, Suppliers & Media Finance
Prepare and process invoices and staff expenses against approved purchase orders.
Liaise with suppliers to resolve invoice queries and reconcile supplier statements.
Maintain strong working relationships with suppliers and client finance teams.
Verify purchase orders and authorisation controls.
Monitor and track expenditure against budgets and HMRC guidelines.
Reconcile work-in-progress (WIP).
Prepare and reconcile credit card statements against media spend and purchase orders.
Maintain the purchase ledger and support supplier payments and reconciliations.
ISO 14001 – Environmental Management
Maintain and update Environmental Management System (EMS) records in line with ISO 14001 requirements.
Monitor and update environmental records and the legal register.
Collect and track sustainability data including waste, travel, and utilities.
Support carbon emissions reporting and scope definition.
Assist with internal and external ISO 14001 audits, including evidence gathering and document control.
Coordinate environmental compliance documentation and audit readiness.
Experience:
Significant experience in finance and management is essential, typically a minimum of five years in a senior accounting role, with a clear progression from an accounting or audit background.
Technical Skills:
Exceptional technical accounting knowledge, strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities, and a high level of proficiency in financial software and Microsoft Excel are required.
Soft Skills:
Strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills are critical. The role requires the ability to act as a trusted business partner and to present complex financial information clearly to non-financial stakeholders and senior management.
Qualifications
A relevant degree, such as Accounting, Mathematics, or Business, is expected, alongside a professional accounting qualification from a recognised body, including CIMA, ACCA, or ICAEW.
Additional certifications or professional qualifications are advantageous, for example CIMA, AAT, or ACCA.

Title: Junior Application Support Analyst
Description:
Job Description
Possesses strong written and verbal communication, interpersonal, and technical skills. Demonstrates excellent problem-solving, attention to detail, and the ability to multitask in fast-paced, deadline-driven environments. Highly organized, resourceful, and resilient, with the ability to work independently or in teams. Communicates technical concepts clearly to non-technical users and maintains a customer-focused, professional approach. Shows high integrity, confidentiality, and a commitment to quality support. Proficient in software development and Microsoft Office tools.
Responsibilities
Technical Support:
Provide first-level support via email, WhatsApp, phone, communication platforms or ticketing systems, assisting users with common software issues and escalating more complex problems to senior analysts.
Perform testing of websites and systems to identify and resolve issues related to functionality, performance, and usability.
Monitor dashboards and system alerts to proactively identify and address any system-related issues or anomalies.
Monitoring And Control
Monitor and refine metrics to be used as a baseline for monitoring.
Monitor software system dashboards and alerts to identify and report issues, learning to optimise performance with guidance.
Ensure the correct tools/access/visibility is established to ensure effective monitoring.
Identify the proper escalation procedure and execute it when deviations occur.
Follow up to ensure reports/incidents have been received and are being evaluated.
Escalate if reports/incidents are not resolved within the time span agreed.
Ensure storage and archiving processes are functioning correctly.
Troubleshooting
Provide detailed issue reports to relevant teams promptly.
Use remote and diagnostic tools per SOPs.
Identify key data, manage alerts/incidents, and escalate when needed.
Log, categorise, and follow up on incidents per company protocols.
Resolve common software issues related to setup, functionality, and user errors.
Escalate complex issues to second-line support and assist with triage.
Collaborate with senior analysts to improve troubleshooting and problem resolution.
Problem Solving
Identify areas of improvement and recommend improvements.
Escalate statistics to management indicating the impact of these changes or the lack of change.
Identify the need for new SOP’s or SOP updates.
Create or update relevant documents as more information becomes available.

Title: Business Intelligence & Workforce Strategy Analyst

Develop predictive models for attrition, hiring demand, internal resource shortages, and growth scenarios.
Build comprehensive scenario plans for internal growth, new service expansion, seasonal hiring fluctuations, and operational shifts driven by AI adoption.

Ensure data governance and integrity across all BI reporting pipelines (HubSpot, HR systems, etc.) and validate data accuracy for executive consumption.

Translate executive growth strategy into actionable headcount forecasts and hiring targets.
Analyze labor capacity utilization and department efficiency to ensure alignment between strategic growth goals and internal labor capacity.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Finance, Economics, Statistics, or similar.
5+ years of experience in business intelligence, strategic analytics, and/or workforce forecasting, preferably in a BPO or high-growth service environment.
Proven experience building complex, predictive models and executing scenario planning for executive review.
Strong background in data governance and serving as a BI-to-Engineering partner for data structure and pipeline validation.

Stable DSL/Cable/Fiber internet (20 Mbps minimum + backup)

Reliable power source and backup work location

Title: FinCrime Risk Manager (Fraud)
Description:
About Revolut
People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 65+ million customers get more from their money every day.
As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. Financial Crime Operations is at the forefront of Revolut’s efforts to keep customers and their money safe. Team members work directly with customers to resolve issues and flag potential concerns. Using cutting-edge technology and sharp attention to detail, they help prevent financial crime and keep trust at the core of Revolut.

Up to shape what's next in finance? Let’s get in touch.

Serving as Revolut’s first-line fraud expert, supporting risk assessments, control design, and launch across product lines
Advising Product and Operations on fraud risks in new launches and expansions
Driving fraud risk reviews, control gap analysis, and remediation plans
Translating complex fraud risk scenarios into scalable, tech-driven solutions
Collaborating cross-functionally to execute on high-impact fraud initiatives that reduce losses
Maintaining oversight of outsourced and insourced fraud controls, ensuring SLAs are met and controls are effective via targeted testing
Enhancing customer experience by identifying and remediating customer detriment caused by fraud controls while improving fairness, transparency, and complaint handling
Developing and optimising fraud prevention strategies that balance customer experience with loss mitigation
What You'll Need
2+ years of experience in fraud risk or advisory supporting the first line of defence
Expertise in fraud typologies, controls, and regulatory frameworks
Experience across retail and business financial services
A proven track record of delivering fraud risk assessments, gap remediation, and fraud prevention strategies
Familiarity with fraud detection technologies, rule writing, or analytics
Nice to have
Experience with AML, sanctions, or broader financial crime
Exposure to crypto or investment products

Title: Distribution Manager, Crushing & Screening
Description:
Job Purpose
The Capital Equipment Distribution Manager is responsible for developing, managing, and supporting the network of distribution partners for the company’s crushing & screening product range. This role is focused on developing the company’s presence in small mining & aggregate markets across Europe, Middle East, Asia, South Africa and other regions as identified for growth. This role ensures that distributors are fully capable, motivated, and aligned to achieve sales, service, and market growth targets across their assigned territories.
Key Responsibilities
Distributor Development & Management
Identify, recruit, and onboard new distributors to expand market coverage.
Evaluate and manage distributor performance through regular reviews and business planning (sales targets, inventory levels, service capability, customer satisfaction).
Establish joint business plans with key distributors to drive growth and profitability.
Provide ongoing commercial and operational support to improve partner performance.
Sales & Market Growth
Develop and execute distribution sales strategies to achieve regional sales objectives.
Support distributors in key account development, tendering, and project opportunities.
Monitor market trends, competitor activity, and pricing to optimize market positioning.
Collaborate with marketing to drive product awareness, lead generation, and promotional activities.
Inventory & Supply Chain Coordination
Work with supply chain teams to forecast demand, plan stock levels, and optimize equipment availability.
Ensure distributors maintain appropriate stock, demo, and spare parts levels to meet customer needs.
Training & Capability Building
Conduct product and sales training for distributor sales and service teams.
Ensure distributors meet technical, aftersales, and safety compliance standards.
Reporting & Analysis
Provide regular reports on distributor performance, market coverage, and sales forecasts.
Track profitability, channel margins, and ROI on distribution initiatives.
Key Skills & Competencies
Strong commercial and relationship management skills.
Understanding of capital equipment sales cycles and project-based selling.
Experience with distribution/channel management models.
Analytical ability to interpret sales and market data.
Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
Strategic thinker with hands-on execution.
Qualifications & Experience
5–10 years’ experience in crushing & screening equipment sales or distribution management (jaw crushers, cone crushers, industrial screens).
Preferred experience in static crushing & screening equipment.
Proven track record of building and managing successful distributor networks.
Performance Metrics
Distributor sales growth & market share.
Channel profitability & inventory turnover.
Distributor satisfaction and retention.
Market coverage and brand presence.
Accuracy of forecasts and business plans.
As an equal opportunity employer, FLSmidth embraces diversity and equality by promoting an environment of inclusion. Title: Supply Chain Quality Controller (Wine Industry)
Description:
Recruiter:
Status Staffing
Job Ref:
PC001979/LS
Date posted:
Tuesday, December 16, 2025
Location:
Stellenbosch, South Africa
SUMMARY:
Our client, an established company based in Stellenbosch, Cape Town, is seeking a Supply Chain Quality Controller to join their dynamic team. The ideal candidate will hold a BSc/Diploma/Degree in Quality Management, Quality Assurance, Food Technology, Food Science, or Supply Chain Management, and have 3–5 years of experience in a compliance-related role such as Compliance Officer or Compliance Analyst. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and Sage (ERP systems) is essential, and own transport will be an advantage.
POSITION INFO:
A recent professional profile photo is to accompany your application
EMPLOYMENT TYPE : Permanent
SECTOR : Supply Chain / Quality Control
BASIC SALARY : Market Related
START DATE : A.S.A.P / Immediate
REQUIREMENTS:
Grade 12 (Matric)
BSc/Diploma/Degree in Quality Management, Quality Assurance, Food Technology, Food Science, or Supply Chain Management
3–5 years’ experience in compliance-related roles such as Compliance Officer, Compliance Analyst, or similar
Experience working with Microsoft Office Suite and Sage (ERP systems)
Practical experience working with regulatory bodies and understanding the regulatory landscape
Proven experience developing, implementing, and updating compliance policies and procedures to meet FMS and regulatory requirements
Experience conducting risk assessments
HACCP (Introductory & Practitioner level)
BRCGS Issue 9 and IFS v8 Awareness (document control, traceability, audits)
Internal Auditor certification (ISO 9001 or ISO 22000/FSSC 22000)
Familiarity with Organic Schemes (EU/US/UK) and Control Union COI/COC
Awareness of IPW and Fairtrade standards
Experience with mock recalls and farm-to-bottle traceability execution
Competency in document control and CAPA (QMS) processes
ERP system experience (Sage or SAP) ensuring data integrity
Lead Auditor certification (ISO 9001 or ISO 22000/FSSC 22000) – advantage
Regulatory Affairs short course (preferably in the wine or beverage sector) – advantage
Own reliable transport – advantage
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Excellent record-keeping and documentation abilities
Sound knowledge of Quality Management Systems
Hands-on and proactive approach to compliance and auditing tasks
DUTIES:
Portal & Compliance Data Management:
Administer client and certification portals (IPW, Fairtrade, Organic, and other retailer compliance portals), including submissions, renewals, attestations, and evidence uploads.
Maintain a deadline and SLA calendar; issue reminders and escalate risks before due dates.
Perform right-first time (RFT) pre-checks on all submissions (metadata, approvals, evidence) to achieve ≥98% RFT accuracy.
Maintain a version-controlled evidence log for all portal actions and approvals.
Compliance Programmes (Including Organic):
Facilitate QMS compliance activities, including reviews, internal checks, training and awareness sessions, and contributions to management reviews.
Ensure adherence to policies and procedures, and drive controlled updates to policies, procedures, work instructions, and forms (with change control records).
Validate QMS processes through risk-based checks and mini-audits, recording results and follow-up actions.
Train and audit wine producers against Fairtrade, IPW, and Organic requirements; log findings and ensure non-conformances are closed out with supporting evidence.
Traceability & Document Control:
Standardize documentation to certification standards (BRCGS, IFS, IPW, Fairtrade, Organic) ensuring consistency in content, format, approvals, and versioning.
Administer, process, and control the distribution of QMS documents with strict revision control and access permissions.
Compile comprehensive farm-to-bottle traceability packs (Organic, Fairtrade documentation, blend records, COAs, and release evidence) with complete indexing.
Plan and execute mock recalls and traceability tests; report performance against SLAs and drive corrective actions.
Assist the Quality Manager with the rollout of new or updated standards and standardization projects.
Auditing Systems – Internal and External:
Schedule, administer, and coordinate supplier, internal, and external audits according to the annual audit plan.
Serve as Quality Systems Lead Auditor when assigned; issue audit reports and track actions through to close-out.
Coordinate mock recall and traceability audits (scope, sampling, witnesses, and evidence packs).
Upload finalized audit reports and follow up on the closure of external findings within required timeframes.
Cross-Functional Communication:
Issue formal change notices for compliance and traceability updates to Quality, Production, Supply Chain, and Commercial teams.
Provide weekly status updates (upcoming deadlines, risks, and actions) and escalate potential blockers promptly.
Maintain communication logs (requests, clarifications, approvals) as audit evidence.
Health, Safety & Housekeeping:
Comply with company Health & Safety policies and procedures; maintain an audit-ready workspace.
Conduct scheduled fabrication audits and report findings with responsible owners and due dates.
Complete all mandatory Health & Safety training and refresher courses; ensure records are up to date.
Continuous Improvement:
Standardize SOPs, templates, and checklists for portals, Organic controls, document control, and traceability packs.
Measure and reduce administrative cycle time (submission to approval) and resubmission rates, report on monthly performance.
Support digitization initiatives (barcode/scanning, LIMS/ERP/QMS integrations, dashboards) to improve accuracy and retrieval speed.
Capture lessons learned and update procedures and training materials accordingly.
HOURS:
Monday to Friday: 08:00 – 17:00

Title: Begeleider - Paladijnenweg
Description:
Werk op de Paladijnenweg met mensen die jou écht nodig hebben. Als Begeleider maak jij dagelijks impact. Klinkt dat niet goed?
Hoe ziet jouw nieuwe werkplek eruit?
Je komt als Begeleider te werken op locatie Paladijnenweg in Amersfoort. Een locatie midden in de wijk Schothorst. Op deze locatie bied je samen met een enthousiast team zorg en ondersteuning aan 18 volwassenen (in de leeftijd van 29 tot boven de 80 jaar) met een licht tot matige verstandelijke beperking en bijkomende problematieken. Je biedt de cliënten ondersteuning naar behoefte en afspraken middels de Triple C methodiek. Cliënten ervaren en hebben zo veel als mogelijk eigen regie over hun leven.
Alle cliënten hebben een eigen appartement of studio. Zij wonen hier op basis van Volledig Pakket Thuis (VPT). Dit houdt in dat zij hun woning huren bij de woningbouwvereniging en zorg inkopen bij Amerpoort. Zij kunnen, als hier behoefte aan is, gebruik maken van een inloop voor koffie en/of een maaltijd. Kenmerkend voor de Paladijnenweg is daar waar mogelijk zorg op maat te bieden.
Je komt te werken in een goed georganiseerd team. Alle teamleden dragen hieraan bij. Er is voldoende ruimte om te groeien in de specifieke taken en voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling. Het team bestaat uit 12 medewerkers bestaande uit 2 Coördinerend Begeleiders, 7 Begeleiders, 2 Ondersteunend Medewerkers en er is wisselend plek voor ongeveer 2 stagiaires. Het team staat open voor vernieuwing, is nauw betrokken, indien mogelijk samen met verwanten, bij het welzijn van de cliënten, maar ook naar elkaar.
Het team is al ver op weg naar taakvolwassen en zelfsturende samenwerking. De uitdaging is dit met elkaar te vergroten.
Kom jij ons team binnenkort versterken?
Wat mag je doen?
Je biedt als Begeleider ondersteuning aan 19 cliënten met een licht tot matige verstandelijke beperking.
In samenwerking met de gedragsdeskundige, jouw collega’s en de cliënten stel je doelen vast in de jaarlijkse planbespreking. Je stelt doelen bij indien nodig in de maandelijkse evaluaties, signaleert en observeert bijzondere situaties en bespreekt deze met de Coördinerend Begeleiders. Daar waar nodig werk je samen met verschillende disciplines binnen de organisatie.
Je ondersteunt de cliënten, zodat zij mee kunnen doen aan het dagelijks leven en een bijdrage kunnen leveren aan de samenleving.
Voor organisatorische taken draai jij je hand niet om. Binnen het team heb jij een aantal aandachtsgebieden (denk aan veiligheid, roosteren of financiën).
Je neemt deel aan multidisciplinaire cliëntbesprekingen en werkbesprekingen.
Je staat enthousiast in je werk.
Hoe waarderen wij jou?
Afhankelijk van je opleiding en werkervaring kom je in dienst als:
Assistent Begeleider met een salaris van min. €2.326,00 en max. €3.319,00 (FWG 30) bij een 36-urige werkweek volgens de CAO Gehandicaptenzorg.
Begeleider met een salaris van min. €2.546,00 en max. €3.564,00 (FWG 35) bij een 36-urige werkweek volgens de CAO Gehandicaptenzorg.
Een contract voor onbepaalde tijd met een proeftijd van twee maanden voor 24-32 uur per week.
We stimuleren groei binnen Eemhart, daarom bieden we ruime opleidings- en ontwikkelmogelijkheden, passend bij jou.
Standplaats is Amersfoort.
Arbeidsextra’s die wij bieden bovenop het in de vacature genoemde salaris:
Gunstige secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, zo ontvang je naast de standaard 8% vakantiegeld een eindejaarsuitkering van 8,33%.
Eemhart heeft een eigen online Leerplein waar je volop gratis kunt bijscholen voor competenties die bij jouw functie horen.
Naast het wettelijk geregelde vakantieverlof (144 uur naar rato van je dienstverband) ontvang je een extra verlof budget (balansuren) van 57 uur (bij een fulltime werkweek).
Eemhart heeft een uitgebreid Meerkeuze arbeidsvoorwaarden (MKA-regeling): zoals fiscale korting bij aanschaf van bijvoorbeeld een smartphone, laptop en/of elektrische fiets, Bol.com, Coolblue of weekendje weg bon, sportabonnement.
Wat breng je mee?
Je hebt een afgeronde zorg-gerelateerde mbo-opleiding (op minimaal niveau 3), zoals Maatschappelijk Zorg of Persoonlijk Begeleider Specifieke Doelgroepen.
Je hebt relevante werkervaring in het begeleiden van cliënten met een verstandelijke beperking gecombineerd met soms moeilijk verstaanbaar gedrag.
Je kunt zelfstandig werken en hebt kennis van eigen taken.
Je bent in staat om te kunnen schakelen tussen de diverse niveaus ’s en problematieken van onze cliënten.
Je beschikt over goede communicatieve vaardigheden, zowel verbaal, non-verbaal als schriftelijk.
Je diensten bestaan uit dag- avond en slaapdiensten, ook in de weekenden en tijdens feestdagen.
Je bent in staat om de vraag van een cliënt om te zetten naar acties in samenwerking met collega’s.
Je bent bekend met diverse computerprogramma's.
Nog vragen of direct solliciteren?
Voor vragen over deze functie kun je contact opnemen met Marjon van Rijn (Coördinerend Begeleider) op tel. 06 – contactinformatie of met Dimphna Roelofs (Coördinerend Begeleider) op tel. 06 – contactinformatie .
Voor vragen rondom de sollicitatieprocedure kun je contact op nemen met de recruiter voor deze rol Chyniel Campbell via tel. 06 – contactinformatie .
Reageren op deze vacature kan gedurende de gehele looptijd. De eerste gesprekken vinden doorlopend plaats. Indien wij een nieuwe collega hebben gevonden sluiten wij de vacature.
Wat een leuke functie he? We verwachten deze dan ook zelf in te kunnen vullen en acquisitie is zonde van jouw en onze tijd. Hier wordt niet op gereageerd.

Title: Business Intelligence & Workforce Strategy Analyst
Description:
About The Job
TalentPop, a high-growth agency supporting over 700 E-Commerce brands globally, is searching for a
Business Intelligence & Workforce Strategy Analyst
. This strategic role sits at the nexus of BI, advanced analytics, and executive decision-making. Your mission is to build the predictive models and reporting infrastructure that drives TalentPop’s future growth, service expansion, and AI adoption strategy. You will be the organization’s primary data partner, creating the unified, accurate view of workforce performance and operational capacity that powers our executive team.
Core Responsibilities & Focus Areas
I. Predictive Modeling & Executive Strategy (The Primary Focus)
Develop predictive models for attrition, hiring demand, internal resource shortages, and growth scenarios.
Build comprehensive scenario plans for internal growth, new service expansion, seasonal hiring fluctuations, and operational shifts driven by AI adoption.
Model high-level "what-if" analyses to support executive decision-making (e.g., revenue growth, churn patterns, new vertical launches, efficiency targets).
Lead the creation and maintenance of the Monthly Business Intelligence Report summarizing strategic workforce insights, hiring performance, and departmental capacity for TalentPop's leadership team.
II. Business Intelligence & Reporting Infrastructure
Build and maintain standardized dashboards and reporting tools that serve cross-functional leadership (Recruitment, Sales, Marketing, Client Success, Executive).
Serve as a key data partner alongside our Engineering and Data Management team to define and maintain the baseline data structure and operational metrics.
Ensure data governance and integrity across all BI reporting pipelines (HubSpot, HR systems, etc.) and validate data accuracy for executive consumption.
III. Workforce & Capacity Planning
Translate executive growth strategy into actionable headcount forecasts and hiring targets.
Analyze labor capacity utilization and department efficiency to ensure alignment between strategic growth goals and internal labor capacity.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Finance, Economics, Statistics, or similar.
5+ years of experience in business intelligence, strategic analytics, and/or workforce forecasting, preferably in a BPO or high-growth service environment.
Proven experience building complex, predictive models and executing scenario planning for executive review.
Strong background in data governance and serving as a BI-to-Engineering partner for data structure and pipeline validation.
Technical Requirements
Stable DSL/Cable/Fiber internet (20 Mbps minimum + backup)
Laptop/desktop with at least Core i5/Ryzen 5 and 8GB RAM
Reliable power source and backup work location
Perks & Benefits
Competitive Compensation: Receive competitive pay with annual performance-based increases.
Time to Recharge: Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) so you can rest, travel, and recharge.
Comprehensive Wellness: We offer a choice of Health and Dental Insurance or a Health Stipend to ensure you feel your best.
Holiday Bonuses: Receive a special Holiday Bonus in appreciation of your hard work and dedication.
Fully Remote Setup: Enjoy the flexibility of a 100% remote work setup—work comfortably from anywhere.
Growth Opportunities: Access clear pathways and opportunities to grow with us as TalentPop continues to rapidly scale in the E-commerce industry.
How to Apply
Ready to Drive Strategy and Growth?
If you are an analytical powerhouse ready to leverage data to define our workforce strategy and drive efficiency for hundreds of global E-commerce brands, we want to hear from you.
TalentPop is redefining support operations, and we need your expertise to model our future.
Apply now to join our global, collaborative, and fast-growing team!

Description:
Our client is focused on creating engaging, high-quality video content designed to perform across social media platforms. They prioritize visually compelling storytelling, strong brand alignment, and performance-driven optimization to connect with audiences on Instagram, Facebook, and TikTok.
Location
Fully-Remote | 9 AM – 3 PM EST (30 hours/week)

The Video Editor will create polished, eye-catching video content for social media by editing raw footage and enhancing it with text overlays, captions, and motion graphics. This role requires a strong understanding of how to optimize videos for engagement across major social platforms.

Video Editing for Social Media
Edit short-form and long-form video content for Instagram, Facebook, and TikTok.

Fill in the application form

Title: Manager, Legal Compliance – Crypto
Description:
Our Purpose
Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we’re helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.
Title And Summary
Manager, Legal Compliance – Crypto
Job Title
Manager, Legal Compliance - Crypto, Mastercard Transaction Services (MTS)
Overview
At Mastercard, we are committed to protecting our network and solutions from being used to facilitate money laundering and terrorist financing. The Manager, Legal Compliance - Crypto, will report to the Director, Legal Compliance MTS. MTS is an enterprise asset within Mastercard’s Commercial and New Payment Flows organization that provides compliance services to both regulated and non-regulated payment flows.
Role Description
The Manager, Legal Compliance – Crypto is responsible for overseeing a team that performs day-to-day Anti-Money Laundering (AML), Sanctions, crypto onboarding due diligence compliance processes, and ongoing monitoring of Virtual Asset Service Providers (VASPs) and other parties engaged in crypto services. This role also conducts thorough investigations for crypto-related programs and customers, in alignment with regulatory requirements and industry best practices.
The manager will lead a team of compliance analysts, providing guidance, mentorship, and support to ensure high-quality due diligence and investigative work. The role requires close collaboration with internal stakeholders, including legal, risk, technology, and product teams, to maintain a strong compliance framework and adapt to the rapidly evolving crypto regulatory landscape.
Key Responsibilities
Lead, mentor, and develop a team of compliance analysts, fostering a culture of integrity, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
Set clear performance objectives, conduct regular evaluations, and provide ongoing coaching and professional development opportunities.
Allocate resources effectively to ensure timely completion of compliance tasks and investigations.
Oversee the execution of Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Sanctions compliance processes, including onboarding, enhanced due diligence, transaction monitoring, and investigations for Virtual Asset Service Providers (VASPs) and other crypto-related products and services including but not limited to:
Crypto card programs
Crypto credentials
Multi-token networks
Stablecoins
Crypto cobranded partnerships
Provide strategic input to enhance the crypto compliance framework, controls, and risk management processes.
Draft, review, and update policies and procedures to ensure alignment with evolving regulatory requirements and industry best practices.
Serve as a subject matter expert, advising internal compliance teams and business units on crypto-related risks, including on-chain and off-chain due diligence, analytics, customer onboarding, and transaction monitoring.
Respond to complex queries and provide guidance on the use of commercial and open source blockchain analytics tools.

Title: Begeleider - Otheense Kreek
Description:
Wil jij een cruciale rol spelen in het leven van bewoners met een licht verstandelijke beperking? Dan maken wij graag kennis met jou!
Hoe ziet jouw nieuwe werkplek eruit?
Welkom bij de Otheense Kreek in Amersfoort: een locatie die het thuis is van mensen met een licht verstandelijke beperking en bijkomende problematiek (LVB+). Denk hierbij aan autisme, een verslaving of psychische problemen. Elk van onze bewoners heeft een eigen appartement in één van onze zes rijtjeshuizen in de leuke, gezellige wijk Kattenbroek in Amersfoort. Daarnaast begeleiden we 8 ambulant cliënten die wij regelmatig thuis bezoeken.
De bewoners vormen een diverse en hechte groep. Elk individu is uniek en ervaart de wereld op een andere manier. Zij brengen elk hun eigen ‘plusje’ mee. Dit maakt het werken bij ons niet alleen uitdagend, maar vooral heel bijzonder. Het biedt jou de kans om door de ogen van een ander naar de wereld te kijken en samen stappen te maken tussen hen en de maatschappij.
Ons team bestaat uit coördinerend begeleiders, begeleiders, assistent begeleiders en een stagiaire. We zijn een open, hecht en eerlijk team. We spreken niet over elkaar maar met elkaar, en feedback is een essentieel onderdeel van onze samenwerking. We willen allemaal het beste uit onszelf en elkaar halen. Dit betekent ook dat we altijd voor elkaar klaar staan, betrokken zijn en heel veel lol hebben samen.
Zien wij jou snel?
Wat mag je doen?
In de rol van Begeleider LVB+ bij de Otheense Kreek speel je een cruciale rol in het leven van onze bewoners. Je biedt ondersteuning en begeleiding in hun dagelijkse routines en hebt een centrale rol in hun weg naar (meer) zelfstandigheid. Je werk vereist een intensieve samenwerking met een team van collega’s, de bewoners zelf, hun familieleden en andere professionals in de zorg. Samen zorgen jullie ervoor dat elk individu de ondersteuning krijgt die nodig is.
Het is een bijzondere ervaring om bij te dragen aan de ontwikkeling van onze bewoners. Je herstelt vertrouwen, bouwt een band op en viert grote en kleine successen. Of het nu gaat om een bewoner met autisme die hulp nodig heeft bij het maken van contact met nieuwe mensen, of iemand met borderline die stappen wil maken naar een nieuwe baan: elke vooruitgang is een overwinning.
Ook werk je met ambulante cliënten. Zij zijn vaak terughoudend in het zoeken van zorg en je hebt minder zicht op hun dagelijks leven. Dit leidt tot andere uitdagingen en vereist geduld en effectieve communicatie. Kortom, werken met deze doelgroep is uniek en uitdagend. Maar bovenal brengt het veel voldoening en plezier met zich mee wanneer je samen voor positieve verandering zorgt. Een mooie uitdaging voor jou!
Hoe waarderen wij jou?
Afhankelijk van je opleiding en werkervaring kom je in dienst als:
Assistent Begeleider met een salaris van min. €2.546,00 en max. €3.564,00 (FWG 35) bij een 36-urige werkweek volgens de CAO Gehandicaptenzorg.
Begeleider met een salaris van min. €2.727,00 en max. €3.678,00 (FWG 40) bij een 36-urige werkweek volgens de CAO Gehandicaptenzorg.
Een contract voor onbepaalde tijd met een proeftijd van twee maanden voor 24-32 uur per week.
We stimuleren groei binnen Eemhart, daarom bieden we ruime opleidings- en ontwikkelmogelijkheden, passend bij jou.
Standplaats is Amersfoort.
Arbeidsextra’s die wij bieden bovenop het in de vacature genoemde salaris:
Eemhart heeft een eigen online Leerplein waar je volop gratis kunt bijscholen voor competenties die bij jouw functie horen.
Er is een vakantietoeslag van 8,0% en een eindejaarsuitkering van 8,33%.
Naast het wettelijk geregelde vakantieverlof (144 uur naar rato van je dienstverband) ontvang je een extra verlof budget (PBL-uren) van 57 uur (bij een fulltime werkweek).
Eemhart maakt ook gebruik van de faciliteiten via FiscFree: fiscale korting bij aanschaf van bijvoorbeeld een smartphone, laptop en/of elektrische fiets, Bol.com, Coolblue of weekendje weg bon, sportabonnement.
Wat breng je mee?
Je hebt een relevante afgeronde mbo-opleiding (op minimaal niveau 3), bijvoorbeeld:
Maatschappelijke Zorg
Pedagogisch Medewerker
Sociaal Werk
Je bent geduldig en kijkt met een open blik
Je kijkt verder dan zichtbaar gedrag en je eigen aannames
Je benadert bewoners zonder oordeel
Je neemt tijd om hen te begrijpen en een band op te bouwen
Je hebt humor en kunt dingen relativeren
Je bent betrouwbaar en doet wat jij belooft
Wij werken in een
onregelmatig dienstenpatroon
. Dat betekent dat jij bereid bent om
dag-, avond- en slaapdiensten
te werken.
Nog vragen of direct solliciteren?
Heb je vragen over de functie? Monique Ramakers (Coördinerend Begeleider) bereikbaar via contactinformatie , beantwoord jouw vragen graag. Krijg je een andere collega aan de telefoon? Deze kan jouw vragen vast ook beantwoorden!
Heb je vragen over de sollicitatieprocedure? Neem dan contact op met Chyniel Campbell, Corporate Recruiter, bereikbaar via 06 – contactinformatie . Zij beantwoordt deze graag!
Reageren op deze vacature kan gedurende de gehele looptijd. Wanneer wij een geschikte collega hebben gevonden dan sluiten wij de vacature. Wacht dus niet te lang en reageer direct!
Wat een leuke functie he? We verwachten deze dan ook zelf in te kunnen vullen en acquisitie is zonde van jouw en onze tijd. Hier wordt niet op gereageerd.

Title: Business Intelligence & Workforce Strategy Analyst
Description:
About The Job
TalentPop, a high-growth agency supporting over 700 E-Commerce brands globally, is searching for a
Business Intelligence & Workforce Strategy Analyst
. This strategic role sits at the nexus of BI, advanced analytics, and executive decision-making. Your mission is to build the predictive models and reporting infrastructure that drives TalentPop’s future growth, service expansion, and AI adoption strategy. You will be the organization’s primary data partner, creating the unified, accurate view of workforce performance and operational capacity that powers our executive team.
Core Responsibilities & Focus Areas
I. Predictive Modeling & Executive Strategy (The Primary Focus)
Develop predictive models for attrition, hiring demand, internal resource shortages, and growth scenarios.
Build comprehensive scenario plans for internal growth, new service expansion, seasonal hiring fluctuations, and operational shifts driven by AI adoption.
Model high-level "what-if" analyses to support executive decision-making (e.g., revenue growth, churn patterns, new vertical launches, efficiency targets).
Lead the creation and maintenance of the Monthly Business Intelligence Report summarizing strategic workforce insights, hiring performance, and departmental capacity for TalentPop's leadership team.
II. Business Intelligence & Reporting Infrastructure
Build and maintain standardized dashboards and reporting tools that serve cross-functional leadership (Recruitment, Sales, Marketing, Client Success, Executive).
Serve as a key data partner alongside our Engineering and Data Management team to define and maintain the baseline data structure and operational metrics.
Ensure data governance and integrity across all BI reporting pipelines (HubSpot, HR systems, etc.) and validate data accuracy for executive consumption.
III. Workforce & Capacity Planning
Translate executive growth strategy into actionable headcount forecasts and hiring targets.
Analyze labor capacity utilization and department efficiency to ensure alignment between strategic growth goals and internal labor capacity.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Finance, Economics, Statistics, or similar.
5+ years of experience in business intelligence, strategic analytics, and/or workforce forecasting, preferably in a BPO or high-growth service environment.
Proven experience building complex, predictive models and executing scenario planning for executive review.
Strong background in data governance and serving as a BI-to-Engineering partner for data structure and pipeline validation.
Technical Requirements
Stable DSL/Cable/Fiber internet (20 Mbps minimum + backup)
Laptop/desktop with at least Core i5/Ryzen 5 and 8GB RAM
Reliable power source and backup work location
Perks & Benefits
Competitive Compensation: Receive competitive pay with annual performance-based increases.
Time to Recharge: Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) so you can rest, travel, and recharge.
Comprehensive Wellness: We offer a choice of Health and Dental Insurance or a Health Stipend to ensure you feel your best.
Holiday Bonuses: Receive a special Holiday Bonus in appreciation of your hard work and dedication.
Fully Remote Setup: Enjoy the flexibility of a 100% remote work setup—work comfortably from anywhere.
Growth Opportunities: Access clear pathways and opportunities to grow with us as TalentPop continues to rapidly scale in the E-commerce industry.
How to Apply
Ready to Drive Strategy and Growth?
If you are an analytical powerhouse ready to leverage data to define our workforce strategy and drive efficiency for hundreds of global E-commerce brands, we want to hear from you.
TalentPop is redefining support operations, and we need your expertise to model our future.
Apply now to join our global, collaborative, and fast-growing team!

Title: Marketing Specialist
Description:

Hi, I’m Noel, founder of
JobRack
.

Here’s a quick video from me explaining the role and what success looks like:

Our Core Values:
Clarity
Focused speed
Positivity and professionalism
Constant improvement
Wowing our clients every time
We’re helpful and friendly.
This is not just a tagline. It’s how we work with each other, our clients and candidates, and even the people we don’t end up working with.
About The Role
We’re looking for a hands-on, performance-focused, build-it-and-make-it-convert Marketing Manager/specialist. You will own the marketing funnel and work directly with the founder to plan strategy, then execute rapidly, independently, and effectively. Speed and action are highly valued.
